episodes.summary: The FFIEC Authentication Guidance has resulted in a cottage industry of anomaly detection solutions. But look carefully before you buy - separate myth from reality - says Terry Austin, CEO of Guardian Analytics.

episodes.title: 7 Steps to Secure Mobile Devices
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Elayne Starkey recently gave up her BlackBerry for an iPhone, and uses the Apple mobile device for personal and work doings, securely connecting to the computer system of her employer, the state of Delaware.

episodes.title: Business Continuity: What We're Missing
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: From the earthquake in Japan to Hurricane Irene in the U.S., organizations worldwide have found their business continuity and disaster plans tested. But what lessons must we draw from these incidents?

episodes.title: Cloud Computing: Compliance Challenges
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Too many organizations overlook regulatory compliance issues when working with cloud computing vendors, says security expert Alastair MacWillson.

episodes.title: Barriers Stunting Cloud Adoption
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Alastair MacWillson says the lack of harmonization among state, national and international security laws and regulations has proved challenging for global organizations that want to work in the cloud.

episodes.title: Risk Awareness: What Do CEOs Need to Know?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: If management awareness of information security issues increases, will an organization's commitment to securing practices and policies also increase? This is the question answered by an eye-opening new study.

episodes.title: The App Sec Pro and the Shark
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When Mano Paul of (ISC)2 discusses today's top application security challenges, he draws an analogy with sharks. And what he views as the skills needed to tackle today's top threats might surprise you.

episodes.title: FFIEC Authentication Guidance: Preparing for 2012
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Banking institutions are focused on preparing for 2012 and their first examinations on conformance with the FFIEC Authentication Guidance. But beyond the exams, what are the fraud trends they need to prepare to face?

episodes.title: The Changing Value of the PIN Debit Network
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The Durbin Amendment to the Dodd-Frank Act brought enormous change to the payments industry. But within this change comes a whole new value proposition for the PIN debit network - and for institutions' efforts to fight fraud.

episodes.title: BlackBerry Episode Strikes at IT Security Tenet
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Winn Schwartau says the BlackBerry disruption this past week (see BlackBerry Disruptions: Where to Start?) hit at the heart of one of the fundamentals of IT security: availability.

episodes.title: How Audits Can Increase Infosec Budgets
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Mike Brown and Amry Junaideen see audits as great tools to promote heftier IT security budgets, substantiating where dollars should be spent to safeguard an organization's information systems and assets.

episodes.title: Breach Legislation: The Next Generation
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: It's a new wave of cybercriminal behind the latest major data breaches, says breach expert Lucy Thomson. And these incidents are resulting in a new generation of breach notification laws globally.

episodes.title: Mobile Device Management
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Roger Baker, CIO at the VA, says desktop computers will eventually phase out, as mobile devices become predominant channels for communication and work. That evolution has made plans for ongoing mobile security a priority for organizations that cross every business sector.

episodes.title: Steps to Stop Skimming
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Gray Taylor of NACS says retailers spend billions every year to fix a broken payments system. And the primary culprit is the lingering mag-stripe.

episodes.title: Authentication: One Solution Won't Fit All
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: How much crossover should banking institutions rely upon as they evaluate authentication standards for retail vs. commercial accounts? Online security expert Christopher Beier offers insights.

episodes.title: EMV: It's About Reducing Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Pradeep Moudgal of California-based SVB says the bank's decision in June to migrate commercial credit cards over to EMV was easy. "The biggest advantage of the chip card, at the end of the day, is to reduce fraud," he says.

episodes.title: Fighting Fraud: Banks, Merchants Must Align
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The only way to improve card security is for banks and merchants to align their strategies, says Gray Taylor of NACS. "This is something that hurts both of our industries. Fraud hurts us all."

episodes.title: ID Theft: How to Help Consumers
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: ID theft expert Joanna Crane wonders whether banks, government agencies and healthcare providers do enough to assist consumers with ID theft recovery, saying consumer expectations are often loftier than what's being done to meet the demand.

episodes.title: Social Networks Revolutionize Payments
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: "It is clear that Internet technology represents the moment of a change equivalent to the change brought on by the printing press and the steam machine," says Kosta Peric of SWIFT.

episodes.title: Cyber Intel Employs Risk Approach
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Harry Raduege sees the nascent field of cyber intelligence as a way for governments and businesses to be proactive, and not reactive, to today's sophisticated digital threats.

episodes.title: Web Apps: The Top Vulnerabilities
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: ISACA has just released a new study about the top vulnerabilities of Web applications. And, according to Sarb Sembhi, the results of this survey just might surprise you.

episodes.title: Emerging Payments Redefine Value
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In the near future, financial institutions will have new opportunities for service in emerging payments. How they define their roles, however, will depend greatly on steps they take now to put a stake in the ground.

episodes.title: Community Service: How to Give Back
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Giving back to the community. It's a civic responsibility, says Dan Waddell of Tantus Technologies. But it's also a necessity to help raise cyber awareness. Waddell explains how security pros can give back.

episodes.title: Tablet: A 'Game Changer' for Mobile Banking
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Javelin's Mary Monahan says the mobile tablet will revolutionize banking and payments.

episodes.title: BofA on Mobile Risk and Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Bank of America's Keith Gordon says securing the mobile channel is much like securing any other banking channel: Controlling risks requires layers of security and controls. But educating customers plays a key security function, too.

episodes.title: BYOD and Corporate Policy
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Unfortunately, says Ken Vander Wal, most organizations have done little to address security in their policies and procedures regarding BYOD, which is changing the ways companies address user behavior and risk.

episodes.title: Fighting Fraud: 5 Key Concerns
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Alisdair Faulkner of ThreatMetrix says financial institutions and businesses should focus on five key security areas. What make up the top five, and where do banks need to make the greatest fraud-prevention investments?

episodes.title: Breach Notification Priority for 2012
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: BITS president Paul Smocer says banks can expect an uptick in cybersecurity-focused legislation in 2012. What impact will changes from Capitol Hill have on requirements for data breach notification, information sharing and critical infrastructure?

episodes.title: Identifying Infosec Jobs, Skills, Tasks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: NICE's Ernest McDuffie says a proposed cybersecurity workforce framework represents a consensus of government thought on how best to define the jobs, skills and tasks needed to secure information technology.

episodes.title: Risk Management's Challenges
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When bankers contemplate risk, says Edward DeMarco Jr. of the Risk Management Association, what dominates headlines in the financial press should be of paramount concern.

episodes.title: Influencing Policy, If Not the Law
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Jacob Olcott says Congress' failure to enact comprehensive cybersecurity legislation over the past half decade doesn't mean lawmakers haven't influenced IT security policy.

episodes.title: Fraud Victim: FFIEC Guidance Lacking
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: ACH fraud victim Mark Patterson says small businesses like his welcome improved online security measures from banking institutions. But is the new FFIEC Authentication Guidance sufficient? Patterson says no.

episodes.title: IP Protection Bills Threaten Internet
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The Brooking Institute's Allan Friedman says bills before Congress aimed at protecting intellectual property threaten cybersecurity.

episodes.title: The State of Security Education
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Information security threats - especially to critical infrastructures and from nation-states - are evolving. But security education curricula are struggling to keep pace, according to Eugene Spafford, renowned information security professor at Purdue University.

episodes.title: Organizing a Breach Notification Team
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: It's one thing to have a data breach response team. It's quite another to ensure that team is made up of savvy personnel, says Brian Dean, a former privacy executive for KeyBank.

episodes.title: Breach Response: Reputational Risk
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Data breaches are all about reputational risk, says attorney Lisa Sotto. And as legal requirements grow, attorneys must play increasingly integral roles in helping clients respond to incidents.

episodes.title: Pace Charters New Cyber Institute
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: New York's Pace University has just announced its new Seidenberg Cyber Security Institute. What is the school's mission, and why is now the ideal time to open its doors to career-minded students?

episodes.title: Fighting Fraud: Deputize the Consumer
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Customers want to be involved with their banking security, but few institutions allow them to play active roles in fraud prevention. What has to change?

episodes.title: BITS Takes Aim at Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: BITS, the technology policy division of The Financial Services Roundtable, has just named a new VP of cybersecurity and fraud prevention. What's John Carlson's mission, and what's it mean to banks?

episodes.title: FFIEC Compliance: A Case Study
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Donna Flynn says Liberty Bank discovered three key gaps when it tackled FFIEC authentication guidance compliance. Two were easy to fill. The third required an out-of-the-box solution.

episodes.title: Disaster Recovery: Supply Chain at Risk
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Every organization likes its business continuity/disaster recovery plan before a disaster, says Al Berman of DRI International. But in the aftermath? Different story - and one that must be addressed in 2012.

episodes.title: FFIEC Compliance Report Card
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A new survey finds that 56% of U.S. banking institutions have conducted risk assessments, but 87% have deployed layered security controls. Are banks ready to conform with the FFIEC Authentication Guidance?

episodes.title: Why Compliance Can't Create Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Regulators push tougher cybersecurity measures. But the challenge for smaller organizations isn't compliance - it's budgets.  Wendy Nather of 451 Research defines the 'Security Poverty Line' and what to do about it.

episodes.title: Hannaford Breach Ruling: What it Means
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A federal appeals court has ruled in favor of victims of the 2007 Hannaford data breach. Attorney Ronald Raether explains the ruling and what it potentially means to future breached entities and their customers.

episodes.title: 2012 Fraud-Fighting Agenda
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Fraud threats have changed little in the past decade. But their global scale has, and James Ratley, president of the ACFE, details how fraud examiners must change their approach to fighting these crimes in 2012.

episodes.title: Top 10 Cybersecurity Trends for Banks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A new survey identifies the Top 10 Cybersecurity Trends for financial service organizations. Malware and mobility head the list of risks to watch. What are the other key concerns?

episodes.title: Complexity Is Major Info Risk Challenge
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Complexity is among the most significant information risk management challenges organizations face at the dawn of the new year.

episodes.title: Automation with a Dash of Humanity
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As organizations move to the continuous monitoring of their IT systems to assure they're secure, they rely much more on automated processes. But don't forget the role people play.

episodes.title: BYOD: Manage the Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: It's not a question of if employees will bring their own mobile devices to work and connect to your systems. It's a matter of when. But the benefits of BYOD outweigh the risks, says Malcolm Harkins, CISO of Intel.

episodes.title: Top Tech Trends for 2012
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Big data. Consumerization. Mobile growth. ISACA picks these as the top technology trends for IT and information security leaders to tackle in 2012. Robert Stroud offers tips to help manage the risks.

episodes.title: Why Insource Forensics?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When it's time to stand up in court and discuss forensic evidence in a legal matter, you need someone who knows your business best, says Greg Thompson, VP enterprise security services at Scotiabank Group.

episodes.title: Privacy Laws: 'Find the Commonalities'
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Global organizations easily can be confused by the myriad privacy laws in different regions of the world. But U.S. privacy attorney Miriam Wugmeister has advice to help navigate these tricky waters.

episodes.title: Tips for Encrypting Mobile Devices
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: To help prevent breaches, mobile devices should be encrypted even if storage of sensitive information on them is prohibited, says security expert Melodi Mosley Gates.

episodes.title: Holistic Planning for Breach Response
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A breach is a disaster, says business continuity specialist Ken Schroeder. So organizing an effective breach-response team does not require a reinvention of the wheel. What it does require is a holistic approach.

episodes.title: No Gambling on Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When your site processes more transactions annually than the London Stock Exchange, you'd better care deeply about breach prevention, says Ionut Ionescu, Head of Threat Management at Betfair.

episodes.title: Top 10 Screening Trends
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Criminal background checks for prospective employees - smart move, or discriminatory practice? Attorney Lester Rosen answers this question and details 2012's top 10 trends in background checks.

episodes.title: How to Identify the Insider Threat
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Security managers need the heads up from non-IT executives before they dismiss employees, some of whom might seek payback for their sacking by pilfering data or sabotaging systems, Carnegie Mellon University's Dawn Cappelli and Mike Hanley say.

episodes.title: Zappos Breach Notice: Lessons Learned
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Zappos was quick to communicate after discovering a data breach impacting 24 million customers. But did the online retailer respond appropriately, or make some missteps in its haste to notify? Francoise Gilbert of the IT Law Group gives a mixed review.

episodes.title: Elements of a Social Media Policy
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: You know your company's social media policy is a good one when it starts sounding less like a checklist and more like common sense, says Sherrie Madia, social media expert and author.

episodes.title: Zappos Breach Highlights Storage Issue
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The recent breach that affected 24 million customers of Internet retailer Zappos.com should lead others to consider how much client information to store, says cybersecurity expert Fred H. Cate.

episodes.title: Visa on EMV in the U.S.
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The Europay, MasterCard, Visa standard, commonly used in most global markets, is coming to the U.S. The sooner issuers, acquirers and merchants initiate migrations, the better, says Stephanie Ericksen, head of authentication product integration at Visa.

episodes.title: Are Anti-Piracy Laws Really Needed?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Does the U.S. government's shuttering of the file-sharing website Megaupload.com show that new laws are not needed to battle intellectual property piracy? Brookings's Allan Friedman believes it does.

episodes.title: How Fraud Prevention Starts with E-mail
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Online security starts with e-mail monitoring. BITS and FS-ISAC have partnered to launch a new registry service that aims to thwart phishing attacks.

episodes.title: Why Debit Fraud Grows
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Losses linked to debit fraud now exceed losses connected to check fraud, according to a new survey by the American Bankers Association. How are banks responding to the threat?

episodes.title: FFIEC Compliance: Tips for the First Exam
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Risk assessments are over. Now it's time for institutions to prove they conform to the FFIEC's Authentication Guidance. Fraud expert George Tubin offers tips to prepare for the first regulatory exam.

episodes.title: After a Breach: 3 Lessons
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Organizations that have experienced a breach report that three lessons they learned were to limit the amount of personal information collected, limit sharing data with third parties and limit the amount of data stored, a new survey shows.

episodes.title: Cybersecurity and Patents: What You Need to Know
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What does a U.S. patent protect, and why should security leaders care? Attorney James Denaro details the risks and the questions you need to ask about the cybersecurity technologies you use.

episodes.title: Privacy Officer in the Hot Seat
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When Google amended its policy, suddenly everyone was talking about privacy. How do privacy officers turn these discussions to their advantage? Kirk Herath of Nationwide Insurance has some ideas.

episodes.title: PCI: New Focus on Mobile
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Mike Mitchell, new chair of the Payment Card Industry Security Standards Council, says mobility is among his top priorities for action in 2012. How will emerging technologies influence the standard?

episodes.title: Fraud Fight: How to Pick Your Battles
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: From mobile malware to the Anonymous hacktivist attacks, how can banking institutions tackle the changing threat landscape? Joe Rogalski of First Niagara Bank has some new ideas.

episodes.title: FDIC Explains Processing Guidance
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Why must financial institutions pay more attention to risks posed by third-party payments processors? FDIC executive Michael Benardo explains the updated guidance in an exclusive interview.

episodes.title: Fraud: The Latest Threats
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What are the top emerging fraud threats to banking institutions via mobile banking, and how must security leaders respond? Julie McNelley of the Aite Group offers tips for fighting the newest threats.

episodes.title: Patrick Bedwell
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Patrick discusses how to consolidate network traffic monitoring into a single appliance and management console, along with web application security and PCI compliance.

episodes.title: Brent Williams
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Brent discusses deploying multi-factor authentication to mega-enterprises with millions of end-users, knowledge-based authentication user enrollment, and how educational institutions are utilizing multi-factor authentication solutions.

episodes.title: NIST to Unveil Controls Guidance at RSA
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: NIST's Ron Ross will be quite busy at RSA Conference 2012, not only promoting revised guidance on security and privacy controls to be unveiled at the securing conclave, but also participating in a panel on one of his favorite topics: continuous monitoring.

episodes.title: Lax Breach Laws Endanger Businesses
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Data breaches are under-reported, and breached organizations aren't giving consumers the information they need about these compromises, says Karen Barney of the Identity Theft Resource Center.

episodes.title: The CISO Challenge
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Jason Clark, CSO of Websense, has met recently with 400 CSOs. In a pre-RSA Conference interview, he discusses how security leaders can be more effective when facing mobile security and other challenges.

episodes.title: Putting to Rest RSA Key Security Worries
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: IT security practitioners who employ the RSA public-private key cryptography needn't lose sleep about its efficacy, despite new research that raises questions on how it creates large prime numbers to generate secret keys, IT security authority Gene Spafford says.

episodes.title: The Book on Insider Threats
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The insider threat: It's a top challenge for any organization, and it's a hot topic for RSA Conference attendees. Dawn Cappelli and Randy Trzeciak preview their new book, The CERT Guide to Insider Threats.

episodes.title: Mobile Security: Enabling BYOD
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Mobile security is a new discussion track at RSA Conference, but it's long been a hot topic for CISOs. Entrust's Dave Rockvam discusses BYOD and how organizations are securing personally-owned devices.

episodes.title: What to Expect at RSA Conference
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: This is the first RSA Conference since 2011's high-profile security breaches. How did those incidents influence this year's agenda? Hugh Thompson explains in an exclusive event preview.

episodes.title: Privacy Bill of Rights: Not Be-All, End-All
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The Obama administration's Consumer Privacy Bill of Rights should be seen as a vital document to help shape an expansive and globally accepted privacy framework in the United States, privacy and data security lawyer Lisa Sotto says.

episodes.title: Scholarship for Service Program Grows
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The need for qualified security pros is growing - but so is the Scholarship for Service Program, which helps students train for roles in government. Victor Piotrowski of the National Science Foundation discusses the opportunities.

episodes.title: How Organized Crime Uses Banks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The U.S. Treasury is asking banking institutions to play a more active role in the fight against organized crime. Fraud experts at Ernst & Young share what the Treasury's new demands mean for future investments banks have to make.

episodes.title: Cyber Attacks: Not If or When, But Now
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: No one - not even a security vendor - is immune to cyber attacks. "It's not a question of if or when companies will face an attack, but how they're going to defend against it," says Symantec's Francis deSouza.

episodes.title: iPad3 4G Nudges BYOD
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Apple's release of the new iPad will affect business. How should organizations incorporate new mobile concerns into their BYOD policies?  Joe Rogalski of New York's First Niagara Bank weighs in.

episodes.title: A Framework for Vulnerability Reports
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A consortium of eight major information technology companies is continuing development of a free framework designed to make it easier to exchange information about security vulnerabilities.

episodes.title: Breaches: The Top Trends
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What are the top global breach trends and threats that organizations should be watching? Wade Baker of Verizon offers insights gleaned from a new study of his group's latest investigations.

episodes.title: Schmidt Hopeful on Bill's Passage
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: White House Cybersecurity Coordinator Howard Schmidt, in an exclusive interview, expresses optimism that Congress could enact significant cybersecurity legislation this year even if President Obama doesn't get all that he wants in an IT security bill.

episodes.title: Deferring to Business on Cybersecurity
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Commerce Undersecretary for Standards and Technology Patrick Gallagher sees the private sector, not government, taking the lead to develop tools, processes and standards to help safeguard IT systems and data in and out of government.

episodes.title: Dissecting a Hacktivist Attack
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Imperva would neither confirm nor deny it helped defend the Vatican website from a hacktivist assault last year, but the IT security provider's director of security, Rob Rachwald, explains how such an attack was constructed and defended.

episodes.title: Targeting Mobile Banking Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What emerging security challenges will new mobile devices and platforms pose for banks and credit unions? Brian Pearce and Amy Johnson shed light on Wells Fargo's approach to unique retail and commercial risks.

episodes.title: How New iPad Can Be Blast from the Past
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Apple's introduction of its third iteration of the iPad e-tablet, coupled with the growing popularity of cloud computing, could lead to new methods of enterprise computing and IT security, Delaware Chief Security Officer Elayne Starkey says.

episodes.title: BITS Tackles Bank Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: BITS, the technology division of the Financial Services Roundtable, has tapped Diane Ness to lead its fraud-reduction program. What void does this new leader fill, and how will she help banks fight fraud?

episodes.title: Avoiding Pitfalls of the Cloud Contract
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cloud-computing service provider contracts, for most businesses and government customers, are take-it-or-leave it propositions, so organizations must approach a services agreement cautiously, IT security lawyer FranÃ§oise Gilbert says.

episodes.title: Redefining IT Security's Core Tenets
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Protecting the availability, confidentiality and integrity of information are the core tenets of IT security. But an FBI cybersecurity leader, Steve Chabinsky, suggests the central theme of IT security needs to be broadened to include assurance and attribution.

episodes.title: New Defense Fights Bank Robbery
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Bank robberies are old-world crimes, but they are still devastating to institutions and their communities. How is the FBI now working with banks to change how they respond to these violent crimes?

episodes.title: Verizon: Hacktivists #1 Breach Threat
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Verizon's 2012 Data Breach Investigations Report shows dramatic increases in attacks linked to hacktivist groups like Anonymous and LulzSec. How should organizations respond to this evolving threat?

episodes.title: The Cost of a Data Breach
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The average per capita cost of a data breach has declined from $214 to $194, according to the new Cost of a Data Breach study. But there are still plenty of causes for concern, says Dr. Larry Ponemon.

episodes.title: Inside Microsoft's Zeus Malware Raid
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: "Many financial institutions have watched for years as cybercrime has escalated, and now we are shutting it down," says Greg Garcia, describing Operation B71 and how it's helping combat ACH/wire and other forms of fraud.

episodes.title: Who Decides How to Allot Infosec Funds?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As enterprises spend frugally on IT security, cybercriminals aren't, and that presents big problems for organizations working feverishly to secure their digital assets, says Steve Durbin, global vice president of the Information Security Forum.

episodes.title: Security Education for Senior Execs
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Where do time-strapped senior leaders go for education on cyber forensics and incident response? Carnegie Mellon University has a new option, and Dena Haritos Tsamitis explains its unique approach.

episodes.title: Heartland CEO on Breach Response
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: From 2010: When he first learned of the full magnitude of the Heartland Payment Systems data breach, Heartland CEO Bob Carr had one overriding thought: "Can we survive this?"

episodes.title: Global Payments Breach: What to Tell Customers
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In the wake of the Global Payments Inc. card breach, ID theft expert Neal O'Farrell says banks and credit unions must be proactive with outreach to customers. What should institutions' messages include?

episodes.title: Assuring the Security of IPv6
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: IPv6, known to some as the new Internet, is architected to be safer than IPv4, but that doesn't mean organizations shouldn't take steps to assure the security in Internet Protocol version 6, American Registry for Internet Numbers' John Curran says.

episodes.title: Risk of Insider Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Many organizations realize they are at risk of insider attacks. But do they have evidence and capabilities to respond to these risks? That's the real challenge, says researcher Larry Ponemon.

episodes.title: Gartner's Litan on Global Payments Breach
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Gartner Analyst Avivah Litan, one of the first fraud experts to report the Global Payments Inc. data breach, says the latest revelations raise more questions than answers about the incident's impact.

episodes.title: Investigating a Payments Breach
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What might the Global Payments breach investigation entail? Dave Ostertag of Verizon's Investigative Response unit describes a forensics investigation - how long it can take and what it might reveal.

episodes.title: Phishing: New and Improved
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Phishing - it's the classic scheme that never goes away. In fact, it evolves. Amy Blackshaw of RSA offers insights on how to respond to this and other trends identified in the 2012 Faces of Fraud survey.

episodes.title: 2012 Faces of Fraud: First Look
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: "Regulation drives spending," says George Tubin of GT Advisors. "You're in a situation where the regulators are telling you, 'You have to do something; you have to make improvements.' Therefore, the bank has to spend some money on technology."

episodes.title: Privacy: Changing a Corporate Culture
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Creating a "culture of compliance" that emphasizes the importance of privacy requires far more than "management by committee," says change management specialist Jan Hillier.

episodes.title: Incident Response: The Gaps
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: To respond to a security incident, an organization must first be aware of it. But too many intrusions go undetected, says Rob Lee of SANS Institute. That's the first problem that needs to be addressed.

episodes.title: FFIEC: What's Reasonable Security?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Banks and credit unions are making investments to prevent ACH/wire fraud. But are they investing in the right solutions? Attorney Joseph Burton says the focus must be on 'reasonable' security.

episodes.title: Heartland CEO on Breach Response
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What's the best strategy for communications after a data breach, like the one suffered by Global Payments Inc.? Bob Carr, CEO of Heartland Payment Systems, discusses what to say in the weeks following a breach.

episodes.title: Fraud Fighting: How to Engage the Customer
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When it comes to fighting financial fraud, Peter Tapling of Authentify says banking institutions are chronically underestimating and under-utilizing one key resource: Their own customers.

episodes.title: How to Prioritize FFIEC Fraud Investments
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When it comes to the FFIEC Authentication Guidance, Aite analyst Shirley Inscoe fears too many banking institutions are investing only in achieving compliance - not ongoing security.

episodes.title: Global Hackers Take Aim at U.S. Banks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Banks and the U.S. payments infrastructure are prime targets for international cyberattacks. And it's not just money hackers are after, says Bill Wansley of Booz Allen Hamilton. What else is at risk?

episodes.title: Post-Breach PR: Lessons Learned
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: One of the biggest mistakes companies make after a major data breach is communicating with the news media, consumers and others before all the facts are clear, says attorney Ronald Raether.

episodes.title: FFIEC: How Well Do Banks Conform?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: How well do banks conform to the FFIEC's updated Authentication Guidance? Gartner analyst Avivah Litan says most have made progress, but they still struggle with the details.

episodes.title: The Anti-Fraud Evolution
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When Joseph Bognanno of Wolters Kluwer Financial Services examines 2012's financial fraud trends, all he sees is more - more of everything, from schemes to new guidance. How can banks stay ahead?

episodes.title: 6 Steps to Secure Big Data
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Securing the massive amounts of data swamping organizations, a trend known as big data, can be addressed, in part, by organizations simply getting rid of data no longer needed, Grant Thornton's Danny Miller says.

episodes.title: Fighting Fraud: The Bank's Perspective
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Banking institutions expect significant increases in fraud-fighting resources in 2012. But in which solutions should they invest? Banking CTO Michael Wyffels has some prioritized suggestions.

episodes.title: Identifying Undetected Breaches
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Eighty-five percent of data breaches go undetected, but organizations have a new type of cop on the beat to ferret out these illicit activities - the data scientist, says Phil Neray, head of security intelligence strategy and marketing for Q1 Labs, an IBM company.

episodes.title: How Mobile Can Aid Fraud Prevention
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Few banking institutions see mobile as a means to address security and fraud-prevention. Javelin's Jim Van Dyke tells how institutions - and their customers - can enhance security via mobile.

episodes.title: New BC Standard: 'An End to Uncertainty'
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Lyndon Bird, technical director of the Business Continuity Institute, praises the ISO 22301 standard for business continuity, calling it "An end to uncertainty." Learn about the emerging standard.

episodes.title: Prospects Iffy for Cybersecurity Bills
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As the  House prepares to vote on a slew of cybersecurity bills, James Lewis of the Center for Strategic and International Studies provides the skinny on the measures and their chances of passage.

episodes.title: The Hidden Costs of Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Dollars lost of fraud are one measure of an incident's impact. But the "soft" costs - loss of reputation and productivity - are the ones that most get the attention of Terry Austin of Guardian Analytics.

episodes.title: Teaming Up to Fight ACH Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When it comes to curbing ACH fraud, banking regulators and law enforcement agencies have joined forces to keep institutions abreast of emerging best-practices. What are their top recommendations?

episodes.title: 'It's a War for Talent'
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The information security profession is a 'war for talent' today, says recruiter Kathy Lavinder. But to win the war requires specialized skill sets. Here are today's top requirements.

episodes.title: Social Engineering: The Next Generation
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Which Internet security threats pose the greatest risks to organizations in 2012 and beyond? Symantec has just released its Internet Security Threat Report, which reveals some surprising trends.

episodes.title: Key Characteristics of Influential CISOs
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A new IBM study identifies three distinct types of information security leaders: Influencers, Protectors and Responders. Which type are you? IBM's Marc van Zadelhoff offers tips for more effective leadership.

episodes.title: Mobile Banking: Mitigating Consumer Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Which security concerns should institutions be bracing for, as more consumers adopt mobile banking? BITS offers a collection of recommendations from some of the industry's top institutions.

episodes.title: How to Spot a Fraudster
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Who is more likely to commit fraud in your organization - the newly-hired youngster or the long-tenured veteran? The ACFE's new 2012 Global Fraud Study profiles the top fraudsters and their schemes.

episodes.title: Americans Less Jittery About Net Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Americans express a bit less anxiety about their security than they felt a year ago, perhaps because they've become desensitized by extensive news reports about cyberattacks last spring, says Unisys' Steve Vinsik.

episodes.title: Improving Breach Investigations
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When breaches occur, most organizations struggle to collect the right data and get investigations off the ground. How can breach response improve? Verizon's Chris Novak offers expert advice.

episodes.title: Risks of False Credentials
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: How common are padded resumes like the one that led to the departure of Yahoo CEO Scott Thompson? Far too common, says attorney Les Rosen, who offers tips to help organizations manage such risks.

episodes.title: Matching Personalities to Jobs
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Do you have the right personality type to flourish in an IT security role? Laurence Shatkin, author of "50 Best Jobs for Your Personality," offers tips for finding the job that truly fits your type.

episodes.title: Understanding 'Big Data'
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Banks have a lot of data, but how well is it integrated? How much are institutions gleaning from the data they house? State Street Corp's chief scientist says financial services could be doing more.

episodes.title: 4 Security Priorities for Banks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: From mobile and the cloud to DDoS attacks and risks surrounding big data, what should banks and credit unions do now to mitigate exposure? Gartner's Anton Chuvakin offers his top recommendations.

episodes.title: Employing Cybersecurity Index as a Metric
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: IT security practitioners realize much value from the monthly cybersecurity index created a year ago by Mukul Pareek and Dan Geer. Why? They benefit from knowing how others see the evolving threat environment.

episodes.title: How to Respond to Hacktivism
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Hacktivist attacks will increase, and researcher Gregory Nowak says organizations can take proactive steps to reduce exposure and protect brand reputation. Why, then, are many organizations failing?

episodes.title: Why Boards of Directors Don't Get It
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: IT risk management, cyber insurance, privacy - these are hot topics for security leaders, but not for their boards of directors. Why do senior executives still fail to see IT risks as business risks?

episodes.title: Understanding Electronically Stored Info
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: For years, David Matthews, Deputy CISO of the City of Seattle, has been immersed in securing electronically stored information. Now he's written the book on the topic. What are the key themes addressed?

episodes.title: Five Application Security Tips
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Many organizations aren't devoting enough resources to ensure that applications for mobile devices are secure, says security expert Jeff Williams. He offers five tips for adequately addressing mobile application security.

episodes.title: BITS Ramps Up Work With Regulators
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Priority one for Nicole Muryn, BITS' new director of regulatory and legislative affairs, is to make sure regulators consider financial institutions' concerns as they craft rules to carry out Dodd-Frank.

episodes.title: Mobile Banking: Predicting the Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Mobile security threats can be managed through testing and strategic risk-mitigation strategies, says Keith Gordon, who oversees authentication and security strategies for Bank of America's consumer online and mobile banking units.

episodes.title: Creating a Malware Intel Sharing System
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Georgia Tech Research Institute is beta testing a malware intelligence system that research scientist Chris Smoak contends will help corporate and government security officials share information about the attacks they confront.

episodes.title: Big Data: It's Not About Size
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Big data isn't about size, says Gartner's Neil MacDonald. It's much bigger: Big data is about volume, velocity, variety and complexity, and requires new approaches on how information is used to secure digital assets.

episodes.title: Lessons from LinkedIn Breach
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In the wake of the LinkedIn breach, what steps should organizations take to enhance online password protection? Araxid's Brent Williams offers advice.

episodes.title: Using Risk to Fund Infosec Projects
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Relating risk to information security initiatives can help IT security managers persuade their bosses to fund these projects, sponsors of a new survey contend.

episodes.title: Protection from Online Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: June has been declared National Internet Safety Month. What is the mission behind the designation, and how can individuals and organizations contribute to the "Stop, Think, Connect" campaign?

episodes.title: Infosec Wares Need to ID Unknown Threats
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Gartner's Peter Firstbrook, to illustrate the vulnerability of IT systems, cites research that pegs at about 400 days the average time a targeted virus remains undetected on a computer. And, he says, that doesn't speak highly of the current offerings from security vendors.

episodes.title: Banks Reduce Account Takeover Losses
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Online banking attacks are up, but financial losses linked to account takeovers are down. What does this shift say about the future of fighting ACH/wire fraud? The FS-ISAC's Bill Nelson weighs in.

episodes.title: Need Exists to Refocus Infosec Skills
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Gartner's Tom Scholtz doesn't see a shortage of technically skilled IT security practitioners. But he perceives a dearth of infosec pros who truly understand how security links to an enterprise's business goals.

episodes.title: Wire Fraud Settlement: The Legal Implications
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The recent settlement between Village View Escrow and Professional Business Bank could set a new course for legal disputes involving account takeover, say the attorneys involved in the fraud case.

episodes.title: Anti-Fraud Investments Go Beyond FFIEC
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Banking institutions are making significant anti-fraud investments as they work toward conformance with the FFIEC's updated Authentication Guidance. But are they investing in the right solutions?

episodes.title: COBIT 5 for Security: What You Need to Know
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: ISACA just issued COBIT 5 for Information Security, a business-centric approach to governance and IT management. ISACA's Robert Stroud explains what COBIT 5 means to your organization.

episodes.title: Zeus: How to Fight Back
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The Zeus Trojan is frightening because of its agility, evolution and success at stealing banking credentials. How can institutions fight back? Malware expert Andreas Baumhof offers new ideas.

episodes.title: Evolving Role of ID, Access Management
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The role of identity and access management is as critical as ever. But the demands of the role? They are radically different, says Sam Curry, CTO of RSA, who discusses the new skills needed.

episodes.title: How the PATCO Ruling Could Benefit Banks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Don't be too quick to write off the PATCO court ruling as a victory for banking customers in the debate over ACH/wire fraud liability. The reversal could actually be a win for banks.

episodes.title: Putting Big Data to Work
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Financial institutions store lots of data. But most don't exploit or even know how to manage it. How can institutions get a handle on big data and use it to deter fraud? Zions Bank offers tips.

episodes.title: Hot Jobs - And How to Land Them
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: From application security to the network, information security career options are exploding. What are the top jobs, and how must infosec pros distinguish themselves to prospective employers?

episodes.title: Integrating Systems to Fight Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Associated Bank is addressing money-laundering concerns from a customer-centric approach. How does this strategy also help the Wisconsin bank enhance transaction monitoring and fraud-detection?

episodes.title: High Roller: How to Protect Accounts
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The so-called High Roller cyberattack uses automation to drain high-value bank accounts. What can institutions do to protect customers? Chris Silveira of Guardian Analytics offers advice.

episodes.title: Breached Organizations Are Tight-Lipped
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Too many organizations that experience a data breach fail to reveal information on the cause of the incident so that consumers can take appropriate action, one consumer advocacy group contends.

episodes.title: CISO Success Requires Collaboration
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: RSA CISO Eddie Schwartz says he spends more time talking to other chief information security officers and IT security practitioners today than he did a decade ago, when he held the same job at Nationwide Insurance Co.

episodes.title: When Breach Planning Fails
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When it comes to breach planning and response, well-intentioned organizations often go wrong. Experian Data Breach Resolution VP Michael Bruemmer tells where they fail and offers advice on how to do these important jobs right.

episodes.title: Eddie Schwartz on His Year as RSA's CISO
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The truth about preventing a breach, like the advanced-persistent-threat attack RSA experienced in 2011, is that an organization can't defend critical systems alone, says RSA CISO Eddie Schwartz.

episodes.title: Phishing Update: 'No Brand is Safe'
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The number of phishing sites is at an all-time high. And so are the targeted brands. The message, says Peter Cassidy of the Anti-Phishing Working Group: "No brand is safe."

episodes.title: Banks and Mobile Payments
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Banking institutions are making technology strides to fight fraud. But how will emerging channels and services, such as mobile payments, impact these investments?

episodes.title: Privacy: 'Do Not Track' Debate
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Microsoft says its next version of the Internet Explorer web browser will feature "do not track" as a default user setting. What are the online privacy implications? Trevor Hughes of the IAPP weighs in.

episodes.title: The Privacy Pro's Challenge
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: There have never been so many job opportunities for privacy professionals. Nor have there ever been so many challenges. Trevor Hughes of the IAPP discusses what it takes to grow a privacy career.

episodes.title: Symantec's CISO on Security Leadership
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Her first nine months on the job included a data breach and a CEO shakeup. Hear how Symantec CISO Patricia Titus has adapted to business change and re-focused the company's security team.

episodes.title: Cybersecurity Act Fails; What Next?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Now that Congress has failed to enact significant cybersecurity legislation, President Obama needs to find new ways to secure key government and business IT systems, says Melissa Hathaway, a former top White House cybersecurity adviser.

episodes.title: Power Grid Too Reliable for Own Good?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The United States - and other advanced societies - shouldn't let the reliability of their electric grids lull them into being unprepared for possible massive power outages caused by cyberattacks, cybersecurity expert Harry Raduege says.

episodes.title: Fraud: Businesses Hold Banks Accountable
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Guardian Analytics is out with its third annual Business Banking Trust Study. What are the latest fraud threats, and how do businesses expect their banking institutions to respond to these threats?

episodes.title: Thinking Smartly About Cloud Computing
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: CSC's Sam Visner sees organizations, in growing numbers, thinking more intelligently about cloud computing, its security and architecture. Yet, he says, they're being very deliberate in their approach in adopting cloud computing.

episodes.title: Social Media: Pros & Cons
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The benefits from employing social media as a way to connect with stakeholders outweigh the risks, says David Bradford, the editor of a new survey of risk managers. Still, he says, the risks must be adequately addressed.

episodes.title: One U.S. Attorney's War on Cyberfraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Jenny Durkan, the U.S. Attorney for the Western District of Washington, is taking a lead role in combatting cyberfraud. Under her leadership, federal prosecutors have upped their efforts to combat ever-increasing threats posed by digital crimes, including card fraud.

episodes.title: FTC's Google Fine: The Privacy Message
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Google's $22.5 million settlement with the Federal Trade Commission is the largest fine ever imposed by the FTC. But the case sends a bigger message about privacy, says attorney Francoise Gilbert.

episodes.title: How to Talk Security to the Board of Directors
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Increasingly, security and risk issues have the attention of boards of directors. What are the keys to discussing these topics with the board? John South, CSO of Heartland Payment Systems, shares tips.

episodes.title: PCI: New Approach to Merchant Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In the wake of recent merchant breaches, a new PCI training program aims to enhance point-of-sale security. Which payment card risks does this program address? PCI Council chair Bob Russo explains.

episodes.title: 3 Lines of Cyberdefense
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: By combining responsible management, risk management and compliance functions and internal audits, organizations will go far in securing their data and systems, says PricewaterhouseCoopers Partner Carolyn Holcomb.

episodes.title: Citadel Malware: The Growing Threat
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: RSA's Etay Maor says Citadel malware and ransomware attacks highlight a growing threat banking institutions and consumers must be prepared to fight. What can institutions do to mitigate risk?

episodes.title: How Cloud Can Facilitate Risk Management
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Ron Ross, the NIST IT security and risk guru, sees cloud computing as a vehicle to help organizations implement an information risk management framework.

episodes.title: Mitigating Messaging Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: E-mail, IM, text messaging - we all increasingly depend on messaging technologies. And so do the fraudsters. Craig Spiezle of the Online Trust Alliance discusses how to mitigate our vulnerabilities.

episodes.title: Apple-Samsung Case: Lessons for CISOs
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: One takeaway from the $1-billion-plus verdict against Android-maker Samsung for infringing Apple patents is that the users of infringed technology also could be held legally liable, patent attorney Jim Denaro says.

episodes.title: FDIC: FFIEC Guidance Progress Report
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: U.S. banking institutions are making solid progress to conform to the FFIEC Authentication Guidance, says William Henley of the FDIC. So, how are examiners responding to banks' good-faith efforts?

episodes.title: FFIEC Guidance Progress Report
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: U.S. banking institutions are making solid progress to conform to the FFIEC Authentication Guidance, says William Henley, a federal regulator. So, how are examiners responding to institutions' good-faith efforts?

episodes.title: Hurricane Season: Are We Prepared?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As Tropical Storm Isaac strikes, many organizations still sting from the impact of Hurricane Irene and 2011's other natural disasters. What lessons were learned, and how can they be applied now?

episodes.title: Anti-Money Laundering Reform Needed
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Charles Intriago isn't shy about sharing his opinions. As he reflects on the sanctions against Standard Chartered Bank, he says banks won't reform until regulators send violators to prison.

episodes.title: Insider Fraud: The 'Low, Slow' Approach
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Which employees are most apt to commit cyberfraud, and how can organizations detect and prevent their crimes? Researcher Randy Trzeciak shares insights and tips from a new insider threat study.

episodes.title: Tackling the Big Data Challenge
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: To address the security and privacy challenges magnified by the velocity, volume and variety of big data, the Cloud Security Alliance has formed a big data working group. What are the group's objectives?

episodes.title: New PCI Certification
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The PCI Council has released a new certification program aimed at training employees, not companies. What makes this program unique, and why is the council coming out with it now? Bob Russo explains.

episodes.title: New Nation-State Attacks Target Banks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Gauss is the latest malware variant likely connected to nation-states. But Roel Schouwenberg of Kaspersky Lab says Gauss' aim at banking credentials is unique. How should organizations respond?

episodes.title: Visa's New End-to-End Encryption Service
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Visa's new end-to-end encryption service aims to eliminate payment card data at the merchant level. Eduardo Perez of Visa's Risk Group discusses the security value of this emerging solution.

episodes.title: 10 Tips for Evolved Defense
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The information security threat landscape has evolved considerably over the past six years, and it's time that organizations' defenses evolve to match them, says Tom Kellermann of Trend Micro.

episodes.title: iPhone 5 and Next-Gen Mobile Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The iPhone 5 is coming, and so are a slew of new or upgraded smart phones and tablets. How should security leaders prepare for this new wave of mobility? Malcolm Harkins, CISO of Intel, offers advice.

episodes.title: Mobile Payment Guidelines Issued
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The PCI Security Standards Council has issued new guidelines on mobile payment acceptance security. What are the key recommendations? The council's Bob Russo and Troy Leach discuss the new guidance.

episodes.title: Cyber Insurance: Getting Started
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Organizations mulling the purchase of cyber insurance should vet their brokers to see if they truly understand policies that provide breach protection, cyber liability lawyer Richard Bortnick says.

episodes.title: Financial Fraud: Manage the Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Worldwide, banking institutions face evolving fraud threats. What are some of the new strategies and solutions they employ to fight back? ACI Worldwide's Patrick Higgins and Andy Morris share insights.

episodes.title: Creating Trust: The $9 Million Pilots
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Five pilot projects unveiled by the federal government, if successful, should build trust in online commerce, helping to boost the economy, says Jeremy Grant, head of the National Strategy for Trusted Identities in Cyberspace National Program office.

episodes.title: Ron Ross on New Risk Assessment Guide
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: NIST's Ron Ross, one of the world's top information risk thought leaders, says new guidance he co-wrote doesn't dictate how organizations must approach risk assessment, but gives enterprises options on how to conduct risk appraisals.

episodes.title: Mobile Payments: The Security Challenge
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When it comes to mobile payments, consumers rely on banks and credit unions to be stewards of security. But how can institutions mitigate risk through a payments mechanism they don't solely own?

episodes.title: Cyberthreats: What's Next?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Earlier this year, Bill Wansley of Booz Allen Hamilton warned of nation-state attacks against U.S. banks. Are his predictions now coming true? What should institutions expect in weeks ahead?

episodes.title: On the Job Training for ISOs
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Delaware Chief Security Officer Elayne Starkey leads, but does not supervise, hundreds of information security officers, many of whom have technical expertise in areas other than security.

episodes.title: Banks Under Attack: PR Missteps
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Banks struck by the wave of DDoS attacks are communicating badly and missing a great opportunity to educate their customers about cybersecurity, says Gregory Nowak of the Information Security Forum.

episodes.title: DDoS Attacks: Are Europe's Banks Next?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Website outages at leading U.S. banks have garnered global attention. But how concerned should European institutions be that they could be the next targets? A London-based security expert shares insight.

episodes.title: Incident Response: Choose Right Words
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A denial of service attack may pose less immediate risk than a data breach - but it's trickier to respond to, says attorney Ronald Raether. What tips does he offer to organizations targeted by DDoS attacks?

episodes.title: Fine Tuning Data Breach Notification Law
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Connecticut Attorney General George Jepsen says he hopes an update to the state's data breach protection law that took effect Oct. 1 will help make its enforcement less difficult.

episodes.title: Windows 8: A Security Upgrade?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Windows 8 is coming soon. What are the security updates in Microsoft's new operating system? Which questions should security leaders weigh before upgrading? Forrester's Chenxi Wang offers insight.

episodes.title: Mobile Banking: Emerging Threats
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Some of the biggest threats to mobile banking and payments are the ones over which institutions have no direct control. How can they mitigate these risks? Mobile banking expert Tom Wills offers advice.

episodes.title: InfoSec Training for IT Specialists
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Delaware Chief Security Officer Elayne Starkey leads hundreds of information security officers, many of whom have technical expertise in areas other than security. What can financial institutions learn from her new certification program that provides needed security know-how?

episodes.title: RSA Warns of New Attacks on Banks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A cybergang threatens a blitz of Trojan attacks aimed at 30 U.S. banks, according to RSA. What steps should all banking institutions take now to prepare? RSA's Mor Ahuvia offers insight and advice.

episodes.title: DDoS: First Line of Defense
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary:
DDoS attacks have existed for years. But the latest wave brings new threats to organizations. How should they defend against these attacks? Ashley Stephenson of Corero Network Security offers insights.

DDoS attacks have existed for years. But the latest wave brings new threats to organizations. How should they defend against these attacks? Ashley Stephenson of Corero Network Security offers insights.

In an interview about defending against the new, sophisticated DDoS attacks, Stephenson discusses:

  • What's new about the attacks we're seeing;
  • Why traditional defenses are insufficient;
  • How organizations can mitigate their risks by deploying a new defensive strategy.

episodes.title: Ira Winkler on ISSA's Future
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cybersecurity thought-leader Ira Winkler has been appointed new international president of the Information Systems Security Association. What are his goals to grow the organization and its influence?

episodes.title: Infosec: One Step Forward, One Step Back
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Infosec pros take note: As the overall number of "true exploits" have decreased, targeted ones - especially those initiated by criminals or nation states - are becoming harder to detect, say IBM's Rick Miller.

episodes.title: The 'Evil 8' Threats to Mobile Computing
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As mobile computing becomes ever-present, enterprises face a new threat landscape that includes rogue marketplaces, insecure public Wi-Fi and proximity-based hacking, says Dan Hubbard of the Cloud Security Alliance.

episodes.title: Mobile Payments: Tackling Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As mobile transactions grow, so do the fraud risks. How is the Merchant Risk Council working with card issuers and merchants to address these threats? Nicolas Vedrenne of the MRC offers insight.

episodes.title: DDoS Attacks: How to Reduce Your Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary:
Download the transcript of this interview in PDF format (sponsored by Corero Network Security)

As DDoS attacks on banks continue, institutions can take immediate steps to lessen the impact on customer experience and reduce fraud risks. Jason Malo of CEB TowerGroup offers insight.

episodes.title: Transparency Key after Cyberattack
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Top executives must be transparent with their stakeholders when their IT systems get attacked. Otherwise, their enterprises' reputations could be more severely damaged, says IBM Fellow Luba Cherbakov.

episodes.title: NIST: Use Cloud to Repel DDoS Attacks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Employing cloud computing services could help organizations defend against the type of distributed denial of service attacks that have temporarily crippled the online service of major American banks, says NIST's Matthew Scholl.

episodes.title: DDoS Attacks: First Signs of Fraud?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Distributed-denial-of-service attacks on U.S. banking institutions will continue, says Akamai's Mike Smith. And he believes the attackers aren't out just to embarrass the banks, but to commit fraud.

episodes.title: CISO's Challenge: Security & Risk
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: CISOs increasingly are asked to manage both information security and risk. What new skills and tools do they need to juggle the dual role? David Sherry, CISO of Brown University, shares his views.

episodes.title: Experts Offer Fed Infosec Governance Plan
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A group of highly respected IT security thought leaders is calling on the Obama administration to exercise existing powers to strengthen the processes the federal government employs to secure its information systems.

episodes.title: Breaches: Small Incidents Add Up to Greatest Losses
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The big breaches make the headlines, but the smaller attacks on merchants are the ones that ultimately benefit the fraudsters and hurt banking institutions most, says Wade Baker of Verizon.

episodes.title: Hurricane Sandy: Triple-Threat Disaster
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Hurricane Sandy threatens buildings, staff and data alike, posing a daunting challenge to business continuity pros. Disaster recovery expert Regina Phelps offers tips for weathering the storm.

episodes.title: Storm Prep Key to Recovery
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: It's been compared to the 'perfect storm,' but Hurricane Sandy is unlike any storm we've seen, says Alan Berman of DRI. He believes organizations have planned well for recovery.

episodes.title: How Secure are the IT Wares You Buy?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: One of the biggest IT security challenges enterprises will face in the coming years will be assuring the integrity of the computer products they purchase, says Gartner Fellow Neil MacDonald.

episodes.title: Educational Value of Competition
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Does cyber defense competition help prepare college students for real-world jobs in information security and risk management? Dan Likarish and Rick Cisneros of Regis University say yes. Here's why.

episodes.title: Incident Response: Gathering the Facts
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: To know how best to respond to IT and communications failures, organizations first must collect information on such incidents, says Marnix Dekker, who co-authored a just-issued report on incidents for ENISA.

episodes.title: Social Media: Reassess Your Strategy
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Social media platforms are ever-evolving. But organizations' and individuals' use of social media has not evolved and may create new risks, says educator Sherrie Madia. How should we manage these risks?

episodes.title: Moving SIEM to the Cloud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The kind of detailed data analysis that helped statistician Nate Silver predict accurately the outcome of the U.S. presidential election could help enterprises using cloud-based SIEM to identify vulnerabilities, says Cloud Security Alliance's Jens Laundrup.

episodes.title: Incident Response: Gathering the Facts
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: To know how best to respond to IT and communications failures, incident response pros first must collect information on such incidents, says Marnix Dekker, who co-authored a new report for ENISA.

episodes.title: Surviving Sandy: A Bank's Story
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Battered by Superstorm Sandy, North Jersey Community Bank maintained operations and customer communications during the storm. CEO Frank Sorrentino discusses the key elements of business continuity.

episodes.title: Top 4 Cyberthreats of 2013
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cloud-based botnets and mobile malware are two of 2013's top cyberthreats. What other threats make the list? Georgia Tech's Paul Royal tells how security pros and organizations can prepare.

episodes.title: Assessing DDoS Attacks on Israeli Sites
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As missiles and bombs do real damage in Israel and Gaza, a veteran Israeli cybersecurity expert, Amichai Shulman, downplays the significance of the assaults waged against Israeli websites, contending any damage has been minimal.

episodes.title: Inside a Forensics Investigation
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What are the key skills and tools forensics pros use in probing a data breach? What can we learn from recent breaches? Rob Lee of SANS Institute walks us through a typical forensics investigation.

episodes.title: Fraud Prevention: Consumers Will Help
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Credit and debit fraud is growing, and that uptick is leading to the loss of customers for issuing banks. But a new global study finds consumers want to work more with institutions to detect and prevent fraud.

episodes.title: Tips for Creating a BYOD Policy
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Developing a bring-your-own-device policy that's well-integrated with an organization's overall information security strategy requires a multi-disciplinary, collaborative approach, says attorney Stephen Wu.

episodes.title: PATCO Owner on Fraud Settlement
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The PATCO fraud dispute could have been settled in 2009, says co-owner Mark Patterson. Why did the case drag on, and what can banking institutions and fraud victims learn from PATCO's recent settlement?

episodes.title: Privacy vs. Security: A Dialogue
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: McAfee CPO Michelle Dennedy and Intel CISO Malcolm Harkins work for the same company, but in some ways they are worlds apart. How must privacy and security leaders bridge gaps to face challenges ahead?

episodes.title: How to Improve Point-of-Sale Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Because many merchant compromises result from badly installed or configured applications, payments acquirers, such as Chase Paymentech, are stepping up to help address point-of-sale security.

episodes.title: Legal Merits of 'Hack Back' Strategy
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: From point-of-sale hacks to malware and DDoS attacks, the top cyberthreats of 2012 have been aggressive and strong. Is it time for organizations to adopt a "hack back" strategy against perceived attackers?

episodes.title: New Trojan Exploits Mobile Channel
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Eurograbber is more than just another banking Trojan. It's an exploitation of fundamental online banking authentication practices that could strike any institution, says Check Point's Darrell Burkey.

episodes.title: Paying More Mind to Malicious Insider
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Former FBI cyber unit chief Tim Ryan sees mounting dangers from the insider, acknowledging undiscerning employees who don't follow proper processes can cause devastation. But he says the actions of those with malicious intent can be more catastrophic.

episodes.title: Privacy Protection: U.S. Falls Short
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In parts of Europe and Asia, privacy legislation took solid steps forward in 2012. In the U.S., however, progress has stalled. Is the U.S. at risk of falling behind when it comes to privacy protection?

episodes.title: Creating a Continuous Monitoring Culture
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: It's as much about people as it is technology for organizations to successfully implement a continuous monitoring program, says George Schu, senior vice president at Booz Allen Hamilton.

episodes.title: Banks Must Brace for 'Blitzkrieg' Attacks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: McAfee researchers have uncovered new information about a Gozi variant, which RSA in October named Prinimalka. The Trojan, part of a blitzkrieg-like attack, is expected to hit 30 institutions in spring 2013.

episodes.title: What is 'Reasonable Security?'
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As the recent PATCO case shows, fraud litigation is moving away from just establishing damages. The key legal question now is: What is reasonable security? Attorneys discuss the 2013 fraud legal landscape.

episodes.title: Why Organizations Fail to Encrypt
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Karen Scarfone, who coauthored NIST's encryption guidance, sort of figured out why many organizations don't encrypt sensitive data when they should. The reason: they do not believe they are required to do so.

episodes.title: 2013 Mobile Security, Payments Outlook
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When it comes to mobile security, users say the right things, but still indulge in risky behavior. Javelin's Al Pascual tells how security leaders can create better partnerships and practices in 2013.

episodes.title: Why It's Time for Next-Gen Firewall
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Threats have evolved, and so have our Internet needs. This is why organizations need to explore the security and productivity gains of the next-generation firewall, says Patrick Sweeney of Dell SonicWALL.

episodes.title: Top 3 Security Priorities for 2013
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: CISOs' top three priorities for 2013 are emerging threats, technology trends and filling security gaps, says RSA CISO Eddie Schwartz. But what new strategies should leaders employ to tackle these challenges?

episodes.title: Langevin: Treaty Stifles Internet Freedom
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: House Cybersecurity Caucus Co-Chair Jim Langevin sees the new International Telecommunication Regulations, approved in Dubai earlier this month over the objections of the U.S., as a veiled threat to suffocate Internet freedom around the world.

episodes.title: How to Address Security's Weakest Link
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
