episodes.summary: Heading into 2013, security leaders across industry feel confident about their processes and technology. People, though, continue to create the greatest risks. Can "awareness in depth" make a difference?

episodes.title: Assessing Prospects for New InfoSec Law
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Members of the U.S. Congress may be more sensitive to cyberthreats than they were in the past, but that doesn't mean they truly all appreciate the risk key government and private-sector IT systems face, says House Cybersecurity Caucus Co-Chair Jim Langevin.

episodes.title: Does Security Stall Technology Adoption?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: IBM's Dan Hauenstein, in analyzing Big Blue's 2012 Tech Trends Report, says security concerns often inhibit the adoption of four technologies: mobile, cloud, social business media and business analytics.

episodes.title: More AML Penalties to Come?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The penalties paid out by HSBC and Standard Chartered Bank for violations to money-laundering regulations should serve as a wake-up call, says Kevin Sullivan. In fact, banking institutions should brace for more fines.

episodes.title: 2012's Top Breaches & Lessons Learned
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: From Global Payments to LinkedIn and Zappos, 2012 was filled with notable data breaches. What were the most significant breaches, and how should they influence organizations' breach responses in 2013?

episodes.title: How to Say 'Yes' to BYOD
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When it comes to mobility, how do leaders balance security needs with employees' BYOD desires? The easy answer: Just say no. But that's also the wrong answer. What security tips do these leaders offer?

episodes.title: Legislation to Watch in 2013
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cloud computing and mobility are areas likely to see new regulatory attention in the year ahead. But what are the other hot topics that leading attorneys believe will be addressed in new legislation worldwide?

episodes.title: Hanging Tough with Int'l Privacy Regs
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: With different nations establishing different privacy standards, organizations face adopting the most stringent regulations in order to be compliant everywhere they operate, says Marc Groman, a director of the International Association of Privacy Professionals.

episodes.title: Account Takeover: The 2013 Outlook
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What are the top account takeover threats to banking institutions in 2013? Ken Baylor of NSS Labs discusses Zeus variants, mobile malware and how institutions can protect themselves from fraudsters.

episodes.title: Tackling the Authentication Challenge
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The evolution of threats and rise of mobility are leading organizations to improve user authentication. What are the new strategies and solutions security leaders in all sectors will employ this year?

episodes.title: FDIC on Mobile Payments Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Peer-to-peer, near-field communications and barcode scans are revolutionizing mobile payments. What unique risks do these emerging technologies pose to banking institutions? Two FDIC executives offer insights.

episodes.title: Tom Ridge on DHS's IT Security Role
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Tom Ridge, the first Homeland Security secretary, questions the wisdom of granting the Department of Homeland Security greater authority to influence IT security within the federal government and the nation's critical IT infrastructure.

episodes.title: FS-ISAC on DDoS, Account Takeover
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Which fraud trends need the most attention from U.S. banking institutions in 2013? Distributed-denial-of-service attacks and account takeover, says FS-ISAC's Bill Nelson, who offers fraud-fighting tips.

episodes.title: ID Theft: 2013 Top Trends
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: ID theft is a growing global problem. Eva Velasquez, head of the ITRC, outlines how public and private organizations in 2013 can update approaches to ID theft prevention.

episodes.title: Top 10 Screening Trends for 2013
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: How will new guidance on criminal background checks change the way organizations approach employment screening? This is one of the key trends to watch in 2013, says screening expert Les Rosen.

episodes.title: VanRoekel on Infosec and Sequestration
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: With Congress facing $1.2 trillion in budget cuts, Federal Chief Information Officer Steven VanRoekel says funding for cybersecurity initiatives will likely be affected. But with smart planning, government information technology should not be placed at risk.

episodes.title: The Evolution of Incident Response
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: It isn't so much the changing threat landscape that causes security leaders to re-assess their approach to incident response. Mobility and the expanding perimeter are the real factors driving change.

episodes.title: Maturing of Biometrics on Smart Phones
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Smart phones that give many IT security managers headaches in developing security policies are being used in increasing numbers to help safeguard systems and applications, thanks to more muscular biometric features, says Steve Vinsik of Unisys.

episodes.title: ENISA Identifies Top Cyberthreats
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: ENISA, the European Union cyber-agency, is out with its first-ever Threat Landscape report. What are the emerging threats and vulnerabilities, and how should organizations globally respond to them?

episodes.title: Arguing Against Voluntary Standards
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The idea of the U.S. federal government and industry jointly developing IT security best practices will do little to help critical infrastructure operators defend against cyber-risk, says Business Roundtable Vice President Liz Gasster.

episodes.title: Linking Cyber, Physical Threat Data
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Sharing information about physical and cyber threats needn't be segregated under the U.S. federal government's National Strategy for Information Sharing and Safeguarding, says Kshemendra Paul, who manages the implementation of the strategy.

episodes.title: CISOs Reveal Top Threat Worries
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: It's not malware, crime rings or hacktivists. What, then, are among the threats that concern security leaders most? CISO Tom Newton offers new insight on today's top threats and strategies to combat them.

episodes.title: Top Malware Threats of 2013
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In 2012, we saw the rise of state-sponsored malware, as well as the evolution of Trojans and ransomware. What new threats will 2013 bring? Adam Kujawa of Malwarebytes offers insights.

episodes.title: Continuous Monitoring and the Cloud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As enterprises move more applications to the cloud, continuous monitoring will play a greater role in assuring the software is patched in a timely manner, says John Streufert, DHS director of federal network resilience.

episodes.title: FFIEC: Commercial Online Provider Swap
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: QCR Holdings, a bank-holding company in Illinois, is moving to a new provider for commercial online banking. Why? To ensure QCR's banks conform to the FFIEC's updated authentication guidance, says CTO Michael Wyffels.

episodes.title: Health Data Breach Response Tips
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Security threats to healthcare organizations are on the rise - and so are regulatory requirements. Kim Singletary of McAfee discusses the top breach prevention and response challenges for healthcare organizations in 2013.

episodes.title: ATM Cash-Out: Why Banks Are at Risk
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Visa's alert to U.S. card issuers about increasing global ATM cash-out schemes should serve as a warning of bigger scams to come, says ATM expert Nicole Sturgill. Why are cash-out incidents on the rise?

episodes.title: Securing Data Via Containerization
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Containerization - it's the latest strategy for securing the critical data accessed by remote workers and mobile devices. How is the concept deployed? David Lingenfelter of Fiberlink offers insight.

episodes.title: What to Expect at RSA 2013
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Mobile security, advanced persistent threat and DDoS attacks on banks have been among the hottest security stories. How have they influenced RSA Conference 2013? Program Chair Hugh Thompson previews the event.

episodes.title: 2013 Data Protection Agenda
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: How can security pros help organizations prevent breaches and data loss? The Online Trust Alliance has released its latest guide to data protection and breach readiness, and OTA founder Craig Spiezle offers tips.

episodes.title: DDoS: Are Attacks Really Over?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Although hacktivists announced suspension of DDoS attacks against banks, other industries are now getting hit, and banks can't afford to get complacent because of the fraud risk, says security specialist Bill Stewart.

episodes.title: Cybersecurity: It's a Skills Crisis
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: It isn't just a staffing shortage that stops organizations from building cyberteams. It's a skills crisis, says SANS Institute founder Alan Paller, who tells why now is the ideal time to fill top roles with qualified professionals.

episodes.title: PCI Council Issues Cloud Guidance
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Outsourcing to the cloud poses new risks, especially for card data. The PCI Council addresses those risks in its just-released cloud security guidance, and Bob Russo offers exclusive insights.

episodes.title: BYOD: Secure the Network
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: We've seen user-driven trends such as BYOD before, says Kevin Flynn of Fortinet. And if organizations remember past security lessons, they will avoid falling prey to mistakes that could lead to breaches.

episodes.title: DDoS Attacks: Lessons Learned
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Some of the largest banks in the U.S. were unable to ward off sophisticated DDoS attacks, so what can smaller organizations do? Plenty, says Marty Meyer, President of Corero Network Security.

episodes.title: FDIC Explains Social Media Guidance
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Federal regulators have issued draft guidance for the use of social media. What are the specific security risks? The FDIC's Elizabeth Khalil discusses how banking institutions can address emerging threats.

episodes.title: Top Threats to Mobile Workers
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Mobile malware, jailbroken devices and unpatched systems are three of the top security threats to mobile workers. How can organizations mitigate the risks? Dave Jevans of Marble Security offers tips.

episodes.title: The Move to Data-Centric Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Organizations typically secure data where it resides and is transmitted. Data-centric security strategies focus on securing the data itself. Mark Bower of Voltage Security explains.

episodes.title: Examining the New EU Cybersec Directive
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A proposed directive requiring the reporting of serious cyber-attacks to national authorities could add complexity to organizations operating online in the European Union, says IT security lawyer FranÃ§ois Gilbert.

episodes.title: The Psychology of Risk
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Risk management is an art, not a science. That is the contention of Andy Ellis, CSO of Akamai and a keynote speaker at RSA Conference 2013. How can psychology change one's approach to risk and security management?

episodes.title: Facebook Hack: What the Breach Tells Us
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Highly publicized breaches at Facebook, Twitter, the New York Times and other organizations in recent weeks suggest there's a new normal in the cyberthreat arena. But the onetime head of U.S. CERT, Mischel Kwon, doesn't think so.

episodes.title: Threat Intelligence in Action
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Malware, DDoS and mobile security aside, one of the biggest risks is organizations' lack of visibility into specific threats. Don Gray of Solutionary explains the need for actionable threat intelligence.

episodes.title: Why Banks Benefit from New Cyber Bill
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Information sharing within the financial sector has been critical in thwarting cyber-attacks. Legislation pending before Congress would help bridge the information gap among industries, says Paul Smocer of BITS.

episodes.title: Multi-Channel Fraud: A Defense Plan
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: From sophisticated malware to socially-engineered schemes, banking institutions of all sizes are under constant, multi-channel attack. How can they respond? Daniel Ingevaldson of Easy Solutions shares ideas.

episodes.title: Big Data for Fraud Detection
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Intrusion detection is challenging for most organizations, and hackers' ever-increasing skill to evade monitoring tools only compounds the problem. But Zions Bank's Michael Fowkes says big data can help.

episodes.title: NIST's Ron Ross on Risk Mgt. Framework
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: An information risk management framework isn't implemented in a vacuum, as National Institute of Standards and Technology Fellow Ron Ross points out.

episodes.title: Legal Lessons from PATCO Fraud Case
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The PATCO fraud case shows why banking institutions cannot rely on compliance to ensure security. In an RSA 2013 preview, attorney Joseph Burton discusses legal lessons from the PATCO settlement.

episodes.title: Defending Against Targeted Attacks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: More than merely a phishing incident, a targeted attack is part of an advanced persistent threat. How can organizations defend against these attacks? Kevin Epstein of Proofpoint offers insight.

episodes.title: Staffing Crisis: What to Do About it
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: We are no longer facing a global IT security staffing shortage - it's a full-blown crisis. This is the conclusion of new research conducted by (ISC)Â². Julie Peeler and Bruce Murphy offer insight.

episodes.title: Daniel Sees Path to New Infosec Law
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Debate over cybersecurity bills last year coupled with recent, highly publicized attacks have raised the visibility of the threat, and that could push Congress to enact IT security legislation in 2013, White House Cybersecurity Coordinator Michael Daniel says.

episodes.title: Managing Identity Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Because managing identities is a global problem, it requires a global solution, says Paul Simmonds of the Jericho Forum. A new organization has been established to address global identity. Simmonds offers insight.

episodes.title: Tackling Call Center Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Call center fraud is increasing, and it's not just financial institutions feeling the pain, says Pindrop Security's Matt Anthony. Now, a database of phone numbers aims to help organizations mitigate risks.

episodes.title: HIPAA Omnibus: A Compliance Plan
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: How is the six-hospital Barnabas Health delivery system tackling the challenge of complying with the new HIPAA Omnibus rule? Hussein Syed, director of IT security, explains.

episodes.title: DDoS: Evolving Threats, Solutions
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: DDoS attacks on banks have returned, and the attackers are changing their tactics and expanding their attack toolsets. How must organizations change the way they defend against DDoS? Carlos Morales of Arbor Networks shares strategies.

episodes.title: Embracing the BYOD Trend
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Organizations in all industries can embrace the bring-your-own-device trend if they take adequate steps to authenticate mobile users, says Soumya Das of SecureAuth.

episodes.title: Using Data for ID Management
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Most organizations are challenged by having too much information in too many places. But Dieter Schuller of Radiant Logic says centralizing data can improve identity management.

episodes.title: Fighting Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: One of the biggest challenges facing organizations is that fraudsters constantly change the way they try to cheat banks and other organizations, says Rajib Roy, president of Equifax Identity and Fraud Solutions, which provides advanced analytics and proprietary technology to deliver customize insights for identity intelligence, fraud prevention, privacy and data security.

episodes.title: CipherCloud Unveils New Offering
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Paige Leidig, chief marketing officer of CipherCloud, says information protection requirements continue to be the primary hurdle for enterprise adoption, despite explosive growth in the cloud content and collaboration market and its evident advantages to productivity and cost efficiencies.

episodes.title: Automating Risk Profiling
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Balancing the customer experience with risk mitigation is tricky, says Jon Karl of Iovation. But automating customer reputation profiles can help organizations take the guesswork out of fraud prevention, and improve the experience on both sides of the transaction.

episodes.title: Overcoming Too Much Data
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Most organizations have more data than they know what to do with, much less understand how they can use that data in a meaningful way, say NopSec's Lisa Xu and Steven Leonard. Having the ability to aggregate that data is key.

episodes.title: More Investment Needed for App Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Hewlett-Packard's John Diamant points out most enterprises invest little in the area with the greatest vulnerabilities: application security.

episodes.title: Automating Governance
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Automating governance, risk and compliance reduces vulnerabilities that can have an adverse impact on the bottom line, says Sergio Thompson-Flores, chief executive of Modulo, a provider of GRC offerings.

episodes.title: Beyond Mobile Device Management
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: To improve security and increase workforce productivity across an enterprise, a set of integrated capabilities is needed, says Corey Williams, senior director of product management at Centrify.

episodes.title: Simulating Cyberattacks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cyberattacks used as modes of distraction for fraud are organizations' biggest concern, say Pam O'Neal and Scott Register of IXIA.

episodes.title: Banking Mobile App Security: Key Issues
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Banking institutions need to ramp up their ability to deal with security issues as they roll out more mobile banking applications, says Andrew McLennan of Metaforic.

episodes.title: Masking Test Data in the Cloud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Because data stored in a cloud-based "sandbox" environment for testing purposes is vulnerable, it should be masked to protect sensitive information, says Karen Hsu of Informatica.

episodes.title: How the Cloud Affects Authentication
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The growth in cloud computing and mobility is creating a need for a streamlined, centralized process for managing user authentication, says Sarah Fender of PhoneFactor.

episodes.title: Layered Security for Mobile Apps
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The new generation of mobile applications requires layers of security to protect integrity, says Vince Arneja of Arxan Technologies.

episodes.title: Public Cloud Services: Security Issues
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Public cloud services can reduce costs for large enterprises, but they pose security risks that must be addressed, says Tsahy Shapsa of CloudLock.

episodes.title: Using Analytics to Fight Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Financial institutions can use real-time security analytics to detect early indicators of fraud, such as cash-out schemes, says David Pack of LogRhythm.

episodes.title: Network Access Control and BYOD
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Combining a network access control system with a mobile device management system is a good way to address security for BYOD, says Scott Gordon of ForeScout.

episodes.title: APT: Protecting Against Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Advanced persistent threats are evolving, and banks can help thwart them by using continuous monitoring for real-time detection, says J. Paul Haynes of eSentire.

episodes.title: Tips for Securing Mobile Apps
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Companies developing their own mobile applications must take steps to ensure their security policies are followed no matter where or how the apps are used, says Kurt Stammberger of Mocana Corp.

episodes.title: Security Beyond the Perimeter
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Security leaders know their old perimeter-based security models are insufficient. But what new model is best? And how can it reduce reliance on passwords for authentication? Julian Lovelock of HID Global offers insight.

episodes.title: Executive Order: Private Sector's Role
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The private sector has a unique opportunity to respond to President Obama's cybersecurity executive order and help shape information sharing and critical infrastructure protection. David Burg of PwC tells how.

episodes.title: Formalizing Cyber-Physical Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Will Pelgrin and Rich Licht of the Center for Internet Security see a strong link between cyber and physical security, and that has led to the creation of a new unit at the center to help local and state governments to secure both.

episodes.title: Using Intelligence to Fight APTs
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Intelligence is helping organizations not only detect and prevent intrusions, says Mark Wood of Dell SecureWorks. It's also helping them identify they've been targeted for an attack in the first place.

episodes.title: Disrupting DDoS
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Distributed-denial-of-service attacks are not new, but they are being taken more seriously as a threat to network security and data protection, especially by financial-services, says Ashley Stephenson of Corero Network Security.

episodes.title: Report: 28% of Breaches Lead to Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: New research says more than 25 percent of consumers hit by a data breach later become victims of identity fraud - especially when payment card information is exposed. Javelin's Al Pascual shares analysis.

episodes.title: Improving Internal Authentication
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Authenticating appropriate network administrators and employees has become increasingly challenging, especially for healthcare organizations and regional banking institutions, says Tim Ager of Celestix.

episodes.title: Phishing Attacks Remain No. 1 Risk
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Despite ever-evolving cybersecurity threats, David Knight of Proofpoint says spear phishing attacks are really the greatest worries for most security and risk officers.

episodes.title: Giving Access Control to Managers
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Business line managers are in better positions to control and monitor network and system access privileges than IT departments, since they know their employees and the privileges they should be provided, says Bill Evans of Dell Software.

episodes.title: Data: The New Perimeter
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Data security used to be about building firewalls and protections around the data. Now it's about securing the data itself. That's why data is the new perimeter, says Charlie Pulfer of Titus.

episodes.title: Developing Information Superiority
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Companies wanting to share cyber-threat information with the government and other businesses should adopt the U.S. Defense Department's doctrine of information superiority, says Lares Institute Chief Executive Andrew Serwin.

episodes.title: Evolution of DDoS Attacks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: We now have seen three waves of DDoS attacks on U.S. banks, and Dan Holden of Arbor Networks says we have seen three distinct shifts in these incidents. What can we expect going forward?

episodes.title: How Phishing Attacks Are Evolving
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Phishing attacks are up, and the methods are changing. Paul Ferguson of the Anti-Phishing Working Group explains how phishers are fine-tuning their schemes and exploiting cross-platform technologies.

episodes.title: Top 4 Global Intelligence Threats
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Solutionary is out with its 2013 Global Threat Intelligence Report. What are the top four threats to organizations, and how can they be mitigated? Security strategist Don Gray offers insights and tips.

episodes.title: BITS on Top Fraud Threats to Banks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: DDoS attacks, mobile malware and tax fraud are growing concerns for U.S. banks. But what's the top threat these institutions and their customers face in 2013? Nancy Guglielmo of BITS offers her insights.

episodes.title: Venture Capital's Role in Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: It's a boom time for information security start-ups. But what unique qualities separate winners from losers? Alberto YÃ©pez of Trident Capital describes the role of venture capital in today's market.

episodes.title: DDoS Attacks: What to Tell Customers
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When struck by DDoS, how - and what - should banking institutions communicate with their customers? Doug Johnson of the American Bankers Association advises on post-attack disclosure obligations.

episodes.title: Analyzing Motive Behind South Korean Attack
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The motive behind the cyber-attack on South Korean banks and broadcasters was atypical, as compared to most digital assaults that involve implanting malware on IT systems, says McAfee's Vincent Weafer.

episodes.title: What's the Cost of Failed Trust?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary:
What's the cost to an organization when it suffers a seurity breach and breaks trust with its own customers? Jeff Hudson, CEO of Venafi, presents results of a new survey on the cost of failed trust.

Venafi has just partnered with Ponemon Group to release a new survey, "The Cost of Failed Trust". Among the key findings: $398M is the average loss facing every Global 2000 organization from attacks on trust assets. And so many of these incidents result from serious exploits of what could be described as common, easy-to-fix vulnerabilities.

episodes.title: Predictive Analysis in Cyberdefense
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Want to know how predictive analysis could work to defend your IT systems? Take a look at how American Navy SEALS found Osama bin Laden, says Booz Allen Hamilton's Christopher Ling.

episodes.title: Old Cyberthreats Pose Greater Dangers
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The bad guys who attack information systems are getting better at what they do, making old threats even more dangerous, says Steve Durbin of the Information Security Forum.

episodes.title: Big Data: How to Use it
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Understanding big data is not the problem, say Michael Fowkes and Aaron Caldiero of Zions Bank. Figuring out how to use the information contained within big data in a meaningful way - that's the trick.

episodes.title: What Breaches Can Teach Us
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What can organizations do to improve security after a network attack? Post-breach investigations help security leaders trace steps and strengthen weak points, says investigator Erin Nealy Cox.

episodes.title: Diplomacy Pays Off with Safer IT Networks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Computer networks in nations where the government has ratified international cyber-agreements have lower incidents of malware infection, says Paul Nicholas, Microsoft senior director of global security strategy and diplomacy.

episodes.title: Truth About 2-Factor Authentication
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary:
In light of evolving fraud threats, financial institutions increasingly are turning to two-factor authentication solutions. Alex Doll, CEO of OneID, offers advice to help institutions make the right choices.

In an interview about the myths and realities of two-factor authentication, Doll discusses:

  • The current threat landscape;
  • How organizations are successfully deploying two-factor solutions;
  • How to keep customer experience top-of-mind in a two-factor rollout.

episodes.title: Fraud Awareness: A Banking Case Study
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: New and proposed FFIEC guidance for fraud prevention and social media spurred Bank of the West in March to launch a viral campaign aimed at fraud awareness. What are the campaign's key elements?

episodes.title: CISO as Chief Privacy Officer
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Intel has added privacy to the portfolio of its top information security executive, Malcolm Harkins, who says too many information security professionals are "color blind or tone deaf" to privacy, wrongly thinking strong data protection provides privacy safeguards.

episodes.title: BITS: Improving E-mail Authentication
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: E-mail authentication foils phishing, but authentication is only effective if every partner in the chain adopts it. John Carlson and Andrew Kennedy of BITS explain how institutions can improve e-mail practices.

episodes.title: Spear Phishing Goes Mobile
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Kaspersky Lab has identified a new spear-phishing attack involving a Trojan designed to target Android devices. Researcher Kurt Baumgartner says organizations need to be prepared for more mobile malware attacks.

episodes.title: Can Moving Data to Cloud Reduce Risk?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: NIST's Ron Ross sees complexity as the biggest risk enterprises face. To ease risk, Ross favors moving data to the cloud. Purdue's Eugene Spafford doesn't fully subscribe to Ross' plan. The two square off in this interview.

episodes.title: Security Careers: Breaking Barriers
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Lisa Xu, CEO of NopSec, says pursuing leadership roles in information security - a male-dominated field - can be challenging for women. What advice does she offer for women to grow in their careers?

episodes.title: Will New Hires Impede Future Security?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The rush to find qualified IT security professionals to meet current cyberthreats could jeopardize IT systems' security in the not-too-distant future, say two leading IT security experts, Eugene Spafford and Ron Ross.

episodes.title: Post-Breach Credit Monitoring Strategies
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: To retain their customers after a breach of sensitive information, organizations should take the extra step of calling those affected to offer free credit protection services, says security expert Brian Dean.

episodes.title: BITS: BYOD Policies Must Evolve
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Bring-your-own-device policies must be frequently updated because of new risks, such as mobile malware, says Jim Pitts of BITS, which has developed best practices for BYOD in banking.

episodes.title: Why DDoS Attacks Are 'No Big Deal'
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Distributed-denial-of-service attacks are increasing against European banking institutions. But UK consultant Mark Child says if banks are worried about DDoS, then they have bigger security problems.

episodes.title: Privacy Across Borders
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As data protection regulations continue to be refined, organizations throughout Europe are more sensitive to privacy restrictions in individual countries, says Dwayne Melancon, CTO of Tripwire.

episodes.title: DDoS: 'The New Normal'
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Prolexic's CEO Scott Hammack says battling distributed-denial-of-service attacks has become part of everyday business. And during this in-depth interview, he explains why.

episodes.title: Boston Lockdown: Business Continuity
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The hunt for a Boston Marathon bombing suspect that locked down the city caused massive disruption to business operations, but enterprises that had business continuity plans in place hardly missed a beat.

episodes.title: ENISA Aims for Longer, Stronger Role
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The European parliament recently voted to extend and strengthen the European Network and Information Security Agency. What does this news mean for Europe's top cybersecurity agency and for the state of emerging threats across Europe?

episodes.title: Professionalizing the IT Security Field
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Should IT security practitioners be deemed professionals like those in medicine and law? That's not an easy question to answer, says Ronald Sanders, former human capital officer at the U.S. Office of the Director of National Intelligence.

episodes.title: Verizon Report: DDoS a Broad Threat
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Distributed-denial-of-service attacks jumped significantly in 2012. And it's not just banking institutions that are victims, Verizon finds in its just-released Data Breach Investigations Report.

episodes.title: The New Era of Third-Party Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Organizations face new cyber-risks from their third-party service providers. But standard contracts fail to cover these risks. Trend Micro's Tom Kellermann discusses the risk management essentials.

episodes.title: Consumers Want Stronger Authentication
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: New research from Cisco finds many consumers want banking institutions to implement stronger authentication, and they're willing to provide private information to support the identification effort.

episodes.title: A New Legal Perspective on ACH Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A Missouri court's judgment in an ACH/wire fraud dispute between Choice Escrow and BancorpSouth reflects an evolution in how courts view fraud liability, says cybersecurity attorney Joseph Burton.

episodes.title: Cyber-Attacks: The New Maturity
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: It isn't just the quantity of cyber-attacks that's staggering; it's the quality. The average hacker now has access to nation-state-level attack capabilities, says James Lyne of Sophos. How can organizations defend?

episodes.title: Addressing the Skills Crisis
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: It isn't a staffing shortage that we face, but rather a skills crisis, says Allan Boardman, international vice president of ISACA. How can organizations build the security skills they need to mitigate evolving risks?

episodes.title: 240 Ideas to Secure Critical IT
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: NIST's Donna Dodson is leading a federal government effort to take hundreds of suggestions from the private sector to create an IT security best practices framework that critical infrastructure operators could voluntarily adopt.

episodes.title: A New Source of Cyberthreat Updates
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Obtaining timely, accurate updates about emerging cyberthreats is challenging. The FS-ISAC is now offering briefings on the latest trends and how to address them, says Bill Nelson, president.

episodes.title: Growing the Global Security Community
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When Richard Nealon first sat for his CISSP exam, he was struck by how U.S.-centric the questions were. Since then, he has strived to promote greater awareness of global information security concerns.

episodes.title: Spamhaus DDoS Attack Called Preventable
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The massive distributed-denial-of-service attack in Europe that targeted Spamhaus could easily have been prevented if information service providers followed a 13-year-old industry best practice, ENISA's Thomas Haeberlen says.

episodes.title: Mandiant on Nation-State Threats
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Security firm Mandiant recently released a widely publicized report detailing cyber-espionage activity originating in China. Mandiant Director Charles Carmakal discusses the latest nation-state threats.

episodes.title: NIST Unveils Security, Privacy Controls
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: NIST's Ron Ross, a big NASCAR fan, likens new security controls guidance to the tools race-car builders use to prevent drivers from breaking their necks when crashing into a brick wall at 200 miles an hour.

episodes.title: Using Big Data to Fight Phishing
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Today's spear-phishing campaigns are localized, small and can slip through typical spam filters. As a result, detection practices have to evolve, says researcher Gary Warner of the University of Alabama at Birmingham.

episodes.title: Addressing DDoS in Risk Assessments
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In assessing the risk of a distributed-denial-of service attack, organizations must think beyond shoring up systems' perimeters and concentrate on analyzing cyberthreat intelligence, Booz Allen Hamilton's Sedar Labarre says.

episodes.title: OpUSA: Sizing Up the Threat
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Mark Weatherford, who recently stepped down as DHS deputy undersecretary for cybersecurity, says that although planned OpUSA DDoS attacks may initially be a nuisance, they represent a genuine long-term threat to the government.

episodes.title: Mobile Banking Without Apps
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Eric Bangerter, an executive with a $1.6 billion institution in Wisconsin, explains why the risks associated with mobile apps led his team to opt for using a Web-based platform for mobile banking instead.

episodes.title: Mitigating Insider Threat From the Cloud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cloud computing providers must step up and develop approaches to prevent their employees from stealing or harming customer data they host, say two experts from Carnegie Mellon University's CERT Insider Threat Center.

episodes.title: Avivah Litan on Bank Cyberheist
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: How could global fraudsters steal $45 million from banking institutions without being detected or stopped? It's a process breakdown, not a technology failure, says fraud expert Avivah Litan of Gartner.

episodes.title: Fraud Arrests 'A Victory for Us'
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cash-out scams are old news. But the size and sophistication of the latest $45 million global fraud scheme that struck banks add up to a troubling trend, says former federal prosecutor Kim Peretti.

episodes.title: Why We Can Expect More ATM Cash-Outs
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Why are ATM cash-out schemes expected to increase - especially in the U.S.? John Buzzard of FICO's Card Alert Service offers insights, based on federal investigators' most recent global fraud bust.

episodes.title: Insider Threat Hovering in the Cloud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: CERT Technical Manager Dawn Cappelli tells a tale of how three individuals, who unexpectedly quit their jobs at a law firm, used a free cloud service to sabotage files containing proprietary client information from their former employer.

episodes.title: The Future of PCI
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As the Payment Card Industry Security Standards Council prepares to update the PCI Data Security Standard, malware attacks aimed at payments networks are garnering attention, says the council's Jeremy King.

episodes.title: First Data on Preventing Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In this exclusive interview, Tim Horton of First Data explains how the nation's largest credit card processor is helping financial institutions and merchants mitigate risks posed by malware and DDoS attacks.

episodes.title: Logs Paint Picture of Menacing Insider
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Maintaining accurate logs of systems' activities is crucial in helping catch insiders who threaten an organization's digital assets, says George Silowash, co-author of the Common Sense Guide to Mitigating Insider Threats.

episodes.title: Targeted Cyber-Attacks: How to Respond
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Facing advanced cyber-attacks, organizations must shift their focus to detection and mitigation, says ISACA's Jeff Spivey, who outlines four capabilities necessary for effective response.

episodes.title: Keys to Successful Info Sharing
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: If everyone supports the idea of sharing cyberthreat information, then why is information sharing so difficult? Shawn Henry, a former investigator with the FBI, tells how organizations can clear their biggest hurdles.

episodes.title: Mobile Threats Outpace PC Attacks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Attacks aimed at mobile devices are progressing much more rapidly than any attacks ever waged against PCs. Organizations are in danger if they don't pay attention, says anti-phishing expert Dave Jevans.

episodes.title: Questioning the Legality of Hack-Back
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Privacy attorney Ron Raether challenges a commission's recent recommendation that the government should support companies that use the hack-back approach to mitigating the theft of intellectual property.

episodes.title: Mobile: Be Secure and Productive
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Securing mobile devices in the enterprise is just half the challenge. The other is ensuring that employees are able to work productively. A panel of experts from Attachmate offers new strategies.

episodes.title: Community Banks: Next DDoS Targets
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary:
DDoS attacks on U.S. banks will continue, and community institutions may well be the next major targets. Rodney Joffe of Neustar offer tips for how smaller institutions can assess DDoS risks and improve DDoS mitigation.

In an interview about DDoS threats and defenses, Joffe discusses:

  • Why community banks must consider themselves the next targets;
  • How organizations can make themselves less attractive to attackers;
  • How to minimize the impact of a DDoS attack.

episodes.title: Americans Don't Fret Over Cybersecurity
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Despite growing awareness of cyberthreats, Americans are not overly concerned about their own cybersecurity, Unisys' Steve Vinsik says in his analysis of his company's latest security index.

episodes.title: Payment Card Security:  A New View on Protecting Sensitive Data from Browser to Back-Office
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: It isn't just a financial services issue. Organizations of all types are victimized by data security breaches and fraud schemes that compromise payment card data. What can be done to help ensure better security and PCI compliance?

episodes.title: Protecting the Virtual Supply Chain
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary:
When it comes to breach prevention, many organizations are improving their own security posture, but neglecting that of their strategic partners. Trend Micro's Tom Kellermann outlines third-party risks.

In an interview about virtual supply chain threats, Kellermann discusses:

  • Supply chain gaps organizations frequently overlook;
  • Top threats exploiting those gaps;
  • Proactive security measures that should be employed.

episodes.title: Mobile Security: Lessons from Asia
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When it comes to mobile banking and payments, security risks are similar globally. But Western institutions can learn from innovative solutions now offered in the East, says fraud expert Tom Wills.

episodes.title: RSA's Coviello: How to Use Big Data
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: RSA's Art Coviello finds today's cybersecurity strategies to be lacking. Global organizations must rely more on big data and public-private partnerships to defend themselves from advanced threats.

episodes.title: Regulations' Impact on Data Breach Costs
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Regulations initially cause organizations to spend more funds on data breaches, but eventually those rules could save enterprises money, the Ponemon Institute's Larry Ponemon says in analyzing his latest study on breach costs.

episodes.title: Phishing: The Privatization of Trojans
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The latest phishing trend: the privatization of banking Trojans. Why should financial institutions be concerned? Daniel Cohen of RSA tells what to look for in the newest cross-channel schemes.

episodes.title: How Analytics Will Change Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: How organizations view security is about to change, says Hugh Thompson of the security firm RSA. He explains why analytics will turn everything we thought we knew about security on its head.

episodes.title: DDoS Attacks: The Impact on Brand
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Defacement and downtime are two consequences for organizations struck by distributed-denial-of-service attacks. But what's the brand impact? Akamai's Fran Trentley discusses risks and mitigation.

episodes.title: Cold Facts About Web App Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: On average, 86 percent of web applications have at least one serious vulnerability, and each app is attacked about 4,000 times per year, says Imperva's Terry Ray. So, how must security be improved?

episodes.title: USC Launches Master's in Cybersecurity
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: USC's Viterbi School of Engineering has just announced a new master's degree in cybersecurity. What's the new program's genesis, and how will it help address the IT security staffing crunch?

episodes.title: A Rise in Encryption?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A dramatic reduction in processing requirements for encryption may mean increased utilization of the technology, says Todd Thiemann of Vormetric.

episodes.title: The Move to Data-Centric Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The attack space is changing, with more enterprise users accessing data from their mobile device, leading to a new focus on data-centric security, says Jeremy Stieglitz of Voltage Security.

episodes.title: Using Mobile to Authenticate
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Organizations looking to leverage multi-factor authentication should consider mobile devices for their unique capabilities, says Sarah Fender of PhoneFactor.

episodes.title: Top Risk Concerns
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What are the top GRC concerns within organizations? John Ambra of Modulo explains.

episodes.title: How to Address BYOD
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The bring-your-own-device trend is a huge issue for organizations today, says Rob Ayoub of Fortinet, who offers recommendations to address the security challenges involved.

episodes.title: Mitigating Advanced Cyber-Attacks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cyber-attacks are becoming increasingly difficult for organizations to defend against, says Ashar Aziz of FireEye.

episodes.title: Getting BYOD Advice
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What are the top bring-your-own-device concerns enterprises are facing today? Russell Rice of Cisco explains.

episodes.title: Addressing Cloud in Government
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What's top of mind for the federal government when it comes to cloud security? David Berman of Centrify explains.

episodes.title: Using Business-Driven IAM to Improve Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What is business-driven identity and access management and how can it help organizations improve their security? Jason Garbis of Aveksa explains.

episodes.title: Improving Identity and Access Management
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What are the top concerns around identity and access management within organizations? Avatier Chief Innovation Officer Ryan Ward says compliance, governance and audit issues are top-of-mind.

episodes.title: Mitigating Mobile Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As BYOD continues to become more commonplace, mobile application risk management aids in identifying the risks on those devices and implementing policy to protect enterprise data, says Domingo Guerra, president and founder of Appthority.

episodes.title: The BYOD Challenge
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What are the top challenges with the bring-your-own-device trend? Stephen Midgley, vice president of global marketing at Absolute Software, says the top issue is organizations not knowing where their data is located.

episodes.title: What Malware is Telling Us
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The techniques employed by advanced threats aren't particularly sophisticated. It's the intellect and infrastructure behind them that create greater risks, says David Scholtz, CEO of Damballa.

episodes.title: The Rise of Application-Layer Attacks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Conventional DDoS attacks are a nuisance, but the rise of application-layer attacks is a real concern, says Vann Abernethy of NSFOCUS. What are the risks, and how can organizations mitigate them?

episodes.title: Breach Response: What Not to Do
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What is one of the most common mistakes organizations make when they uncover a data breach? Brian Laing of AhnLab tells how a seemingly innocent response often leads to costly consequences.

episodes.title: An Adversarial View of Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The information security industry needs to hit rock bottom, says Akamai's Joshua Corman. And then - to truly improve information risk management - it needs to develop a new, adversarial view of the world.

episodes.title: The Global View of DDoS
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Globally, across industries, DDoS attacks are getting larger, says Susan Warner of Neustar. But are the attacks aimed more at disrupting organizations, or distracting them, so fraud can be committed?

episodes.title: The Case for Breach Response
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In the face of advanced threats, organizations need to shift their security posture from breach prevention to incident response, says Tom Cross of Lancope, who discusses new strategies.

episodes.title: A New Look at Mobile Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Mobile device management and application security are just two aspects to consider. What about network security? Dave Jevans of Marble Security discusses a three-tiered approach to mobile security.

episodes.title: Next-Gen Firewall Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Misconfigured firewalls aren't necessarily a result of technical issues. Often, there are business or staff issues that can be easily addressed to improve security. Jerry Skurla of FireMon explains how.

episodes.title: ACH Fraud Cases: Lessons for Banks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Former federal banking examiner Amy McHugh says banks can learn a lot from recent legal decisions and settlements in account takeover cases, including which authentication and online-banking security investments they should make.

episodes.title: Responding to State-Sponsored Attacks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: State-sponsored attacks are up significantly, so organizations need to rely on new, stronger controls to ward off advanced threats. John Gordineer of Dell SonicWALL discusses the role of next-generation firewalls.

episodes.title: The New GRC Agenda
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Over the past decade, many organizations shifted their security focus from regulatory compliance to metrics business intelligence. What's the latest shift? Vivek Shivananda of Rsam explains.

episodes.title: How to Leverage Threat Intelligence
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Who are the threat actors, what are their techniques and when are they apt to attack? This is the type of threat intelligence all organizations need, says Scott Kaine of Cyveillance.

episodes.title: Mobile Security of Corporate Data
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The mobile security focus has shifted from basic block-and-tackling to ensuring better productivity and corporate data protection, says Jonathan Dale of Fiberlink. What new challenges are posed?

episodes.title: Defending Against Advanced Threats
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The advanced persistent threat is top of mind for all organizations. Either they are dealing with it now, or preparing their defenses just in case. Robert Berlin of Fortinet offers security insight.

episodes.title: Defining Next-Generation Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: We're already seeing the next generation of advanced security threats, so now is the time for organizations to adopt next-gen security defenses. Brian Hazzard of Bit9 explains how.

episodes.title: Where Is the "S" in GRC?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Organizations generally do a good job focusing on governance, risk and compliance. But breaches add up, and LockPath CEO Chris Caldwell wonders "Where is the 'S' in GRC?" - where is the security?

episodes.title: The Power of Access Intelligence
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Access is a two-edged sword. Organizations need to open systems to employees, partners and customers. But they also must keep out threat actors. Douglas Mow of Courion talks about finding a balance.

episodes.title: Tips on Preparing for IPv6
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The implementation of IPv6, the new Internet communications protocol, will have a major impact on identity and access management. EMC researcher Davi Ottenheimer explains how organizations should prepare.

episodes.title: DLP: Engage the End-User
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Data loss prevention strategies are shifting. Organizations are now turning to end-users to help protect critical data. Stephane Charbonneau of Titus discusses how to engage users to improve security.

episodes.title: NSA Leak: Lessons for CISOs, CPOs
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Security and privacy professionals should be cautious about the type of information they share with the federal government's intelligence community, says Peter Swire, a former White House privacy counselor.

episodes.title: CIA's Ex-CISO on Preventing Leaks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Robert Bigman, former CISO at the CIA, says many government agencies and other organizations have yet to take adequate steps to prevent rogue systems administrators from accessing sensitive information on systems they manage.

episodes.title: FFIEC: Impact on Account Takeover
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Reports of account takeover incidents have increased in the last 18 months, yet losses have remained steady, says former federal banking examiner Amy McHugh, who analyzes what security measures are working and what still needs to be done.

episodes.title: Laying Foundation for Next-Gen Workforce
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: RSA Chief Information Security Officer Eddie Schwartz is heading a new task force that he hopes will help develop the next generation's well-trained, rightly skilled cybersecurity workforce.

episodes.title: Expanding Global Threat Data Sharing
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cyberthreats, including distributed-denial-of-service attacks, are growing worldwide. So FS-ISAC is expanding its information sharing efforts internationally to help financial institutions counter the threats, says Bill Nelson, the organization's president.

episodes.title: Intel's Harkins on Mobile Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Most organizations rate their mobile device security efforts as poor, in need of improvement or just adequate, according to the latest ISMG survey. So where are the security gaps? Malcolm Harkins of Intel offers insights.

episodes.title: Threat Info Shared Even Without CISPA
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Whether or not Congress enacts cyberthreat intelligence sharing legislation, the IT security community is moving forward with its own information sharing initiatives, MS-ISAC Chairman William Pelgrin says.

episodes.title: Preparing for Cyber Patent Disputes
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Patent infringement lawsuits that involve security practices are becoming more common in heavily-regulated industries. Organizations need to take several steps to be well-prepared, advises patent attorney James Denaro.

episodes.title: 3 Cybersecurity Game Changers
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What are the top three cybersecurity game changers, and what negative impact can they have on organizations if security leaders do not manage them properly? Rolf von Roessing of ISACA shares insight.

episodes.title: Taking Down Botnets
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Moscow-based cyber-intelligence firm Group-IB facilitates botnet takedowns throughout the world. Here, the firm's CTO explains how Group-IB and law enforcement curb cross-border cybercrime.

episodes.title: The Case for a 'Borderless' Breach Law
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The best argument for enactment of a federal data breach protection law to replace 46 state statutes is that physical location is not relevant in a society that relies on mobile technologies, says public policy advocate David Valdez.

episodes.title: Defending Against Hacktivist Attacks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Recent DDoS attacks on banks are prime examples of the new age of ideological threats to organizations across all industries. Who are the threat actors, and how can organizations best manage risks?

episodes.title: More Litigation Against Retailers Expected
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Losses linked to retail breaches have fueled class action lawsuits on behalf of consumers. But Javelin's Al Pascual says banks are soon likely to take legal action, too, in breach cases that expose cards and lead to fraud.

episodes.title: NIST Readies Incident Coordination Guide
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A new incident response publication coming from the National Institute of Standards and Technology will include guidance on how to form circles of trust - networks of IT security experts spanning multiple organizations, says NIST's Lee Badger.

episodes.title: The Path to Accelerated Breach Response
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: At a time of heightened cybersecurity threats, few organizations have processes for employees at all levels to report breaches. It's time for accelerated breach response, says attorney Ellen Giblin.

episodes.title: BITS on Low-Tech Ways to Fight Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When it comes to fighting fraud, technology can only go so far, says Nancy Guglielmo of BITS. So, how can banking institutions truly correct the user behavior that enables many fraud schemes?

episodes.title: Bill Endorses Obama Cybersecurity Plans
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Draft legislation circulating in the Senate, if enacted, would serve as Congress' endorsement of President Obama's order to create best practices that industry could voluntarily adopt, says Jacob Olcott, the former counsel to the committee that wrote the bill.

episodes.title: Who Owns Your Social Media Assets?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As social media use grows, so do the risks of organizations getting caught up in costly legal disputes over ownership and assets. Alan Brill of Kroll advises on how to mitigate such risks.

episodes.title: Legal Tips for Managing Social Media
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Organizations increasingly engage with customers via social media, but managers often fail to incorporate or enforce key policies. Attorney David Adler offers tips to improve social media management.

episodes.title: 'Is My Security Program Protecting My Business?'
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: It's an increasingly common question from CEOs. "How is our security program protecting the business?" Pamela Gupta of OutSecure shares insight on what CISOs should demonstrate when they answer that question.

episodes.title: Indictments: New Clues Into Fraud Schemes
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Kim Peretti, the ex-prosecutor who helped nab Heartland hacker Albert Gonzalez, says recent indictments offer insights into the actors behind global fraud schemes that affected 160 million cardholders.

episodes.title: Hotline's New Use: Avert Cyber Disaster
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The hotline, the communications link established between Washington and Moscow during the Cold War to avert a nuclear war, is being used to warn of potential cyber and environmental crises, the State Department's Christopher Painter says.

episodes.title: Diplomat: Security, Openness Can Co-Exist
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The best ideas to secure the Internet do not come from the top-down government approach imposed by some foreign governments, but from the openness derived by a multi-stakeholder process, says Christopher Painter, America's top cyber diplomat.

episodes.title: Addressing Mobile Payments Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Because mobile payments are so new, banking institutions worldwide are still trying to understand which threats to address first, says payments fraud expert Neira Jones.

episodes.title: Exit Interview: DHS's Bruce McConnell
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Though others deemed Bruce McConnell as one of the government's most innovative security thought-leaders, he says his vision of how best to secure IT evolved during his just-ended 4-year tenure at DHS as a senior cybersecurity policymaker.

episodes.title: Information Sharing: What's Missing?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Organizations won't effectively share cyberthreat intelligence until they have more efficient ways of gathering and prioritizing data, says EMC's Kathleen Moriarty, author of a new report about information sharing weaknesses.

episodes.title: FFIEC: Managing Cloud Vendors
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The FFIEC's 2012 guidelines for cloud providers highlight due diligence, and institutions that don't adequately screen vendors face trouble. Troy Wunderlich of Washington Trust Bank offers tips.

episodes.title: Re-Assessing DDoS: The Lessons Learned
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: It's time to start thinking about the next wave of DDoS attacks, says Neustar's Rodney Joffe. And it's time for other critical infrastructure industries - not just banks - to assess their risks.

episodes.title: PCI 3.0 Draft Guidelines Released
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Version 3.0 of the PCI Data Security Standard is coming, and draft guidelines reflect the impact of recent retail breaches. PCI GM Bob Russo explains big changes to ensuring payment card security.

episodes.title: Confronting Iran as a Cyber-Adversary
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The old saw of a blind squirrel fortuitously finding an acorn reminds the Atlantic Council's Jason Healey of cyber-assailants from third-rate cyber-power Iran, believed to be behind DDoS attacks on U.S. banks.

episodes.title: Can DHS Be Trusted to Protect Gov't IT?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Bruce McConnell, who just stepped down as one of the federal government's top cybersecurity policymakers, says he understands why some lawmakers don't trust DHS with significant authority to safeguard government IT.

episodes.title: Facing the Advanced Threat
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Today's advanced threats are no secret. Focusing the correct resources on them is the true challenge, says Will Irace of General Dynamics Fidelis Cybersecurity Solutions. He offers tips for harnessing the right skills and technology.

episodes.title: Why 'Clueless' Consumers Need Education
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Banking institutions have done a poor job of educating consumers about payments fraud prevention, says Aite analyst Shirley Inscoe. "Banks need to figure out how to communicate with consumers in a way consumers understand."

episodes.title: Impact of Big Data on Privacy Policy
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Because big data brings significant benefits - and risks - CEOs and boards of directors must take charge of developing privacy protection policies, ISACA International Vice President Jeff Spivey says.

episodes.title: Fraudsters Banking on Phishing
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Phishing attempts against bank employees are on the rise. How can institutions improve their defenses? Daniel Ingevaldson of Easy Solutions offers insights on how to combat advanced phishing techniques.

episodes.title: Expanding Continuous Diagnostic Effort
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: John Streufert, the DHS director overseeing the rollout of a federal continuous diagnostic initiative to mitigate IT systems vulnerabilities, expects that many state and local governments will participate in the program.

episodes.title: Warning: A New DDoS-Fraud Link
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Gartner analyst Avivah Litan says fraudsters are using DDoS attacks as a distraction for a new, extremely effective account takeover scheme. How should institutions respond to this emerging threat?

episodes.title: The Challenge of Attributing Fraud Losses
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Fraud is increasing across the board, but attributing losses to certain types of fraud continues to pose challenges for many banking institutions, says Doug Johnson of the American Bankers Association.

episodes.title: Tracking the Fraud Lifecycle
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What are the distinct phases of the fraud lifecycle, and how can banking institutions intervene at each stage to prevent losses? Daniel Ingevaldson of Easy Solutions offers fraud-fighting tips.

episodes.title: DDoS: The Need for Updated Defenses
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In the wake of a year of attacks waged against banking institutions by Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Cyber Fighters, the FS-ISAC's Bill Nelson and the ABA's Doug Johnson say the need to regularly update DDoS preparedness is a critical lesson learned.

episodes.title: Why Call Center Fraud Succeeds
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Many banking institutions have done a poor job of addressing call-center fraud, says IDC analyst Jerry Silva, who offers tips on addressing the challenge of balancing customer service with security.

episodes.title: Account Takeover: The Fraudsters' Edge
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Account takeover fraud is growing globally, and it's not just banks that are suffering, says analyst Julie Conroy. Here, Conroy explains why fraudsters continually have the upper hand.

episodes.title: Implementing Continuous Monitoring Plan
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The massive initiative to deploy continuous monitoring at U.S. federal government agencies will be done in phases, with the initial rollout occurring over three years, the Department of Homeland Security's John Streufert says.

episodes.title: Business Continuity: What's Overlooked?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When building a business continuity plan, banking institutions too often overlook certain key processes that must be maintained after a cyber-attack or a disaster, says Dan Shannon of core banking processor FIS.

episodes.title: SMU's New Cybersecurity Mission
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In response to today's cybersecurity challenges, Southern Methodist University has selected Frederick Chang to head a new program that will address top issues - including how to fill the skills gap.

episodes.title: Banks Plan National Cyber-Attack Drill
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: More than 1,000 banks will test their incident response strategies by participating in a simulated cyber-attack exercise. SWACHA's Dennis Simmons says the drill, which is open to more participants, will help bolster defenses.

episodes.title: Pitfalls of Professionalizing InfoSec
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Professionalizing occupations within the cybersecurity field won't necessarily help fill vacant IT security jobs in government and industry, says Diana Burley, an IT security workforce expert.

episodes.title: PCI Updates Address Retail Breaches
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Mitigating card risks associated with retail malware attacks and POS vulnerabilities is a focus of updates to the PCI Data Security Standard, say Bob Russo and Troy Leach of the PCI Security Standards Council.

episodes.title: Small Businesses at Greater Fraud Risk
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Small business owners are concerned about fraud, but few implement measures to adequately protect themselves and their accounts, say Michelle Di Gangi and David Pollino of Bank of the West.

episodes.title: Helping Businesses With Cybersecurity
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Mary Galligan, the just-retired head of the FBI's New York cyber unit, says the federal government can do more to help businesses take all the right steps to protect sensitive information and prevent breaches.

episodes.title: Cybersecurity, Trade on Collision Course
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Nations' policies for mitigating cyberthreats can conflict with efforts to promote cyber-enabled global trade, cautions Allan Friedman, research director of the Brookings Institution's Center for Technology Innovation.

episodes.title: Attackers-for-Hire: A Troubling Trend
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Attacks waged for cyber-espionage, fraud, DDoS and other nefarious deeds are increasingly being hired out to sophisticated hackers for specific purposes, says Symantec researcher Kevin Haley.

episodes.title: Purdue's Spafford on Educating Executives
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: To mark his induction into the National Cyber Security Hall of Fame, Purdue University Computer Science Professor Eugene Spafford offers insights on key challenges, including overcoming senior executives' misperceptions about key issues.

episodes.title: Gartner's Litan on Fixing Authentication
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Knowledge-based authentication is no longer reliable, says fraud expert Avivah Litan, an analyst at Gartner. She explains why so-called behavioral authentication is the only reliable way to verify users.

episodes.title: Insights on Fighting Call Center Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Face-to-face and over-the-phone social-engineering schemes are increasingly used to perpetrate fraud, highlighting the need for more education and real-time transaction monitoring, says Gartner's Avivah Litan.

episodes.title: Finding New Ways to Fight Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Banking institutions and merchants are fighting back against cyber-attacks by sharing information and assisting law enforcement investigations, says Julie Conroy of Aite, which has issued a report about account takeover and cyberfraud trends.

episodes.title: How to Fight Insider Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The average insider scheme lasts 32 months before it's detected, says threat researcher Jason Clark, who suggests using a combination of the right technologies and the right processes is the key to improving detection.

episodes.title: Continuous Monitoring and Mitigation
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What are some of the unique challenges organizations face when they move into continuous monitoring and risk mitigation? Scott Gordon of ForeScout and Ken Pfeil of Pioneer Investments offer insight.

episodes.title: Hostile Profile Takeover: The Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What is hostile profile takeover, and why does this emerging threat pose such a risk to smart phone users? Dave Jevans, CTO of Marble Security, describes this and other new mobile threats.

episodes.title: Breach Response: Lessons Learned
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The number of reported breaches is up considerably this year, but so is the overall quality of organizations' breach preparedness, says Michael Bruemmer of Experian Data Breach Resolution.

episodes.title: CISOs Balance Risk, Tech Obligations
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: IT security leaders need to develop a strong, holistic security and risk management strategy as they implement advanced, strategic technical capabilities, IBM's David Jarvis says in analyzing new survey results.

episodes.title: Building a 'Defensible' Breach Response
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Organizations must develop a "defensible response" to data breaches and fraud incidents because of the likelihood of a regulatory investigation or legal action, says attorney Kim Peretti, a former Department of Justice cybercrime prosecutor.

episodes.title: Prosecutor Offers Fraud-Fighting Advice
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Rather than waiting until they're a breach victim, organizations should reach out to law enforcement officials to develop a good working relationship in battling cybercrimes, federal prosecutor Erez Liebermann says.

episodes.title: Synthetic IDs: Understanding the Threat
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Using "synthetic identities" to commit fraud is becoming easier, but it's increasingly difficult for organizations to detect this type of deception, says Claudel Chery of the U.S. Postal Inspection Service.

episodes.title: Reasonable Security: Changing the Rules
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Article 4A of the Uniform Commercial Code, which deals with reasonable security measures for banks, needs a major update, says attorney Dan Mitchell, who represented PATCO Construction in a high-profile account takeover dispute.

episodes.title: DDoS: What to Expect Next
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The good news is: U.S. banks have learned valuable security lessons from defending against recent distributed-denial-of-service attacks. The bad news? DDoS has evolved into new and improved assaults.

episodes.title: What is Unintentional Insider Threat?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: For years, researchers have studied malicious insider threats. But how can organizations protect themselves from insiders who make a mistake or are taken advantage of in a way that puts the organization at risk?

episodes.title: State Launches Single Identity Pilot
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Pennsylvania Chief Information Security Officer Erik Avakian explains how the commonwealth is using a $1.1 million federal grant to pilot a program to furnish single identities to residents who transact state business over the Internet.
