episodes.title: Governing the 'Internet of Things'
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Every second, 80 "things" are being connected to the Internet, and ISACA's Rob Stroud says that requires information security professionals to identify and mitigate threats, protect individuals' privacy and manage access.

episodes.title: Obama, FIs Talk Cybersecurity
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Banking executives were among the CEOs who met with President Obama at the White House to discuss cybersecurity strategies. Paul Smocer of BITS explains how this discussion may pay off for financial institutions.

episodes.title: How to Fight Cross-Border ATM Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: ATM cash-outs and card-skimming schemes are getting more difficult to detect because today's attacks are global, coordinated and sophisticated, says ATM security expert Chuck Somers.

episodes.title: PCI Update: Focus on Third-Party Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: New requirements to mitigate payment card risks posed by third parties, such as cloud providers and payment processors, are a focal point of the PCI Security Standards Council's updated data security standard.

episodes.title: ENISA on the New Threat Landscape
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cyberthreats increasingly target mobile devices, and simple security measures could help end-users slash these incidents by 50 percent. This is the key finding of ENISA's new Threat Landscape Report, says Louis Marinos, the prime author.

episodes.title: New Encryption Tools for the Cloud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Computer scientists at the Georgia Institute of Technology are developing new ways to apply encryption when storing or searching data in the cloud, says Paul Royal, associate director of the university's information security center.

episodes.title: Contain Mobile Security Threats
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Mobile security is no longer about managing devices, says Ian McWilton of Moka5. The real trick is to secure corporate assets through containerization solutions that reduce costs and improve user experience.

episodes.title: Today's Greatest Online Payment Risk
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Inadequate authentication is among the greatest security challenges for online payments, says Scott Dueweke of Booz Allen Hamilton, who suggests biometrics needs to play a bigger role.

episodes.title: State Creates 'Cyber National Guard'
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As Michigan deploys its Cyber Civilian Corps, the state  will need to address some of the same challenges the federal government faces in sharing cyberthreat information between the government and the private sector, state CIO David Behen says.

episodes.title: Mobile Security: Top Priority for 2014
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Shoring up mobile security gaps should be a top 2014 priority for financial institutions, says Gartner analyst Anton Chuvakin, who contends many other security issues, including managing cloud vendors and other third parties, aren't so urgent.

episodes.title: Creating Valuable Cybersecurity Metrics
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Organizations need to know how other enterprises handle cyber-attacks to truly understand whether their IT security investments will pay off, the EastWest Institute's Karl Rauscher says.

episodes.title: How to Minimize Supply Chain Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: For risk managers, an often overlooked step for minimizing supply chain risks is to continually monitor outsourcers and other third parties to address critical security issues, says the Information Security Forum's Steve Durbin.

episodes.title: Prosecutor: ID Theft Top Fraud Concern
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: U.S. Attorney Steve Wiggington says identity theft, especially linked to card skimming, is still the No. 1 fraud threat facing financial services institutions as well as consumers. He stresses information sharing is critical for fighting fraud.

episodes.title: Limiting Third-Party Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Wayne Dunn, CTO of HarborOne Bank in New England, says improving vendor management is a top security priority for institutions in 2014. As more core banking functions are outsourced, due diligence becomes increasingly critical.

episodes.title: Questioning the Culture of Surveillance
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: You can be outraged that the NSA collects Internet communications records of U.S. citizens. But don't be surprised, says sociologist William Staples. This is just one example of our "culture of surveillance."

episodes.title: Cloud Security: Top 10 Tips
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Governments and others using cloud-based services should keep 10 security tips in mind, including making sure they can maintain control of their data if a service provider goes bankrupt, says Dimitra Liveri, co-author of a new report.

episodes.title: How EMV Will Change Banking Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As U.S. banking institutions make the EMV migration, fraud will migrate from payments cards to areas such as check and first-party fraud, says Fiserv's Mike Urban. How must institutions prepare?

episodes.title: Push for Patent Reform Advances
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In the wake of a surge of lawsuits, bipartisan Congressional support is building for a measure designed to help protect banking institutions from frivolous patent infringement claims, says NAFCU's Brad Thaler.

episodes.title: How Secure is Virtual Currency?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: U.S. banking institutions need to develop payments strategies to deal with virtual currencies, such as Bitcoin, even if the security risks are not yet fully understood, says Fiserv's Mike Urban.

episodes.title: Major Password Breach: Lessons Learned
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The theft of 2 million credentials reminds security professionals that their organizations are at risk because many employees use the same passwords and devices for personal and business purposes, data security lawyer Ronald Raether says.

episodes.title: How Will NIST Framework Affect Banks?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The NIST cybersecurity framework will help U.S. banking institutions assess their security strategies, but some institutions fear the framework could trigger unnecessary regulations, says Bill Stewart of Booz Allen Hamilton.

episodes.title: Creating Role-Based Security Training
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Managers at all levels must understand their responsibilities in providing role-based cybersecurity training, says Patricia Toth, a computer scientist at the National Institute of Standards and Technology.

episodes.title: Breach Predictions for 2014
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: 2014 is going to be a critical year for data breach preparation and response, according to Michael Bruemmer of Experian. What are the key breach-related developments that security leaders must watch?

episodes.title: Fighting Fraud With ID Management
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Most fraud on the Internet is linked to unsecured identities, which is why a new global identification framework is needed, says Paul Simmonds, who heads a coalition working on a framework model.

episodes.title: Timely Advice on IAM, Asset Management
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cybersecurity risks posed by inadequate IAM and IT asset management are mounting. Now the National Cybersecurity Center of Excellence has drafted guidance to address banking institutions' unique risks, says Nate Lesser, the center's deputy director.

episodes.title: EMV: The Outlook for 2014
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: While the U.S. migration toward EMV card technology may have been jolted by a July court ruling, Randy Vanderhoof of the Smart Card Alliance contends the movement toward EMV will accelerate in 2014.

episodes.title: The 2014 Anti-Fraud Agenda
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: U.S. banks stopped $9 out of every $10 of attempted deposit account fraud in 2012, according to a new ABA Fraud Survey Report. What are they doing right, and how must they improve fraud prevention in 2014?

episodes.title: Target Breach: A Watershed Event
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The breach at Target stores that may have affected as many as 40 million credit and debit card account holders is a watershed moment that could greatly raise awareness of cybersecurity risks, says privacy attorney David Navetta.

episodes.title: 5 Resolutions for IT Security Pros
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: 2014 may well be the "Year of Security," and IT security pros must prepare now for new job demands. ISACA's Robert Stroud offers five New Year's resolutions to help prepare for 2014's security trends.

episodes.title: Improving the Way to Manage Risk
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: While preparing a speech to be delivered in Korea, NIST's Ron Ross wanted to convey  the message of the importance of computer security. He hit on five themes - threat, assets, complexity, integration and trustworthiness - which form the acronym TACIT.

episodes.title: 2014 Cybersecurity Forecast
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As a result of high-profile breaches, such as the Target incident, security is increasingly a board issue. What are the key topics security leaders should prepare to discuss in 2014? Alan Brill of Kroll offers his forecast.

episodes.title: Reworking Framework's Privacy Approach
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A preliminary version of the cybersecurity framework takes a too-broad approach to privacy, says security and privacy attorney Harriet Pearson. And that could result in fewer organizations adopting the voluntary security guidelines.

episodes.title: Mobile Security Case Study
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As bank employees rely more on mobile devices to get their work done, ensuring secure file-sharing is a top priority. James Gordon of Needham Bank in Massachusetts shares his security strategy.

episodes.title: Why Training Doesn't Mitigate Phishing
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Training that's designed to help workers avoid clicking on links from spear-phishing e-mails may be ineffective because employees often fail to read training materials, says Eric Johnson, a Vanderbilt University professor who's co-author of a new study on the subject.

episodes.title: How to Fight Prepaid Card Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Increasingly sophisticated prepaid card fraud is affecting more banking channels. Payments fraud expert Tom Wills offers insights on what banking institutions can do to mitigate this threat.

episodes.title: Financial Trojans: What to Expect in 2014
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In 2013, financial Trojans targeted more than 1,400 institutions in 88 countries - and these attacks are only growing. Symantec's Vikram Thakur tells how organizations can combat attackers in 2014.

episodes.title: FIDO's 2014 Authentication Agenda
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: To help reduce reliance on passwords, the FIDO Alliance is developing standard technical specifications for advanced authentication. Michael Barrett and Daniel Almenara of FIDO describe the impact the effort could have in 2014.

episodes.title: Background Screening: Top 10 Trends
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The new year's top trends in background screening can be summed up in two words: legal and compliance. Les Rosen of Employment Screening Resources offers expert tips for more effective screening.

episodes.title: 5 Trends to Sway Cybersecurity's Future
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Five significant trends, including the mobile revolution and the use of big data, will influence the future of cybersecurity, says Allan Friedman, co-author of a new book on the subject.

episodes.title: DDoS: The Next-Generation Solution
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In 2013, attackers proved that sophisticated DDoS attacks could be launched as effective disruptions and distractions. What are the evolving solutions that now help organizations mitigate these strikes?

episodes.title: Breaches Expose Payments System Flaws
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In the wake of the Target and Neiman Marcus data breaches, Steve Kenneally of the American Bankers Association calls for greater security and accountability throughout the U.S. payments system.

episodes.title: Ethics & Technology: The Disconnect
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Technology is the biggest challenge to ethics and compliance in organizations today, says Deloitte's Keith Darcy. "We have the capacity to do things before we ever consider the ethical consequences ..."

episodes.title: Exclusive: Inside Cisco Security Report
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: From new malware to the Target breach, cyber-attacks reached an all-time high in 2013, says Cisco's Annual Security Report. Cyberthreat expert Levi Gundert tells how organizations can regain the advantage in 2014.

episodes.title: Network Security: Enhancing Visibility Through Integration
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: From access controls to intrusion detection, mobility to privacy, many organizations face similar network security challenges. Isabelle Dumont of Palo Alto networks offers a new, unique approach for healthcare organizations, and the key concepts of this approach can be applied to any security environment.

episodes.title: Target Malware: Exploring the Origins
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Dan Clements of IntelCrawler, the research firm that claims it traced malware apparently used in the Target breach and other retailer attacks to a 17-year-old hacker in Russia, offers an exclusive, in-depth explanation of his company's findings.

episodes.title: iPhone App Offers Breach Law Guide
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A new, free iPhone app is designed to help organizations navigate 46 state data breach notification laws as well as federal statutes, such as HIPAA, attorney Scott Vernick says.

episodes.title: Records Exposed Hit New High in 2013
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cybercriminals exploiting weaknesses in how users employ passwords is a significant factor behind an increase in records exposed in breaches during 2013, says Craig Spiezle of the Online Trust Alliance.

episodes.title: The Global State of Privacy
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Amidst draft legislation and the fallout of large-scale breaches, now is both the best and worst of times for privacy, says Trevor Hughes of the IAPP. What are the best career opportunities for privacy pros?

episodes.title: RSA 2014: A Preview
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Expanded with more educational tracks and sessions on emerging hot topics, the 2014 edition of the RSA Conference will be the largest ever, says Hugh Thompson, program committee chair.

episodes.title: DHS Report Researcher: Retailers at Risk
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Retail data breaches are growing. ISight Partners' Tiffany Jones, a researcher who helped the Department of Homeland Security prepare its report about malware attacks, offers new insight into the latest cyber-attacks.

episodes.title: PCI Council Responds to Critics
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The PCI Security Standards Council has no plans to modify its standards for payment card data security in response to high-profile payment card breaches at Target and Neiman Marcus, says Bob Russo, the council's general manager.

episodes.title: Compensating Banks for Breaches
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When breaches result from retailers' lax security practices, merchants should be obligated to help banking institutions cover fraud losses and other post-breach expenses, says Viveca Ware of the Independent Community Bankers of America.

episodes.title: Card Breaches Pose Greatest Fraud Risk
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A new identity fraud study shows that consumers who are victims of a payment card breach are at greater risk of fraud than victims of other types of breaches, says Al Pascual of Javelin.

episodes.title: 5 Ways to Improve PCI Compliance
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Organizations in all sectors can improve their compliance with the PCI Data Security Standard by taking five critical steps, says Rodolphe Simonetti of Verizon Enterprise Solutions, which just issued a new PCI compliance report.

episodes.title: Building a 'One-Shot' Memory Device
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Employing quantum physics, Yi-Kai Liu, a computer scientist at the National Institute of Standards and Technology, is attempting to devise a way to create a one-shot memory device that could help secure transactions or administrative passwords.

episodes.title: Target Breach: The Cost to Banks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Expenses linked to the data breach at Target Corp. have already cost the 58 member institutions of the Consumer Bankers Association more than $170 million - a price they should not have to pay, says the association's David Pommerehn.

episodes.title: Baking Privacy Into Health IT
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary:
Editor's Note: Excerpts of this interview appear in ISMG's Security Agenda magazine, distributed at RSA Conference 2014.

Privacy should be built into the design of all healthcare information technology and related processes, says Michelle Dennedy, who's writing a book on the concept of "privacy by design."

episodes.title: An EMV Pioneer Offers Lessons Learned
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Merrill Halpern of the United Nations Federal Credit Union, a pioneer in the use of chip cards, says high-profile retail breaches reinforce the long-term value of EMV for various forms of payment within the U.S.

episodes.title: InfoSec Investments: Venture Capital's View
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What is the venture capital view of the security trends and technologies that will have the most impact on careers in 2014? Alberto YÃ©pez of Trident Capital weighs in with his insights and predictions.

episodes.title: Securing the Smart Grid
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Distributed generation and plug-in motor vehicles are among the emerging security challenges to the smart grid. In an RSA 2014 preview, Gib Sorebo of Leidos discusses the threats to utilities and consumers.

episodes.title: HSBC Requires Dual Authentication
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In a groundbreaking effort to boost security, HSBC Bank USA is now requiring its retail banking customers to use dual-factor authentication for certain sensitive online banking transactions, says LuAnne Kingston, senior vice president.

episodes.title: iBoss Offers Behavioral Analysis
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The gateway security solutions provider iBoss Network Security is enhancing its offerings by incorporating analysis of behavioral movement of traffic in and out of the network.

episodes.title: Improving Encryption Management
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As organizations expand their use of encryption to help prevent breaches, they must improve their management of cryptographic keys, says Prakash Panjwani, senior vice president at SafeNet.

episodes.title: The API as an Attack Vector
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The application programming interface is now an attack vector, which creates new security issues, warns Travis Broughton, IT architect at Intel.

episodes.title: Fighting Phone Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: While much of the security focus is on online fraud and major data breaches, organizations of all sizes and sectors are seeing a rise in phone-based fraud, says Matt Anthony of Pindrop Security.

episodes.title: Log Analysis for Breach Prevention
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Log analysis is often used for managed security, but are organizations going far enough with the information they have at their fingertips? Don Gray, chief security strategist for Solutionary, says there is much more organizations could be doing to predict breaches.

episodes.title: Cryptocurrency an Easy Target
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Researchers at Dell SecureWorks have identified some 146 unique malware families that are targeting cryptocurrencies. Approximately 100 of those  have emerged in just the last year, says Pat Litke, security analysis adviser for the company's CyberThreat unit.

episodes.title: Security: Going Beyond Compliance
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: While most organizations are focusing on compliance, they are ignoring basic human-factor security risks that technology cannot fix, says Hord Tipton, executive director of the International Systems Security Certification Consortium, better known as (ISC)Â².

episodes.title: 2014 Fraud Prevention: 2 Key Steps
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Two critical steps that banking institutions need to take in 2014 to help prevent fraud are implementing big data analytics and adopting far more sophisticated customer and employee authentication, says Gartner analyst Avivah Litan.

episodes.title: How Mobile Hacks Threaten Enterprise
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Among the biggest cyberthreats enterprises face comes from hacks on consumer mobile devices, says Caleb Barlow, a director of product management at IBM Security.

episodes.title: Securing Network Architecture
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Although the growth of cloud-based data centers offers opportunities to more rapidly deploy applications, it also raises new security issues, says Steve Pao, senior vice president at Barracuda Networks.

episodes.title: Real Threat Intelligence
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Everyone is talking about threat intelligence, but what are the characteristics that make it useful? David Duncan of Webroot offers insights on new solutions and partnerships.

episodes.title: How to Improve Cybercrime Tracking
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: With enhanced analytics, organizations and law enforcement are improving their ability to trace malware attacks and other advanced persistent threats, says Eward Driehuis of Fox-IT.

episodes.title: Automating Data Analysis
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: By automating data analysis, organizations can enhance their threat intelligence and lessen their workloads, says Flint Brenton, president and CEO of AccelOps.

episodes.title: Advanced Threat Defense
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Advanced, ever-evolving threats call for security solutions vendors to counter with equally advanced and sophisticated solutions. JD Sherry of Trend Micro discusses new strategic alliances and product sets dedicated to creating new measures of threat defense.

episodes.title: Insights on Enhancing Authentication
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Too many businesses are worried about how security might adversely affect the user experience, even among their own workforce, says Bert Rankin, chief marketing officer of ThreatMetrix.

episodes.title: Cisco Unveils Open Source Initiative
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cisco has launched a new open source initiative focused on application identification, says Scott Harrell, vice president of the company's security business group.

episodes.title: Cyberthreat Protection Evolves
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The increasing use of cloud-based resources requires a new approach to protection against cyberthreats, says Ashley Stephenson, CEO at Corero Network Security.

episodes.title: The Evolving Threatscape
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Traditional fraud has evolved in complexity, changing the threat landscape dramatically. Greg Maudsley and Preston Hogue of F5 discuss new strategies to mitigate evolving threats.

episodes.title: DDoS Attacks Continue to Grow
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Neustar is about to release a new report on the DDoS threat landscape. What are some of the key trends to watch? Neustar's Jim Fink offers a preview of the study's findings.

episodes.title: FIDO: Beyond 'Simple' Authentication
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Simple credentials, such as passwords, are a hacker's best friend, says Phillip Dunkelberger of Nok Nok Labs, a founding member of the FIDO Alliance. That's why the alliance is working to reduce reliance on passwords by enabling advanced authentication.

episodes.title: CipherCloud Unveils New Platform
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: CipherCloud's Paige Leidig discusses a new offering that helps enable organizations rapidly adopt a cloud application as it protects sensitive data and ensures compliance to policies and regulations.

episodes.title: Security Professionals: Time to Step Up
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In the wake of high-profile breaches and data leaks, the government will pay a lot more attention to information security. Are security pros ready for this scrutiny? Professor Eugene Spafford has his doubts.

episodes.title: DDoS: More Defenses Needed
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: While January's seemingly isolated distributed-denial-of-service attacks against JPMorgan Chase and Bank of America may have been a blip, DDoS expert Barrett Lyon says stronger attacks are on the way.

episodes.title: 2014 Brings Shift in Cyber-Attacks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: While massive DDoS attacks were dominant in 2013, this year, smaller application-layer attacks going after such things as log-in pages and password files are far more common, says Rich Bolstridge, chief strategist, financial services, at Akamai Technologies.

episodes.title: Continuous Diagnostics: A Game Changer
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Phyllis Schneck, the Department of Homeland Security's deputy undersecretary for cybersecurity, equates the department's continuous diagnostics and mitigation initiative with a medical probe detecting an infection in the human body.

episodes.title: The Impact of Bit9, Carbon Black Merger
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The recent merger of Bit9 and Carbon Black will eventually result in a single, merged product offering, says Benjamin Johnson, CTO at Carbon Black.

episodes.title: Keys to Secure Content Sharing
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As content sharing via mobile devices becomes more common, organizations must make sure security issues are adequately addressed, says Hormazd Romer, senior director of product marketing at Accellion.

episodes.title: Third-Party Risks: Containment Strategy
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Mobility has driven the rise of containerization as a security strategy for employee-owned devices. But what about for contractors? Kimber Spradlin of Moka5 discusses how to mitigate third-party risks.

episodes.title: Dedicated DDoS Protection
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Distributed-denial-of-service attacks are a concern for all organizations. But financial institutions face unique challenges, and so they require a unique level of protection, says Mark Byers of Fortinet.

episodes.title: FIDO: Pushing International Buy-In
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: One key factor in efforts to reduce reliance on passwords for authentication will be international acceptance of the FIDO Alliance's soon-to-be released protocol for advanced authentication, says Michael Barrett, the alliance's president.

episodes.title: BofA on Mobile Payments Trends
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Although adoption of mobile banking is accelerating, mobile payments have yet to reach a tipping point and security issues need to be addressed, says Marc Warshawsky of Bank of America, a mobile banking pioneer.

episodes.title: Big Data's Role in Breach Detection
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Recent data breaches, such as the ones suffered by Target Corp. and Neiman Marcus, may have been detected sooner if retailers had been sharing transactional pattern and behavioral information about their customers, says Mike Braatz of ACI Worldwide.

episodes.title: Retail Breaches: The Malware Source
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Attackers likely purchased malware in underground "cybercrime-as-a-service" markets to use in recent credit card breaches, including the Target Corp. attack, a new report from McAfee Labs asserts. Adam Wosotowsky explains the report's findings.

episodes.title: Streamlining Payments Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As banking institutions expand their payments platforms, channel integration could help not only to ensure a consistent consumer experience but also to streamline security, says Marc West of Fiserv.

episodes.title: So, You Want a Career in Privacy?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: There have never been more career options for privacy professionals. But what are the essential skills and experience for advancement? Michelle Dennedy of Intel Security discusses her career path.

episodes.title: Malware: New Attacks Evade Detection
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Banking Trojans such as Zeus have gotten much tougher to detect because of new attack techniques, which means intrusions are going undiscovered for longer periods, says Trusteer researcher Etay Maor.

episodes.title: State Marijuana Laws: The Challenges
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: New guidance from FinCEN addresses know-your-customer concerns surrounding financial transactions linked to legal marijuana businesses. Anti-money-laundering expert Kevin Sullivan sorts through the advice.

episodes.title: Why Is End-to-End Encryption So Daunting?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Retail point-of-sale breaches at Target Corp. and Neiman Marcus have put a spotlight on payment card security and encryption. But achieving true end-to-end encryption isn't easy, says data protection specialist Richard Moulds.

episodes.title: (ISC)Â² Turns 25: What's Ahead?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: (ISC)Â² is celebrating its silver anniversary as a global organization educating and certifying information security professionals. What are the key threats and trends driving the profession's future growth?

episodes.title: Advanced Threat Defense
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Advanced threats are like the weather. Everyone talks about them, but few have a solid defense plan - or even a solid understanding of the threat landscape. Mike Nichols of General Dynamics Fidelis Cybersecurity Solutions  offers insight.

episodes.title: Changing Landscape of Application Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Increasingly, organizations are seeing attacks migrate from the network to the application level. How can security leaders ensure they are prepared to handle this shift? Kunal Anand of Prevoty offers insight.

episodes.title: Career Profile: Attorney Kim Peretti
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Years before she helped put fraudster Albert Gonzalez behind bars, Kim Peretti was an attorney who had dual interests in law and technology. How did she channel her interests into a prominent career?

episodes.title: Inside the New Global Threat Report
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Even so-called minor breaches can cost organizations nearly $200,000, according to one finding from NTT Group's annual Intelligence Report. Rob Kraus of Solutionary shares the study's insights and advice.

episodes.title: Cybersecurity: Involving Senior Leaders
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: To boost cybersecurity, senior leaders - whether a CEO, a board member or a government agency director - need to think of information as a critical asset worthy of protection, risk management experts Val Rahmani and Malcolm Harkins say.

episodes.title: FFIEC on DDoS: What Are Expectations?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The FFIEC just issued new guidelines on DDoS risks to U.S. banking institutions. What is the substance of these guidelines, and how must banks and credit unions respond? Rodney Joffe of Neustar offers advice.

episodes.title: Inside Symantec's 2014 Threat Report
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Symantec's 2014 Internet Security Threat Report calls 2013 the year of the mega breach. Why? Because it's getting far too easy for the bad guys to pull off these breaches, says Symantec's Kevin Haley.

episodes.title: Heartbleed Discoverer Speaks Out
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The chief executive of the Finnish company that uncovered the Internet website vulnerability known as Heartbleed says security practitioners should rethink how they approach IT security by placing a greater emphasis on vetting software for vulnerabilities.

episodes.title: Determining Heartbleed Exfiltration
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A notion emerging from the Heartbleed bug is that organizations can't determine if the vulnerability caused data to be exfiltrated. But CERT's Will Dormann says that may not always be the case.

episodes.title: CBA: Retailer Security Needs Oversight
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Banking institutions and retailers are working to enhance cybersecurity collaboration, but the Consumer Bankers Association wants more regulatory oversight of merchants, says the CBA's David Pommerehn, a speaker at the upcoming Fraud Summit San Francisco.

episodes.title: CISO Showcase: Intel's Malcolm Harkins
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Malcolm Harkins has a unique role. He oversees both security and privacy for global technology vendor Intel. What tips does he offer individuals who seek to build careers in either discipline - or both?

episodes.title: Visa's Richey on Card Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Ellen Richey of Visa, keynoter at the April 29 Fraud Summit San Francisco, outlines key card fraud-fighting trends for the year ahead, including the U.S.'s migration toward EMV, greater use of tokenization and heightened fraud detection.

episodes.title: SWACHA CEO on Payments Careers
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Dennis Simmons, retiring CEO of SWACHA, says new career paths are being forged for IT professionals as well as legal experts who have good understandings of cybersecurity and cross-channel fraud in the world of e-commerce.

episodes.title: Verizon Report: Web App Attacks on Rise
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Verizon's latest annual breach report shows that Web application attacks increased more than malware-fueled point-of-sale intrusions in 2013, says analyst Dave Ostertag, who provides an overview of the report's findings.

episodes.title: Is CyberSec Framework Doomed to Fail?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A George Mason University research fellow says the cybersecurity framework, issued earlier this year by the National Institute of Standards and Technology, is likely to cause more problems than it solves.

episodes.title: Eric Cole to Enter Hall of Fame
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The best way to detect whether hackers have penetrated an IT system is to examine outbound traffic, says Eric Cole, the latest inductee to the Infosecurity Europe Hall of Fame.

episodes.title: Tips for Fighting Fraud with Big Data
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Most organizations, including banks, have more data than they know what to do with, says Allison Miller, a cyberthreat and data analytics expert. So why aren't they more effectively using big data analytics for fraud prevention and detection?

episodes.title: Mobile: It's Time to Play Offense
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Instead of approaching mobile defensively, banking institutions should be discussing how mobile integration can improve cross-channel security, says Jim Van Dyke of Javelin Strategy & Research.

episodes.title: First Data: How to Tackle Cyberthreats
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Paul Kleinschnitz, general manager of payment processor First Data's cybersecurity solutions team, says there are plenty of technologies to address payment card security, but cyberthreat awareness is still lacking.

episodes.title: BYOD: Building an Effective Strategy
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Too many organizations have a device-centric BYOD policy that fails to look at big picture issues, including building a comprehensive strategy for protecting corporate information no matter how it's accessed, says Ian Evans of AirWatch.

episodes.title: Fighting Threats with Behavioral Analysis
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A behavioral analysis approach to fighting malware can be more effective than a signature-based approach in the current threat environment, contends Webroot's Patrick Kennedy.

episodes.title: Cloud-Based Threat Protection
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cloud-based advanced threat protection helps organizations detect sophisticated malware that is able to bypass existing security measures. The key is to start with the premise that the network is already infected, says Seculert's Dudi Matot.

episodes.title: Reducing Cyber-Attack Response Times
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As cyber-attacks become more common, organizations must devise new ways to shorten response times and lessen the impact, says Paul Nguyen of CSG Invotas.

episodes.title: The Evolution of the Cybercriminal
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Today's cybercriminals are perfecting the use of advanced-persistent-threat attacks to pilfer valuable information from precisely targeted victims, says Greg Day of security provider FireEye.

episodes.title: Choosing the Right App Components
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The key to creating secure applications is choosing the right open source components and carefully monitoring them to ensure they remain free of defects, says Sonatype's Wai Man Yau.

episodes.title: Reassessing Information Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Organizations and security threats have changed dramatically, but many information security strategies have not - and that is a huge problem, says SafeNet's Jason Hart.

episodes.title: Understanding Vulnerability Management
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: "If you're not doing the right things on managing vulnerabilities, it doesn't really matter what other kinds of sophisticated things you do - that's the baseline for security," says BeyondTrust's Marc Maiffret.

episodes.title: Security Built Into the Code
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: For too long, code writers have been measured on the features built into their applications - not the potential security vulnerabilities. It's time to change that perspective, says Maty Siman of Checkmarx.

episodes.title: Getting Up to Speed on Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Timely analysis of data residing in an organization's information systems is a critical element of IT security, say Haiyan Song and Joe Goldberg of the security firm Splunk.

episodes.title: Protecting Credentialed Information
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Understanding the behavior patterns of individuals with access to an organization's most important credentials is one of the keys to privileged management, says CyberArk's Matt Middleton-Leal.

episodes.title: Enhancing Application Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: New technology enables organizations to protect applications against reverse engineering and tampering by cybercriminals, says Arxan Technologies' Mark Noctor, who explains how the approach works.

episodes.title: The Need for Network Visibility
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The old, standard dashboards are no longer sufficient. To be truly effective, network pros now need new data to help find and resolve network security issues, says Mike Heumann of Emulex.

episodes.title: Using Network 'Situational Awareness'
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Network "situational awareness" can help organizations in all business sectors improve regulatory compliance by identifying networks and devices that need protection, says Lumeta's Reggie Best.

episodes.title: The Authentication Evolution
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: On the technical side, authentication is much the same as it was years ago. But the way consumers are using two-factor authentication products has dramatically changed, says Vasco's Jan Valcke.

episodes.title: U.K. DDoS Attacks Work as Smokescreen
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A new study from Neustar shows DDoS attacks in the United Kingdom are often used as a smoke screen for malware attacks or theft, says security specialist Susan Warner.

episodes.title: Mobile as the Enabler of Trusted ID
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Trusted Identity is the end-goal, and mobile devices are the means to get there, says Dave Rockvam of Entrust. How are mobile devices being leveraged for security in the enterprise today?

episodes.title: DDoS: Evolving Attacks and Response
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: DDoS attacks have grown in sophistication. But so have organizations' dependencies on the services disrupted by DDoS, says Corero's Ashley Stephenson. How should security leaders respond to protect their critical services?

episodes.title: Cybersecurity: Taking an Economic View
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Hurt the criminals and cyberthreats will decrease. That's how organizations in all sectors, working with law enforcement, should approach cybersecurity, says Juniper Networks' Kevin Kennedy.

episodes.title: The New DDoS Industry
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When it comes to DDoS attacks, the hacktivists get all the headlines, but there is a robust service industry behind the scenes, supporting these sophisticated strikes, says Darren Anstee of Arbor Networks.

episodes.title: Mobile File Sharing Trends
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As members of the workforce increasingly rely on mobile devices to access corporate data, secure sharing of files becomes more challenging, says Accellion's Vidhya Ranganathan, who describes an effective strategy.

episodes.title: The Role of Ethical Hacking
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Ethical hackers can play an important role in testing the security of websites, says High-Tech Bridge's Ilia Kolochenko, who describes a new on-demand security assessment service.

episodes.title: The Next Generation of Encryption
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Voltage Security's Mark Bower contends data-centric security can help break down barriers to the widespread use of encryption and help protect sensitive information, including credit card numbers.

episodes.title: Authentication and the Individual
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Individuals resort to lying about themselves to protect their identities when accessing systems in today's imperfect cyber world, says Peter Tapling, president of Authentify, an out-of-band authentication service.

episodes.title: Security for Smaller Organizations
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cloud-based "testing-as-a-service" and "security-as-a-service" platforms can make security more accessible to smaller organizations, says Spirent's Brian Buege.

episodes.title: The Need for Product Testing
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When considering security products, companies need to run test scenarios to make certain the product can handle their type of traffic, says Ixia's Richard Favier.

episodes.title: Turning Awareness into Action
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Organizations across all industry sectors understand the importance of information security. But turning security awareness into meaningful action - that's the challenge that many midsized entities face, says Sophos' Nick Bray.

episodes.title: Secure Web Gateway: Cultural Issues
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When marketing a secure Web gateway worldwide, iboss has to take into consideration the culture of each region and offer customization to meet local needs, says Roy Harris, senior vice president.

episodes.title: Ponemon: Data Breach Costs Rising
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: On the day Target's CEO resigned in the aftermath of a massive data breach, the Ponemon Institute issued its 2014 Cost of Data Breach Study, which Chairman Larry Ponemon says helps explain why CEOs should be more involved in breach preparedness and response.

episodes.title: Social Media's Role in Fraud Prevention
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Because most online banking customers are active social media users, banking institutions should leverage social media in their fraud awareness campaigns, says David Pollino of Bank of the West, who's a featured speaker at the May 14 Fraud Summit Chicago.

episodes.title: 2nd Panel OKs Limits on Bulk Collection
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: With a second House panel approving the USA Freedom Act, Congress moves a step closer to sending the president a bill to limit the government's bulk metadata collection program, the Center for Democracy and Technology's Harley Geiger says.

episodes.title: Avivah Litan on  'Context-Aware' Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A multi-layered approach known as "context-aware security" is the most effective strategy for fighting both insider and external cyberthreats, says Gartner analyst Avivah Litan, who explains how this strategy works.

episodes.title: Fed to Unveil Plan for 'Fast Payments'
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The Federal Reserve will make recommendations this summer for how the United States could launch a "fast-payments" system with enhanced authentication, says Kirstin Wells of the Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago.

episodes.title: Fighting the Synthetic ID Threat
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Fighting fraud tied to synthetic identities requires revamping the credit infrastructure to improve detection of fraudsters' activities, says risk management specialist Richard Parry.

episodes.title: The Emerging Mobile Threat Landscape
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As mobile banking adoption rapidly grows this year, financial institutions need to identify and fill security gaps, says Aite Group analyst Julie Conroy, a featured speaker at the May 14 Fraud Summit Chicago.

episodes.title: A New Way to Build Security Awareness
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Embedding some information security practitioners within business units could help improve IT security awareness in many enterprises, reducing security risk, says Steve Durbin, global vice president of the Information Security Forum.

episodes.title: Applying Engineering Values to InfoSec
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The National Institute of Standards and Technology is developing new cybersecurity standards based on the same principles engineers use to build bridges and jetliners.

episodes.title: Consumers on InfoSec: What, Me Worry?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Consumers around the world aren't overly concerned about Internet security, perhaps because they've experienced fatigue from the oversaturated media coverage of data breaches, Unisys Chief Information Security Officer David Frymier says.

episodes.title: Getting CISO, CEO to Talk Same Language
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What does "IT security as a business enabler" mean? For a definition, Gartner's Paul Proctor looks to the way IT managers at a European car maker translate security problems into a language a CEO can understand.

episodes.title: Target's Impact on Mobile Payments
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: High-profile retail breaches, such as the one suffered by Target Corp., could spur more merchants to promote increased use of mobile payments to boost security, says Thad Peterson, a new analyst at Aite Group.

episodes.title: Banks: How to Improve Threat Detection
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Banking institutions need to develop "day-to-day situational awareness" of the latest threats, says Vikram Bhat, a principal at Deloitte & Touche, which just released a report about cybersecurity issues and awareness.

episodes.title: Keeping Up with Cybersecurity Framework
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The folks at PricewaterhouseCoopers, after surveying 500 U.S. business, law enforcement and government executives, conclude that the vast majority of cybersecurity programs fall very short of the federal government's cybersecurity framework goals.

episodes.title: Stop Breaches? Improve Internet Hygiene
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Poor Internet hygiene, not increased cybercrime, is what's really to blame for the increased botnet traffic the online world is battling, say cybersecurity experts Tom Kellermann and Rod Rasmussen.

episodes.title: A Multidisciplinary Approach to InfoSec
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Imagine a cyber-attack that disables an electricity distribution center. What's the role of the U.S. military, government or the utility company in defending and retaliating? That's a question on the mind of Army Col. Gregory Conti.

episodes.title: IAM and Improving the Customer Experience
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Customers increasingly use digital channels to interact with organizations. But these interactions raise new security concerns that must be addressed by IAM solutions, says David Gormley of CA Technologies.

episodes.title: BITS: How to Prepare for Cyberthreats
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Paul Smocer of BITS explains why banking institutions, which face increasing cyberthreats, need to put the NIST Cybersecurity Framework to use, and why third parties should prepare for more regulatory scrutiny of their security practices.

episodes.title: How to Safely Reduce Security Controls
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Continuous monitoring is helping Freddie Mac reduce the number of security controls it uses to safeguard its information systems, says CISO Patricia Titus, who summarizes lessons that can apply to government and private-sector entities.

episodes.title: Application Fraud: Scams and Solutions
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Identity fraud is one of consumers' most feared crimes, and at banks those schemes translate into application fraud. FICO's Adam Davies discusses today's common application fraud scams and how to stop them.

episodes.title: PCI's Russo on State of Retail Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: P.F. Chang's confirmed card breach has renewed debate about the state of security at U.S. merchants. The PCI Council's Bob Russo says that while there has been progress in recent months, the retail industry still has a long way to go.

episodes.title: How Can Women Advance? Let Them Fail
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Letting women make mistakes, as men are allowed to do, could help grow the female IT security workforce from its current level of less than 30 percent. That's a conclusion of a panel of IT security experts assembled by Information Security Media Group.

episodes.title: Revamping the U.S. Payments System
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Over the next five years, the U.S. payments infrastructure is slated to undergo a major overhaul, with the Federal Reserve leading the charge. Two Fed leaders share insights on the impact on U.S. banking institutions.

episodes.title: The ROI of Privileged ID Governance
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Organizations are careful when granting privileged access to critical systems. But they struggle to govern these privileged identities. Merritt Maxim of CA Technologies shares new strategies.

episodes.title: The Key to Anticipating Cyber-Attacks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Banking institutions must improve how they analyze cyber-threat intelligence. But without better tools, security leaders can't adequately anticipate new attacks, says Greg Garcia, the new executive director of the FSSCC.

episodes.title: How to Tackle Cloud Infrastructure Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Infrastructure security used to be more manageable. But it's far more complex in today's cloud environment. Carson Sweet of CloudPassage shares insight and strategies to improve cloud infrastructure security.

episodes.title: Security Workforce: A Report Card
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Recognizing the security workforce shortage is one thing. Addressing it is quite another. What will it take to truly grow the workforce? Diana Burley of The George Washington University shares her vision.

episodes.title: BYOD: Bring Your Own Disaster?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Does BYOD really stand for Bring Your Own Disaster? JD Sherry of Trend Micro discusses the latest mobile security trends and threats, including the evolution of ransomware and the Internet of Things.

episodes.title: Security: A Constant State of Infection
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Under assault by advanced threats, organizations must change their approach, says Damballa's Stephen Newman. Detection is out; response is in. How do organizations deal with 'a constant state of infection?'

episodes.title: 3 Key Questions from CEOs to CISOs
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Following Target and other high-profile breaches, CEOs and boards have three key questions for security leaders. Coalfire's Rick Dakin reveals those questions - and how CISOs must be ready to respond.

episodes.title: Why Information Sharing Isn't Working
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Tim Pawlenty, CEO of the Financial Services Roundtable, says the only way to ensure adequate cyberthreat information sharing is through federal legislation that would furnish liability protection and other incentives.

episodes.title: How to Secure Legacy Apps
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Security is built into most applications developed today. But how does one go back and secure legacy apps in one's environment? Kunal Anand of Prevoty shares insight on this often-overlooked challenge.

episodes.title: IT and Security: Filling the Gap
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: IT and security groups may know the same technical terms, but they don't always speak the same language. Don Gray of Solutionary discusses how security leaders can help bridge the communications gap.

episodes.title: Not All Malware is Created Equally
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Not all malware strains pose equal threats to an organization. So, how does one distinguish the most dangerous forms? Through layered security controls, says Julian Waits, CEO of ThreatTrack Security.

episodes.title: Combining MDM and BYOD: The Best of Both Worlds
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Users' fear of data loss on personal devices must be balanced with an organization's need to protect sensitive information, says ZixCorp's Nigel Johnson. He explains the evolution of mobile device management.

episodes.title: Improving Cyberthreat Communication
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A common framework for communicating threats and alerts among security vendors' systems would bolster efforts to protect consumers' information, says David Duncan of Webroot.

episodes.title: Big Data: Breaking Down Silos
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Using big data to fight fraud is a challenge for most organizations. Andreas Baumhof of ThreatMetrix explains how context-based authentication combines fraud and security to leverage the use of big data.

episodes.title: Focusing on Vectors, Not Threats
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: To help defend their organizations, security professionals should devote more attention to attack vectors rather than specific threats, says Stephen Pao of Barracuda Networks.

episodes.title: Lessons Learned from Cyber-Insurance
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Despite recent high-profile breaches, organizations are not buying cyber-insurance policies at explosive rates. But Gartner's cyber-insurance expert Juergen Weiss says that might not be a bad thing.

episodes.title: FireEye's Global Privacy Plan
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: FireEye has just appointed a privacy officer and handed him a big mission: Launch a new global privacy program. What is Shane McGee's strategy for this new role, and what will be his top challenges?

episodes.title: Emerging Mobile Banking Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Mobile banking brings new opportunities to institutions and customers alike - but also a host of new security risks. Jim Anderson of BAE Systems Applied Intelligence discusses the emerging landscape.

episodes.title: Breach Lessons from the Trenches
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: From Neiman Marcus to P.F. Chang's, 2014 has shaped up to be the 'Year of the Data Breach.' What lessons can be gleaned from the trenches of breach investigation? Experian's Michael Bruemmer shares tips.

episodes.title: Data Breaches: What the Victims Say
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What is the consumer impact of big data breaches such as Target's and P.F. Chang's? Victims blame the breached entities, and they want government action, says Al Pascual of Javelin Strategy & Research.

episodes.title: EMV: What About Card-Not-Present Fraud?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When the U.S. transitions to chip-secured payment cards, banking institutions will see a significant uptick in card-not-present fraud. What can they be doing now to prepare? Fiserv's Patrick Davie shares tips.

episodes.title: New Insights on Fighting Check Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Check fraud remains the No. 3 source of losses for financial institutions, Information Security Media Group's soon-to-be-released Faces of Fraud survey shows. But fraud expert Wesley Wilhelm says behavioral analytics can help mitigate the risks.

episodes.title: Heartbleed Impact: Community Health Systems Breach
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Solutionary is out with its quarterly threat intelligence report. Topping the list: the exploitability of the Heartbleed bug, and the current malware trends. Rob Kraus teases the report's highlights.

episodes.title: Fraud: Defining 'Reasonable Security'
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: FFIEC guidance and case law are helping banks define what constitutes "reasonable security." In a panel discussion, three experts debate the long-term impact of two recent account takeover fraud cases.

episodes.title: Art Coviello: Divided We Fall
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: "United we stand; divided we fall." That's the message from Art Coviello to kick off the 2014 RSA Conference Asia Pacific & Japan in Singapore. What advice does the RSA chair offer to global security leaders?

episodes.title: Testing Your APT Response Plan
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Enterprises should test the processes they establish to respond to advanced persistent threat attacks, just as they vet their business continuity plans, ISACA International President Robert Stroud says.

episodes.title: The Analytics-Enabled SOC
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: To detect and deter today's threats, security teams need new and dynamic data analytics capabilities. Haiyan Song of Splunk discusses the analytics-enabled SOC and how to improve incident response.

episodes.title: Card Fraud: Why Consumers Don't Get It
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: New research shows consumers believe online purchases are more secure than those made at bricks-and-mortar retailers. Researcher Shirley Inscoe of Aite explains why misconceptions about card fraud should be worrisome to banks.

episodes.title: Attack Response: Before, During, After
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Attacks are more frequent, severe and complex. How can security pros defend against the entire attack continuum - before, during and after? Cisco's Bret Hartman describes a threat-centric approach.

episodes.title: Big Lessons in Small Data
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Big data has been the recent buzz in security circles, but what are organizations missing by overlooking the power of "small data?" Verizon's Jay Jacobs discusses how to get the most from data analytics.

episodes.title: Application Security: The Leader's Role
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Attackers increasingly focus on software vulnerabilities in what application security expert Anthony Lim calls "the invisible onslaught." How can the CISO exert more control over software development?

episodes.title: Job Change: How Do You Know It's Time?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When is it time to make that big move to a new job? And what's the smartest strategy? Matthew Speare of Regions, a bank holding company, talks about how to read and respond to signs that it's time for a major career change.

episodes.title: Shaping a Cloud Services Contract
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As a customer, Delaware Chief Security Officer Elayne Starkey has seen the evolution of cloud computing over the past three years to a point where she has more sway over the security terms of cloud services contracts.

episodes.title: Fighting Back Against Retail Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Financial institutions feel the pain of recent retail breaches, and they seek new ways to secure payments and fight fraud. But how can security leaders influence changes within their own organizations?

episodes.title: Targeted Attacks: Raising Risk Urgency
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Detecting and preventing advanced attacks isn't just a technology issue - it's a business risk that needs to be elevated to the highest levels of an organization. Trend Micro's Tom Kellermann shares strategies.

episodes.title: 'Masquerading': New Wire Fraud Scheme
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A new impersonation scheme is taking aim at business executives to perpetuate ACH and wire fraud, says Bank of the West's David Pollino, who explains steps institutions should take now to protect their customers.

episodes.title: Banks as Cybercrime Fighters?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Karl Schimmeck of the Securities Industry and Financial Markets Association won't discuss reports about the group's alleged backing of the formation of a cyberwar council, but says financial institutions must play a role in protecting critical infrastructure.

episodes.title: Raduege: Why New Cyber Agency Matters
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A new federal cyberthreat intelligence center could help the government build more resilient networks and better identify cyber-attackers, leading to arrests and punishments, says Harry Raduege, a former top Defense Department IT leader.

episodes.title: Can PINs Reduce Online Fraud?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: PINS can effectively reduce card-not-present as well as card-present fraud, argues Liz Garner of the Merchant Advisory Group, who will be a featured speaker at Information Security Media Group's upcoming Fraud Summit Los Angeles.

episodes.title: Spear Phishing: Do You Know Your Risks?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The widespread use of mobile devices and social media has fueled spear phishing by eroding the so-called perimeter that once shielded corporate networks, a panel of financial fraud experts says in part two of their discussion about spear phishing trends.

episodes.title: 'Internet of Things' Security Analysis
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Vendors are rushing useful new "Internet of Things" products to market, but too often treat device security and data privacy as an afterthought, says Forrester Research analyst Andrew Rose.

episodes.title: Does U.S. Truly Want Cyber Peace?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cyber-historian Jason Healey contends the U.S. government does not want peace in cyberspace so it can conduct more attacks and exploitations. Instead, he says the feds should make the Internet's economic benefits its top priority.

episodes.title: FFIEC Cyber Exams: Lessons Learned
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What's the main lesson community banks are learning from the FFIEC's cybersecurity pilot exams? That regulators want them to prove they understand emerging threats, says Booz Allen's Jeff Lunglhofer.

episodes.title: New PCI Guidance for Third-Party Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The PCI Council has unveiled new guidance for mitigating payment card risks posed by third parties. Troy Leach, the council's CTO, explains how banking institutions and merchants can put the guidance to use.

episodes.title: The Password Is 'Dead'
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Millions of user credentials are breached regularly - whether we hear of the incidents or not. So, why do we continue to rely on passwords? Derek Manky of Fortinet discusses authentication and data retention.

episodes.title: A Holistic Approach to Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: No single security solution is enough to defend against today's multifaceted exploits. So it's time for a new holistic and cooperative approach to information security, says Bob Hansmann of Websense.

episodes.title: Incident Response: 'Drowning in Alerts'
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When it comes to incident response, organizations don't lack threat intelligence. They lack the automation, tools and the skilled staff to act on that intelligence, says Craig Carpenter of AccessData.

episodes.title: Putting CyberVor in Perspective
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: That Russian hackers may be hording 1.2 billion credentials merely reflects the insecurity of the world we live in today, says David Perry, threat strategist at the Finnish IT security company F-Secure.

episodes.title: Cybersecurity: Why It's Got to Be a Team Sport
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Former NSA information assurance leader Tony Sager goes on the road to the Black Hat USA security conference to promote the notion that no one should try to solve cybersecurity threats alone.

episodes.title: Blackphone: Inside a Secure Smart Phone
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Can a smart phone increase your privacy and security while remaining both highly usable and attractive to buyers? The inaugural Blackphone is testing that question for consumers and businesses.

episodes.title: Simplifying Cybersecurity Complexity
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Finding a common theme from the Black Hat USA conference isn't easy, but a few emerged - simplifying complexity and developing community-based solutions - from sessions and discussions with top cybersecurity experts.

episodes.title: Spear Phishing: How Not to Get Hooked
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Spear phishing attacks are increasingly sophisticated. Banking institutions must learn more about how fraudsters dupe one's customers and employees, says a panel of three financial fraud experts.

episodes.title: Cybersecurity: What Boards Must Know
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As the Target breach demonstrated, boards of directors will be held accountable when their organizations are breached. Attorney Kim Peretti offers tips on how to educate boards about security issues.

episodes.title: Michael Daniel's Path to the White House
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Michael Daniel explains that among his biggest challenges as special assistant to the president is fully understanding the economics and psychology behind cybersecurity, topics that few people have mastered.

episodes.title: Apple iOS 8: What's New for Security?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Apple's forthcoming iOS 8 includes a number of useful new security and privacy features, says Symantec threat researcher Candid Wueest. But there are missing features he'd still like to see implemented.

episodes.title: Mobile Banking: Evolved Services, Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: 2014 has seen an explosion of mobile banking demand and services. But as the channel grows, so do the threats against it. What are today's top threats, and how can institutions offer more secure mobile banking?

episodes.title: Breach Response: Are We Doing Enough?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What lessons can be learned from recent high-profile breaches? IT security experts John Pescatore of the SANS Institute and Ron Ross of NIST explain how organizations can work to mitigate the new-style data breach threat. Listen to the conversation.

episodes.title: Cyber Framework: Setting Record Straight
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In an in-depth interview, Adam Sedgewick, the point man for the NIST cybersecurity framework, addresses misconceptions about the guidance, the costs to implement it and its role as a marketplace catalyst.

episodes.title: Fighting Cybercrime in Canada
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Canada is considering adopting tougher data security and cybercrime legislation that could serve as a model for other nations, says Claudiu Popa, an information security expert who'll be a panelist at the Fraud Summit Toronto.

episodes.title: How to Mitigate Merchant Malware Threat
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The explosion in POS malware attacks against U.S. merchants highlights the need for retailers to take bolder security steps. Troy Leach of the PCI Council and Karl Sigler of Trustwave outline key steps.

episodes.title: Breach Prevention: A New Approach
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Amidst a year of high-profile and costly data breaches, what can organizations be doing to help ensure they aren't the next victims? Charley Chell of CA Technologies discusses new authentication solutions.

episodes.title: Fraud: How to Secure the Call Center
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Call center data and logs can help banks predict account-takeover attempts across multiple banking channels, says fraud expert Matt Anthony, a presenter at ISMG's upcoming Fraud Summits in Toronto and London.

episodes.title: Security: Maximize Business Benefits
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When it comes to the evolution of machine data, security organizations now can improve protection and the top line. How can they maximize the business benefits? Jean-Francois Roy of Tibco shares tips.

episodes.title: Keys to Fighting Insider Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What steps can organizations take to mitigate insider fraud threats? Michael Theis of Carnegie Mellon, a featured speaker at ISMG's upcoming Fraud Summits in Toronto and London, explains why using data analytics is key.

episodes.title: PCI Council's New GM on Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: During his first media interview as new general manager of the PCI Security Standards Council, Stephen Orfei says retailers and banks today are better equipped than ever to fight cybercrime.

episodes.title: Fraud: An Alarming Lack of Preparedness
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Today's sophisticated fraud threats are daunting. But security adviser Neira Jones is more concerned about financial institutions' lack of preparedness to face these threats. A London Fraud Summit preview.

episodes.title: Helping Retailers Fight Malware
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Helping merchants deal with the growing threat of POS malware is one of the biggest challenges facing Troy Leach, CTO of the PCI Security Standards Council, who says the BlackPOS malware threat, in particular, "is keeping me up at night."

episodes.title: The Biggest Challenge to EMV Migration
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What's the toughest challenge the U.S. faces when it comes to EMV? Randy Vanderhoof of the EMV Migration Forum points to getting POS software and terminals certified for EMV transactions. Find out what other hurdles he identifies.

episodes.title: ATM Malware: Hackers' New Focus
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Although malware attacks against POS terminals at retailers have been in the spotlight, banks and credit unions need to be aware of the emerging threat of malware targeting ATMs, say Trustwave's Matthew Jakubowski and Graham Mott of the U.K.'s ATM network.

episodes.title: Fraud Summit: How ATM Attacks Evolve
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: ATM-related fraud is quickly evolving, says Graham Mott, head of the U.K.'s LINK Scheme and a presenter at the Sept. 23 London Fraud Summit. New malware attacks waged against ATMs prove why information sharing among banking peers is critical.

episodes.title: Shellshock Bug: How to Respond
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: To mitigate the newly discovered Bash bug - AKA Shellshock - which may make millions of systems vulnerable to remote takeover, organizations must take several key steps, says security expert Alan Woodward.

episodes.title: Authentication: Changes Coming In a Year
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The U.S. government could be a year away from allowing citizens to use the same authentication credentials to get services from multiple departments and agencies, says Jeremy Grant, who oversees the National Strategy for Trusted Identities in Cyberspace.

episodes.title: From ISIS to FISMA, A Conversation
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In a wide-ranging interview, the acclaimed expert on cybersecurity strategy addresses the cyberthreat posed by ISIS and explains why Congress is unlikely to enact significant cybersecurity legislation this year.

episodes.title: Shellshock: The Patching Dilemma
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As researchers scramble to learn more about Shellshock and the risks it poses to operating systems, servers and devices, Michael Smith of Akamai explains why not all patches are actually fixing the problem.

episodes.title: The Slow Path to Password Replacement
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The development of authentication technologies that could replace the password is "nearing a tipping point," but there's still several years of work to do, says Jeremy Grant, who oversees the National Strategy for Trusted Identities in Cyberspace.

episodes.title: Top Threat to Financial Institutions: Advanced Malware
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Heartbleed, Shellshock, targeted attacks - the security threats to banking institutions are legion. And there are new banks can get better at detecting these evolving threats, says Solutionary's Jeremy Nichols.

episodes.title: Why Shellshock Battle Is Only Beginning
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Nearly two weeks since news of Shellshock broke, attacks that are taking advantage of the Bash vulnerabilities are grabbing headlines. But Michael Smith of Akamai warns that the battle against hackers capitalizing on Shellshock could go on for years.

episodes.title: What Would the Original CISO Do?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What advice does the first CISO have for today's security leaders? Steve Katz speaks up on top security threats, how to defend against them and what it takes to lead an effective security team.

episodes.title: Why Bank Breach Info Often Conflicts
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Emerging reports now suggest other financial institutions may have been targeted by the same hackers who breached Chase. But how can we be sure? Mark Clancy of the Depository Trust & Clearing Corp. explains why the analysis is challenging.

episodes.title: Are You Prepared for a Breach?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
