episodes.summary: More hackers are exploiting remote-access and network vulnerabilities, rather than installing malware to invade networks and exfiltrate data, says Dell SecureWorks' researcher Phil Burdette. That's why conventional breach-detection tools aren't catching the intrusions.

episodes.title: APT Attacks Will Seek Smaller Targets
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: With automation and the increasing economic feasibility of launching targeted attacks on a small scale, tier-II and III organizations housing data need to start getting concerned, says Gartner's Ahlm.

episodes.title: Account Takeovers: Did FFIEC Guidance Make a Difference?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Four years after the FFIEC issued its updated authentication guidance, many banking institutions say account takeover losses have gone up, a new survey shows. John LaCour of PhishLabs explains why institutions' reactive approach to fraud is failing.

episodes.title: Forensics - How Not to Spoil the Data
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Organizations create more data than ever, and they face more requirements to collect and present it for investigations and legal cases. How do they avoid spoiling this data? Zapproved's Sarah Thompson offers tips.

episodes.title: MIT Offers Online Cybersecurity Training
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The Massachusetts Institute of Technology is launching a new online cybersecurity course that aims to fill a gap for IT professionals as well as business leaders, says MIT's Clara Piloto.

episodes.title: Commercializing Federal IT Security Wares
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The federal government is licensing a government-built anomaly detection tool known as PathScan to Ernst & Young, which, in turn, will refine the software and market it. In an interview, DHS's Mike Pozmantier explains why the government is offering its technology to the private sector.

episodes.title: Fighting Fraud: New Insights from a Former FBI Agent
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As criminals get more savvy about circumventing financial institutions' fraud prevention controls, fraud-fighting collaboration among institutions and law enforcement officials is becoming more important, says Clyde Langley, a former FBI agent who'll be a presenter at ISMG's Sept. 15 Fraud Summit San Francisco.

episodes.title: Why Cybercrime Now Exceeds Conventional Crime
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Drawn by the potential for low risk and high reward, criminals worldwide are increasingly pursuing online crime instead of conventional forms of property crime, such as burglary and robbery, warns cybersecurity expert Alan Woodward.

episodes.title: The Road to True Data Protection
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Many organizations spin their wheels when it comes to cybersecurity, says IBM's Andy Land. They invest in tools that do everything except what security leaders are fundamentally tasked with doing: Protect the data.

episodes.title: How the FBI Helped Recover Millions from Wire Fraud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: FBI Special Agent Charles Gunther says collaboration with FinCEN, international law enforcement and U.S. banks has helped the FBI recover millions of funds stolen from customers via emerging wire fraud schemes.

episodes.title: How to Align Security to Business Performance
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Increasingly, as enterprise leaders plan security investments, they think not just about threats and technology, but also how to tie their decisions to business performance. Gartner's Sid Deshpande  explains the shift.

episodes.title: Will Mobile Payments Overshadow EMV Card Migration?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The U.S. migration to EMV chip payment cards, which is progressing slowly, will be overshadowed by EMV-compliant mobile payments, says Gray Taylor of Conexxus, a convenience store and petroleum industry technology association.

episodes.title: Obama Threatens Sanctions Against China If Hacks Continue
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: President Obama characterizes hacks of American businesses by Chinese hackers as an "act of aggression" against the United States and promises his administration will take action against the Chinese if they don't stop.

episodes.title: U.S. Cyber Challenge Seeks to Boost Number of Security Pros
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The 6-year-old U.S. Cyber Challenge, designed to build interest in cybersecurity careers, is going strong, as participation in its online competition and cyber boot camps continues to grow, says Karen Evans, the organization's national director.

episodes.title: California's Proactive Approach to Cyberthreats
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The creation of the California Cybersecurity Integration Center demonstrates that the state is taking a proactive approach to securing its digital assets, says Mark Weatherford, a former California state CISO and onetime DHS deputy undersecretary for cybersecurity.

episodes.title: How Banks Can Leverage the Bitcoin Infrastructure
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The use of Bitcoin poses big cybersecurity and money-laundering concerns for banks. But the transaction infrastructure used by cryptocurrencies offers many features that banks should put to use, says former FBI Special Agent Vince D'Agostino.

episodes.title: Kevin Mandia on the State of Cybersecurity
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The attacks have evolved, breaches have multiplied, and serious security gaps have been exposed. But what most concerns FireEye President Kevin Mandia? The rise of nation-states as leading threat actors.

episodes.title: What It Takes to Be an IT Security Auditor
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Gregory Wilshusen discusses the path he followed to his job as the government's lead information security auditor and the skills needed to be an InfoSec auditor.

episodes.title: PCI's Orfei on How EMV Will Spur Mobile Payments
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: PCI Council General Manager Stephen Orfei says the migration to EMV in the United States will facilitate faster adoption of contactless mobile payments. That's why mobile will be a hot topic at the PCI Council's annual North America Community Meeting this week.

episodes.title: The Shift to File-Centric Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Security leaders do well securing stored data and data in transit. But what about the integrity of data after it reaches the intended recipient? This is a huge gap to be bridged, says Chris Kniffin of Seclore.

episodes.title: Why InfoSec Professionals Must Understand Privacy Issues
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In addition to having a dedicated individual or team responsible for privacy matters, organizations must ensure their information security and IT staffs are knowledgeable about data privacy issues, says Trevor Hughes, CEO of the International Association of Privacy Professionals.

episodes.title: Targeted Attacks Becoming the Norm
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The commoditization of attack infrastructure and services in the cyber-criminal underground, and the low cost and ease of launching targeted attacks, are growing concerns that require new defense strategies, says Trend Micro's Raimund Genes.

episodes.title: Banking Trojans Retooled for Data Mining
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cybercrimnals are now using the Dyre and Dridex banking Trojans to gather massive amounts of data about individuals and companies that could enable them to track patterns of behavior, which might later help them evade intrusion detection, says Fox-IT's Eward Driehuis.

episodes.title: Experian Breach: Lessons Learned
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As a result of Experian's data breach, 15 million T-Mobile subscribers are at risk from phishing attacks and fraud. But it's not clear what more T-Mobile can do to protect breach victims, says security specialist Mark James.

episodes.title: Why U.S. EMV Migration Will Spur Global Fraud Shift
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In the wake of the Oct. 1 EMV fraud liability shift date, U.S. merchants can expect to pay for counterfeit fraud losses previously absorbed by European issuers, says Jeremy King of the PCI Council. Longer-term, he expects European banks will experience more fraud as U.S. POS and card security leapfrogs other markets.

episodes.title: Identity-Centric Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Recent breaches indicate that stronger controls are needed to protect key corporate assets - especially identities. CA's Steve Firestone discusses how to protect identities, while at the same time improving the user experience.

episodes.title: Inside BitSight's Benchmark Report
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: BitSight Technologies is out with its annual Industry Benchmark Report, and cybersecurity ratings are low for the energy and utilities industry. BitSight's Mike Woodward shares insights for all sectors.

episodes.title: Should Medicare Move to Chip ID Cards?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Proposed federal legislation calls for testing the use of smart cards, similar to the chip cards being rolled out by the U.S. credit card brands, for Medicare patient identification to help reduce fraud. Kelli Emerick, leader of the Secure ID Coalition, explains the proposal.

episodes.title: Why Ex-NSA Chief Now Argues Against Encryption Backdoor
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In this audio blog report, hear why former NSA Director Mike McConnell changed his view on the value of the government getting device manufacturers to create a backdoor to allow law enforcement to bypass encryption.

episodes.title: Cloud Security: Job Opportunities
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: With organizations increasingly moving to the cloud, more security professionals are needed to help secure those environments as well as manage incident response. Cloud forensics expert Neha Thethi outlines must-have skills, qualifications and certifications.

episodes.title: Is EMV Bad News to Small Businesses?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: NACS attorney Doug Kantor says small businesses are getting a raw deal from the card brands when it comes to expectations for EMV migration. The expense is too high, and the fraud-reduction benefits too low to make EMV worthwhile, he argues.

episodes.title: Simplifying and Unifying Authentication
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Has authentication become too complex for banking institutions? That's a legitimate concern, says Peter Tapling of Early Warning. He offers strategies to simplify and unify authentication strategies.

episodes.title: Payment Security: What Factors Are Essential?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The future of payments security hinges on a combination of factors, including widespread use of the EMV chip, tokenization and encryption, as well as near real-time payments, says Liz Garner, vice president of the Merchant Advisory Group, a featured speaker at ISMG's Fraud Summit New York on Oct. 20.

episodes.title: Attracting More Women to InfoSec Careers
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The information security field has done a poor job of attracting and retaining women, contends Jo Stewart-Rattray, international director of ISACA, who emphasizes the need for mentoring as well as salary equity.

episodes.title: Machine Learning: Sizing Up Its Role in InfoSec
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: By identifying abnormal data access behavior, machine learning systems could improve breach prevention and fraud detection in the healthcare arena and other sectors, contends artificial intelligence expert Robert Leithiser.

episodes.title: Solving Secure Email Platform Challenge
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Building a strong platform to secure enterprise email systems is like piecing together a puzzle by joining existing technologies from various sources. NIST is readying a guide to do just that.

episodes.title: Mergers Create Challenges for CISOs
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Mergers and acquisitions create challenges for CISOs, including allocating resources to meet the information security needs of newly united companies, says Joey Johnson, CISO of Premise Health.

episodes.title: TalkTalk Attack Highlights Worldwide Breach Concerns
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The recent data breach at U.K.-based telecom company TalkTalk illustrates that breach risk mitigation is a critical issue worldwide. PCI's Jeremy King, who will be a featured speaker at ISMG's Fraud Summit London on Oct. 27, explains why European data security is getting more scrutiny.

episodes.title: CISO's Guide to Spear Phishing Defense
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Everyone's talking about business email compromise, but what they aren't talking enough about is what's at the root of these attacks - spear phishing. Joseph Opacki of PhishLabs discusses how security leaders must respond to the threat.

episodes.title: Art Coviello's New Cybersecurity Agenda
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A quiet life in retirement? Not for Art Coviello, former executive chairman of RSA. He's just joined the boards of two new security ventures, Bugcrowd and Cylance, and he's got big ideas for how to influence the 2016 cybersecurity agenda.

episodes.title: Cybersecurity: The CEO's Responsibilities
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Many CEOs and boards of directors are failing their companies by not truly understanding their cybersecurity risks, says Steve Durbin of the Information Security Forum. He stresses that senior leaders must ensure their organizations provide adequate funding to manage risks.

episodes.title: Why Tinba Trojan Is Now a Global Concern
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Tinba, which has been linked to attacks in the U.S., Canada and Europe, is now targeting bank accounts in Russia, according to a new report from Dell SecureWorks. Researcher Brett Stone-Gross tells why Tinba is unusual and can be tough to detect.

episodes.title: How to Succeed at Information Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Developing a successful information security career requires excellent technical acumen as well as the ability to understand the impact that security policies have on people, says Gurdeep Kaur, a chief security architect at AIG.

episodes.title: PHI Breaches: Not Just Healthcare Sector's Problem
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: An upcoming Verizon report on health data breaches illustrates that the data is at risk at organizations outside of the healthcare sector, and not just at hospitals, clinics, insurers and their business associates, says security expert Suzanne Widup of Verizon Enterprise Solutions.

episodes.title: Why Banks Need to Prepare for More Chase-Like Breaches
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Banks need to prepare for many more massive cyberattacks along the lines of the sophisticated campaign that hit JPMorgan Chase and other financial services organizations, says Javelin Strategy & Research's Al Pascual, who offers risk management insights.

episodes.title: What the JPMorgan Chase Breach Teaches Us
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The massive cyberattacks that struck Chase and other leading U.S. financial services firms  illustrate just how vulnerable larger institutions can be to cyber-attacks. They also show why organizations must encrypt customer data, says security and forensics expert Chuck Easttom.

episodes.title: Paris Attacks Reignite Encryption Debate
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The terrorist attacks in Paris likely would have occurred even if intelligence and law enforcement agencies could have broken encryption Islamic State attackers used in their communications to plan the assault that killed at least 129 people.

episodes.title: After Paris Attacks, Beware Rush to Weaken Crypto
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In the wake of the Paris attacks, cybersecurity expert Brian Honan argues that now is not the time to make snap public policy decisions that attempt to promote or restrict either cryptography or surveillance.

episodes.title: Detecting Anomalous Behavior: A New Strategy
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A huge part of fraud prevention is being able to detect anomalous behavior on your network. But to do so, you need to know what normal behavior looks like. Usman Choudhary of ThreatTrack discusses how to create that network baseline.

episodes.title: Rethinking How to Recruit InfoSec Pros
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: NICE's Rodney Petersen sees too many government agencies and businesses using old-school methods to identify and recruit IT security professionals. Consequently, they often fail to build their cybersecurity staffs.

episodes.title: LabMD CEO Speaks About FTC Legal Battle
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: LabMD's recent victory in its long legal battle with the Federal Trade Commission will be short-lived, the medical testing lab's CEO predicts. Find out why, and what changes Michael Daugherty hopes the case will bring to FTC's enforcement practices.

episodes.title: What is 'Sleeper Fraud,' And Why Must Banks Beware?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The surge in data breaches has left millions of consumer records compromised. As a result, fraudsters have all they need to open bogus accounts, which cost banks huge losses linked to what Greg Shelton of LexisNexis Risk Solutions calls "sleeper fraud."

episodes.title: New Counter-Fraud Strategies for the Insurance industry
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Insurance fraud schemes are growing in scale and sophistication. But at the same time, insurance companies - and their customers - are losing their appetite to accept fraud losses. IBM's Brian Banigan offers insight on the latest counter-fraud solutions.

episodes.title: Report: Insiders Still Top Breach Threat
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: While cyberattacks will continue to menace healthcare and other business sectors next year, organizations can't afford to overlook addressing risks tied to insiders, who are responsible for most data breaches, says Michael Bruemmer of Experian Data Breach Resolution.

episodes.title: PCI Compliance in the Cloud
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In the age of payment card breaches, PCI compliance is a top priority for merchants and organizations that process electronic payments. But what difference does it make when its PCI compliance in the cloud? Steve Neville of Trend Micro shares insight.

episodes.title: Sending CISOs to Cyberthreat Bootcamp
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: More cybersecurity specialists are making the leap from long-time careers in law enforcement, the military and the government to the private sector, says Dale Meyerrose, a retired U.S. Air Force Major General, who explains why.

episodes.title: Former RSA Chair Coviello on 2016 Security Outlook
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Consultant, venture capitalist, retired chairman of RSA. Art Coviello plays many roles, and through them he has a unique view on how the information security marketplace is taking shape for 2016. Who does he see as the winners and losers?

episodes.title: Business Email Compromise Attacks Rapidly Evolving
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Business email compromise attacks are becoming more sophisticated and pervasive, and smaller businesses in English-speaking countries are proving to be the most common targets, says PhishLabs' Joseph Opacki, who calls on banks to show customers examples of the schemes.

episodes.title: 'I Bet My Career on It ...'
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: He'd spent nearly 15 years in information security, then realized we needed to change our fundamental approach. Why did Art Gilliland, CEO of Skyport Systems, bet his career on this notion? And how is it paying off?

episodes.title: Building a Career on Taking Apart Malware
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Malware: How does it work, who built it and what - or who - is it designed to target? Answering these types of questions is a job for Marion Marschalek of Cyphort, who reverse-engineers malicious code for a living.

episodes.title: Is Obama Calling for Encryption Bypass?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: President Obama's remarks urging "high-tech and law enforcement leaders to make it harder for terrorists to use technology to escape from justice" are being interpreted by some to mean that government and Silicon Valley should collaborate to create a backdoor to circumvent encryption on devices used by terrorists.

episodes.title: Why Check Fraud Remains So Hot - and What to Do About It
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Check fraud - it not only won't go away, but it is morphing to keep pace with consumers' digital banking habits. David Barnhardt of Early Warning talks about this persistent fraud threat and how banking institutions should respond to it.

episodes.title: Why Regulatory Scrutiny of Banks Will Intensify in 2016
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cyberattacks against U.S. banks will continue to increase in 2016, making cybersecurity oversight and AML enforcement focal points for regulators, says Walter Mix, a former commissioner of the California Department of Financial Institutions.

episodes.title: Leading Cybersecurity Out of Medieval Times
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Today's security threats may be considered "advanced" by some, but ThreatSTOP founder and CEO Tom Byrnes believes many organizations are living in the medieval times of cybersecurity. How can they avoid slipping into the Dark Ages?

episodes.title: Be Secure and Comply in a Hybrid Cloud Environment
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: It's the ultimate challenge for government agencies: How can they be both secure and compliant - especially when operating in a hybrid cloud environment? Trend Micro's Ed Cabrera offers insight into the unique challenges and emerging solutions.

episodes.title: Changing Jobs: Corporate Culture Issues
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As information security professionals consider new opportunities, they must carefully determine whether the corporate culture is a good fit, says former healthcare CISO Jeff Cobb, who recently made his own career transition to security consulting.

episodes.title: Wearable Devices: Will They Face Regulatory Scrutiny?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As it continues to ramp up its cybersecurity enforcement efforts, the FTC could take action next year against consumer wearable device makers if they fail to live up to their promises to protect the privacy of health data and other information, says researcher Stephen Cobb, who also expects scrutiny from the FDA.

episodes.title: What Malware Taught us for 2016
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In terms of malware, 2015 will go down as the year that ransomware got big, and the organized criminals behind it got bolder. IBM's Limor Kessem discusses what to expect from advanced malware variants in 2016.

episodes.title: PCI Council Extends Encryption Deadline
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Jeremy King of the PCI Security Standards Council explains why it has extended its compliance deadline for encryption updates aimed at phasing out SSL and TLS 1.0. But he stresses that merchants, processors and acquirers should not wait to make upgrades.

episodes.title: Exploring the Ethics Behind DNC Breach
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Giving the fired Sanders aide the benefit of the doubt that he wasn't trying to steal Clinton campaign secrets to benefit the Vermont senator's quest for the White House, was Josh Uretsky justified in accessing the rival's data to conduct his own investigation?

episodes.title: 2016: The Year Hackers Exploit  the Cloud?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The rising profile and increasingly complex nature of cyberattacks was a major development in 2015. What are the key threats for security practitioners to be wary of in the year ahead? FireEye CTO APAC Bryce Boland shares insights.

episodes.title: Addressing the InfoSec Educator Shortage
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: To help train more cybersecurity professionals, academia must work with business and government to find enough qualified trainers and educators, says George Washington University Professor Diana Burley.

episodes.title: The Evolution of User Behavior Analytics
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Too many recent high-profile breaches resulted from attackers using legitimate user credentials to infiltrate critical systems. Fortscale's Bert Rankin tells how user behavior analytics help organizations catch attackers after the breach.

episodes.title: BITS President: Cyber Guidance Confuses CISOs
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Conflicting cybersecurity guidance from banking regulators and a federal agency is making it more difficult for CISOs to set priorities, says Chris Feeney, president of BITS, the technology and policy division of the Financial Services Roundtable.

episodes.title: The Practical Application of User Behavior Analytics
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Understanding the promise of user behavior analytics is one thing. Deploying them to detect and respond to threats is quite another. Bert Rankin of Fortscale offers tips on practical application of the latest UBA solutions.

episodes.title: Cybersecurity as a Competitive Advantage
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Boards of directors that figure out how to leverage cybersecurity as a strategic asset will give their organizations a strong competitive advantage, says Lance Hayden of Berkeley Research Group. "Security needs to be part of what the organization uses to competitively differentiate itself."

episodes.title: What's Next for Cybersecurity Framework?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: NIST is soliciting comments from stakeholders on whether its cybersecurity framework is helping organizations secure their information systems. Those observations could result in an update of the framework, NIST's Adam Sedgewick explains in this interview.

episodes.title: Solve Old Security Problems First
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Improving breach detection and defenses involves much more than buying the latest technology, warns security expert Haroon Meer. "We keep moving on as we try to solve new, shiny problems, which we then half solve, but we still haven't completely solved problems that we knew about 20 years ago."

episodes.title: The 2 Worst Breaches of 2015
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The breaches of the infidelity online dating service Ashley Madison and toymaker VTech illustrate how cyber intrusions got worse in 2015, thanks to organizations failing to secure private information.

episodes.title: 2016: Year of Cyberthreat Info Sharing
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In the coming months, the Department of Homeland Security will implement a new cyberthreat information sharing law designed to help prevent breaches. But will the Cybersecurity Act of 2015 really make a difference?

episodes.title: 2016 Breach Prevention: Time to Purge Data
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Expect rebooted European Union data privacy rules to drive organizations worldwide to begin minimizing the amount of information they collect and store on individuals in 2016, both to protect privacy as well as minimize the impact of data breaches.

episodes.title: Gartner's Litan: FFIEC Assessment Tool Falls Short
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The FFIEC's Cybersecurity Assessment Tool is already being integrated into regulators' cybersecurity examinations, says Gartner analyst Avivah Litan. But the tool has so far led to more confusion than clarity, she says, and must be enhanced in 2016.

episodes.title: Analysis: Unusual Ruling in Massachusetts Breach Case
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Attorney Kevin McGinty analyzes the potential impact of a Massachusetts judge's unusual decision to allow a class-action lawsuit stemming from a health data breach to proceed, despite a lack of evidence of harm stemming from the incident.

episodes.title: Why Traditional Security Tools Can't Cut it
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Today's enterprise infrastructure is full of blind spots that can hide malicious threats, and traditional security tools struggle to scale up to meet increased demands. How must security leaders respond? Amrit Williams of CloudPassage shares insight.

episodes.title: Where Will We Find Next Generation of Security Leaders?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As Art Gilliland, CEO of Skyport Systems, assesses cybersecurity in 2016, he sees distinct strengths, weakness and opportunities for the next generation of leaders. The question is: Where will we find these leaders?

episodes.title: New Global Alliance Seeks Measurable InfoSec Solutions
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The primary mission of the new Global Cyber Alliance is to identify measurable ways to mitigate cyberthreats facing the public and private sectors, says Phil Reitlinger, a former DHS official and Sony CISO, who heads the new group.

episodes.title: Mitigating the Accidental Insider Threat
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When it comes to threat detection, spotting malicious insiders is one thing. They often leave a trail. But how do you protect against the accidental insider threat? Mike Siegel, VP of Products at Forcepoint, shares strategy and solutions.

episodes.title: Fighting the Mobile Malware Hydra
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Every organization is concerned about malware - how it evolves, slips past multilayered defenses and infects networks. John Nielsen, Product Manager for IBM Mobile Security, discusses the latest malware trends and steps organizations may take to fight back.

episodes.title: Special Report: Identifying Malicious Insiders
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In this in-depth audio report, a panel of experts addresses the challenge of detecting insider threats and outlines the latest approaches, including "sentiment and linguistic" systems.

episodes.title: Rivals Avoid Taking Stand on Backdoor
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: If presidential candidates don't have the technical know-how to take an educated stand on whether tech companies should provide the government with a backdoor to encryption, how can we judge if they'll make the right choice if they get elected?

episodes.title: Network Security - Empower Your People
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When it comes to responding to network security threats, it isn't just a matter of collecting and analyzing data. It's a question of how quickly you can put that data to work in your defenses, says Dan Holden of Arbor Networks.

episodes.title: The CISO's Role in Fighting Extortion
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Extortion campaigns waged by cybercriminals are expected to become more damaging in 2016, putting additional pressure on CISOs to enhance protection of internal networks and educate employees about extortionists' techniques, says iSight Partner's John Miller.

episodes.title: EMV Update: The Rise of Mobile Payments
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Because of the U.S. migration to EMV, 2016 is expected to be a watershed year for mobile payment adoption, says Randy Vanderhoof of the EMV Migration Forum. Now, he says, the industry should be more focused on new applications hitting the market than on the number of adopters.

episodes.title: Phishing: How to Counter Targeted Attacks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Sophisticated phishing campaigns, increasingly targeted because of social media, are fueling business email compromises - a growing wire fraud scheme that is attacking businesses worldwide, says Jim Hansen of PhishMe.

episodes.title: Common Security Mistakes by Startups
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A successful startup is fueled by passion, speed and innovation - all enabled by technology. Not securing this technology layer from day one can therefore have expensive consequences later. IEEE's Diogo MÃ³nica shares security insight for startups.

episodes.title: How Will GRC Take on Mobility, IoT?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Mobility and IoT are acknowledged by security practitioners to be a whole different beast when it comes to management. MetricStream's French Caldwell says that GRC likewise needs to change its paradigm to accommodate this disruption.

episodes.title: Absolute Data & Device Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: When is a breach not a breach? When you can prove that sensitive data has not been accessed - even off a lost or stolen device. And the way to ensure that, says former prosecutor Stephen Treglia, is through Absolute Data & Device Security.

episodes.title: Are Retailers Improving Cybersecurity?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Retailers have been at the center of high-profile breaches and an ongoing debate with banking institutions. But Brian Engle of the Retail Cyber Intelligence Sharing Center says cross-industry collaboration is helping retailers improve cybersecurity.

episodes.title: How Yahoo Hacks Itself
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Chris Rohlf, Yahoo's penetration testing and red team leader, describes how he helps the company take a proactive security approach -  and the skills required to get the job done.

episodes.title: RSA Conference Turns 25
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: It's the 25th anniversary of the RSA Conference. What's planned for this year's landmark security event? Britta Glade, senior content manager for the conference, and Informatica CISO Bill Burns offer a preview of the RSA Conference 2016 in San Francisco.

episodes.title: DHS Tries to Entice Businesses to Share Cyberthreat Data
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In this audio report, hear Homeland Security Assistant Secretary Andy Ozment attempt to assuage concerns raised by some business leaders who fear revealing corporate secrets by participating in cyberthreat information sharing. Others also weigh in on the issues.

episodes.title: Privacy Takes Center Stage at RSA Conference
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Privacy looks to be one of the hottest topics at RSA Conference 2016. Cisco's Michelle Dennedy shares insights on encryption backdoors as well as the likely impact of newly revised EU privacy legislation.

episodes.title: Security Profession Must Get Younger
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Even as the demand for security professionals grows, the outflow of practitioners from the profession is greater than the influx of fresh blood, says (ISC)Â² CEO David Shearer. How can this trend be effectively addressed?

episodes.title: Why CISOs Need a 'Separate Voice' from CIOs
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Why should CISOs not report to CIOs? And why do CISOs need more direct lines of communication with CFOs? Chris Pierson, a cybersecurity attorney and CISO who'll be a speaker at RSA Conference 2016, provides answers.

episodes.title: Cloud Security: It's Now an Enabler
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: It used to be that security was the one big barrier to organizations embracing the cloud. But Troy Kitch of Oracle says that not only is that barrier coming down, but now leaders are seeing cloud as a security enabler.

episodes.title: Is Dridex the Most Dangerous Banking Trojan?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Kevin Haley, a researcher at Symantec, says the moneymakers behind Dridex are successfully infecting thousands of users worldwide on a monthly basis, purely through spam - making Dridex the most dangerous banking Trojan on the market today.

episodes.title: Inside the Cybercrime Investigator's Notebook
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Jeff Shaffer, a former Secret Service agent, has investigated cybercrime for more than 25 years. Now a manager at PricewaterhouseCoopers, he discusses how organizations can protect their assets better by understanding their attackers' MO.

episodes.title: The Crypto Debate: Apple vs. the FBI
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: It's the perfect time to debate whether the government should compel Apple to help the FBI circumvent protections blocking access to the San Bernardino shooter's iPhone. Hear Apple CEO Tim Cook, FBI Director James Comey, Sen. Marco Rubio and cryptologist Bruce Schneier in this audio report.

episodes.title: Creating Cybersecurity Rating Systems for Cars
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Automobiles have crash ratings. Do they need ratings for cybersecurity, too? In this interview, security expert Jacob Olcott of BitSight Technologies previews a session he'll moderate at the RSA Conference 2016 that will address this question.

episodes.title: Strategies for Advanced Endpoint Protection
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In 2015 alone, 84 million new pieces of malware were created. How can organizations hope to keep pace with the new strains and tactics? Through advanced endpoint protection, says John Peterson of Comodo.

episodes.title: PCI DSS Update: What to Expect
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The PCI Security Standards Council will soon release an update to its PCI Data Security Standard, requiring the use of multifactor authentication for administrators who have access to card data networks. In an interview, the council's Troy Leach explains the new requirements and compliance expectations.

episodes.title: Adapting Cybersecurity Contests as a Recruitment Tool
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cybersecurity competitions are being adapted so employers can use them to vet the know-how of prospective employees, U.S. Cyber Challenge National Director Karen Evans says.

episodes.title: DHS Eyes Malware Provenance to Identify Malicious Code
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The Department of Homeland security sees malware provenance - which identifies the attributes of malicious codes - as a way to complement its signature-based Einstein intrusion detection and prevention systems to find malware that infects IT systems.

episodes.title: Cutting Debit Fraud: Lessons from Canada
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Debit fraud losses in Canada hit an all-time low in 2015, mainly because of the nearly complete migration to EMV and real-time settlement of debit payments, says Mark Sullivan, who heads fraud management for Interac, Canada's payment network. He offers important lessons for the U.S.

episodes.title: Are We Approaching Security Wrong?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Too many companies that provide cybersecurity solutions are failing to focus on helping organizations control risk at a reasonable cost, argues Malcolm Harkins, CISO at Cylance.

episodes.title: 'Industrialization' of Cybercrime: Sizing Up the Impact
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The "industrialization" of cybercrime, remote-access attacks and mobile-banking application and online-browser overlay attacks are trends the financial industry should monitor this year, says George Tubin of IBM Security Trusteer.

episodes.title: More Hackers Relying on Compromised Credentials
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: More cybercriminals are adapting their attack techniques, using compromised credentials linked to privileged accounts to invade networks and systems, according to researchers at Dell SecureWorks, who describe an open source solution that can help mitigate the threat.

episodes.title: Bringing CIA Cybersecurity Experience to Congress
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Former intelligence operative Will Hurd brings his CIA values, including his belief in the benefits of sharing of threat information, to his job as chairman of a House subcommittee with information security oversight. Hurd addresses a number of cybersecurity matters in a wide-ranging interview.

episodes.title: Cloud Computing: The Security Concerns
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Attacks against the cloud, using the cloud for command and control of malware attacks, and securing endpoints are posing big worries for all industries, says Brian Kenyon of Blue Coat Systems.

episodes.title: Emerging ID Management Issues for 2016
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Identity management is going to be a big issue in 2016, and emerging authentication tools, such as biometrics, could very well gain a more significant foothold, although not without posing new risks, says Steve Martino, CISO at Cisco Systems.

episodes.title: Spotting Breaches by Studying Users
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Organizations can apply user behavioral analytics - the practice of reacting to how people behave in the information security realm - to better spot and block data breaches, says Fortscale's Kurt Stammberger.

episodes.title: Up Close: Verizon Data Breach Digest
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Unlike other security and breach reports, Verizon's Data Breach Digest is a collection of data breach investigation case studies from around the world. Verizon's Ashish Thapar elaborates on findings from this digest.

episodes.title: VA Gov. McAuliffe on Cybersecurity
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Virginia Gov. Terry McAuliffe has a message for state leaders across the nation: Cybersecurity has to be a top item on their policy platforms. And, by the way, he very much intends to make Virginia the cyber capital of the United States.

episodes.title: Apple Case Creates Important Policy Debate
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Apple's standoff with the U.S. government is creating a healthy debate about whether federal investigators, under certain circumstances, should have the right to circumvent the security functions of smartphones and other devices, says cybersecurity attorney Chris Pierson.

episodes.title: Why Traditional Defenses Will Never Work Again
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Webroot has just released its 2016 edition of its annual threat brief. In an exclusive interview, Michael Malloy, executive vice president of products and strategy, discusses the report and how its key findings will likely play out in the year ahead.

episodes.title: Advanced Threats: The Shift to Response
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Threat response is a lot like physical fitness. Enterprises know what they need to do - they often just opt not to do it. RSA's Rashmi Knowles offers advice for how to move from threat prevention to response.

episodes.title: Beyond PII & IP Theft: New Proactive Strategies for Stopping Damaging Breaches
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The big-name breaches have made us all sensitive to the loss of personal and competitive data. But are we overlooking the real risks? Shawn Henry of CrowdStrike offers insight on how we need to evolve our core defenses.

episodes.title: Could Blockchain Play Broader Role in Payments?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Blockchain technology used by bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies offers opportunities for enhanced authentication and ID management, as well as cross-border money remittances, says Ben Knieff of the consultancy Aite. But he contends it's not clear that the technology could play a role in faster payments.

episodes.title: CISOs Playing a Larger Role
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Because of growing cybersecurity concerns, CISOs in the financial sector finally are getting more time with their boards of directors and more direct interaction with senior executives, says John Carlson, chief of staff at the Financial Services Information Sharing and Analysis Center.

episodes.title: Study: Automated Info Sharing Improves Threat Response Time
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Automated threat intelligence sharing can significantly reduce the amount of time it takes organizations to identify, assess and react to attacks, according to new research from Johns Hopkins. Mark Clancy, CEO of Soltra, says automated information sharing with government and other sectors is catching on.

episodes.title: Cyber Insurance: A Buyers' Market?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Although relatively few carriers offer cyber insurance, buyers can negotiate favorable terms when purchasing policies, say Experian's Michael Bruemmer and NetDiligence's Mark Greisiger, who explain why in this interview.

episodes.title: Leveraging Security to Meet Compliance
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: PCI DSS 3.1 is scheduled to become effective as of June 30, 2016, and with that comes several changes - and challenges for security professionals. In an interview, Dell's Tim Brown discusses why network security is instrumental to ultimately meeting PCI DSS 3.1.

episodes.title: Terrorist Financing a Growing Worry for U.S. Banks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Growing worries about the use of the U.S. financial system to launder funds for terrorists has spurred proposals for new state and federal regulations aimed at tightening money-laundering controls. Attorney Lauren Resnick explains steps banks are taking to help detect suspicious activity.

episodes.title: Visualizing the Entire Attack Surface
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In the world of the extended enterprise, everybody seeks greater visibility into network activity. But Gidi Cohen was there in 2002, founding Skybox Security to provide analytics to improve cybersecurity. Cohen discusses the evolution of visibility.

episodes.title: Federal CISO Will Face Tough Challenges
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The White House has yet to announce who will be the government's first CISO, a position President Obama announced six weeks ago. In this audio report, experts weigh in on whether there's enough time left for the new information security leader to be effective before the president's term ends.

episodes.title: Case Study: A Community Bank Deploys Biometrics
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cambridge Savings Bank in Massachusetts is incorporating biometrics into its online and mobile banking platform as a way to limit, and in some cases remove, the need for username and password authentication. In this case study interview, two bank executives discuss what others can learn from the project.

episodes.title: CIO/CISO - Finding the Critical Balance
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In many enterprises, the CISO reports to the CIO, and occasionally you find a CIO who reports to the CISO. But Venafi's Tammy Moskites holds both roles. How does she manage the natural tension between IT and security?

episodes.title: UK's Hottest Banking Fraud Schemes
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cyber attackers are not just more sophisticated and more persistent than ever before. They also are greedier, says IBM Security's Limor Kessem, who shares insight on the latest fraud threats to UK banking institutions.

episodes.title: Legal Issues Persist as FBI Backs Off in iPhone Case
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Although the battle over whether the courts should compel Apple to help the FBI unlock the iPhone used by one of the San Bernardino shooters is on hold for now, the debate over the privacy issues involved isn't going away, says Greg Nojeim of the Center for Democracy and Technology.

episodes.title: The Case for Cloud-Based IAM
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: At a time when workers use more apps than ever to do their jobs - and from more locations and devices than ever - traditional IAM is simply not sufficient, says David Meyer of OneLogin. Cloud-Based IAM is what organizations truly need.

episodes.title: Report: IT Security Threat to Intensify in Next Two Years
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A new report, Threat Horizons 2018, from the Information Security Forum paints a fairly pessimistic picture of enterprises' ability to protect their IT from cybercriminals over the next two years. In an interview, ISF's Steve Durbin discusses what organizations can do to mitigate cyberthreats.

episodes.title: Reimagining API Creation
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: There is no such thing as "security by obscurity." Attackers can hack what they can't see. This means organizations must reimagine the fundamentals of API creation, says Jaime Ryan of CA Technologies.</

episodes.title: DDoS: It's Not Necessarily What You Think It Is
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Many organizations both misunderstand and underestimate the power and scale of today's DDoS attacks, says Darren Anstee of Arbor Networks. And these lapses may be negatively impacting enterprises' DDoS defense.

episodes.title: New Cybersecurity Task Force: Will It Make a Difference?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: David Finn, a former healthcare CIO, says he agreed to join a new Department of Health and Human Services cybersecurity task force because he supports its mission of involving representatives of all healthcare sectors in the effort to tackle challenges. In this interview, he outlines key security issues.

episodes.title: Creating a Framework for a Security-Privacy Dialogue
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A new coalition of leaders from government, industry and privacy advocacy groups hopes to help provide a framework for reaching a consensus on how to use IT to ensure society's security while protecting individuals' privacy, says Art Coviello, an organizer of the new Digital Equilibrium Project.

episodes.title: Ransomware: Healthcare Fights Back
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: MedStar is but the latest healthcare entity to fall victim to a ransomware attack. What can organizations do proactively to improve their ransomware defenses and response? PhishMe CEO Rohyt Belani offers insight.

episodes.title: Securing the Distributed Workforce
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Today's distributed enterprise faces two key challenges: Provide top-notch cybersecurity and ensure a seamless user experience. Paul Martini, CEO and co-founder of iboss Cybersecurity, discusses a new strategy designed to meet both goals.

episodes.title: Cyber Insurer Offers Ransomware Defense Insights
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: What steps can organizations take to help ensure they're not the next victim of a ransomware attack? Technology expert Craig Musgrave of The Doctors Company, which offers cyber insurance, identifies the top priorities.

episodes.title: EMV: Chargebacks Hitting Merchants of All Sizes
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: U.S. merchants of all sizes - not just smaller retailers - have seen significant increases in chargebacks in the wake of the Oct. 1, 2015, EMV fraud liability shift date, Liz Garner, vice president of the Merchant Advisory Group, contends in this in-depth interview.

episodes.title: The Global State of Threat Intelligence
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Only 23 percent of surveyed organizations can respond effectively to a cybersecurity incident. This is among the findings of Solutionary's fourth annual Global Threat Intelligence Report. Researcher Rob Kraus discusses the security gaps.

episodes.title: Internet of Things: Security Insights for Developers
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: "Internet of Things" developers must think about how attackers might attempt to exploit a device, and why, and then write code designed to block such attacks, says Charles Henderson, IBM's global head of security testing and threats.

episodes.title: InfoSec Career Advice for Women
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Denise Hayman, vice president at the security firm Neustar, offers in-depth advice to women interested in launching an information security career in this audio interview.

episodes.title: Important Lesson From Trade Secrets Case
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The most important lesson from the lawsuit electronic health records vendor Epic Systems filed against Tata Consultancy Services is that data security controls must extend beyond protecting personally identifiable information to include intellectual property, attorney Ron Raether explains in this audio report.

episodes.title: PCI-DSS Update: 5 New Requirements for Service Providers
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Five new payment card data security requirements for third-party service providers are among the most significant changes included in version 3.2 of the PCI Data Security Standard released April 28, says Troy Leach of the PCI Security Standards Council.

episodes.title: Verizon's Latest Breach Report: Same Attacks, More Damage
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The Verizon 2016 Data Breach Investigations report finds malware, ransomware and phishing attacks are more common than ever and creating even more damage. Organizations are continuing to get exploited via vulnerabilities that are months or even years old, forensics expert Laurance Dine explains in this interview.

episodes.title: Tackling Quantum Computing Threats to Cryptography
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Within the next 20 years, quantum computing could be applied to easily crack current approaches to cryptography, according to the National Institute of Standards and Technology, which already is beginning work on new approaches to encryption that can withstand the power of quantum computing.

episodes.title: Healthcare Taps the Power of Threat Intelligence
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Healthcare entities are increasingly in the crosshairs of attackers who seek to cause business disruption. How can threat intelligence bolster cybersecurity defenses? FireEye's Dan McWhorter offers insight and strategies.

episodes.title: Why Banks Need To Be More Proactive With Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The digital banking shift creates great convenience - for the fraudsters, as well as the customers. What can institutions do to reduce their vulnerability to breaches and fraud? Dave Allen of Bottomline Technologies offers advice.

episodes.title: How to Bake Security Into IT From the Start
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: NIST's Ron Ross, in an audio interview, explains new draft guidance that's designed to help technology vendors build secure components that their customers can use to build trustworthy information systems. Ross will be a keynoter at ISMG's Fraud and Breach Prevention Summit in Washington.

episodes.title: Internet of Things: Would New Regulations Help or Hurt?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Establishing new laws and regulations to address privacy and cybersecurity concerns related to the Internet of Things would likely be ineffective, attorney Steven Teppler, who co-chairs an American Bar Association IoT committee, says in an audio interview.

episodes.title: Barriers to Adopting Multifactor Authentication
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Many financial institutions struggle with implementing effective multifactor authentication solutions. They may lack confidence in new methods or grapple with the difficulty of integrating newer technologies with legacy investments. So, what technologies and processes need to be in place to ensure MFA's adoption throughout the financial sector? Crossmatch's Chris Trytten offers insight and strategies.

episodes.title: Beyond Vulnerability Management
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: With today's multi-layered attack surface, traditional vulnerability management no longer suffices. Security leaders must embrace a new strategy to help identify and secure true assets at risk. Gautam Aggarwal of Bay Dynamics explains how.

episodes.title: Preparing for Round 2 of HIPAA Audits
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The HHS Office of Civil Rights is gearing up for round two of HIPAA compliance audits. What should security leaders expect, and how should they prepare? David Holtzman of CynergisTek and Geoff Bibby of Zix offer insights and advice.

episodes.title: Information Security Forum's Durbin on Emerging Threats
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The emerging threats posed by cybercrime and evolving banking services, including mobile banking, will be among the focal points of a keynote address by the Information Security Forum's Steve Durbin at ISMG's Fraud & Breach Prevention Summit in Washington May 17-18.

episodes.title: Cyber Breach - What If Your Defenses Fail?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: It's one thing to talk or even plan about "What happens if we are breached?" It's quite another to undertake a true breach exercise. What are the critical elements of such a drill? Author Regina Phelps shares advice from her new book.

episodes.title: Ransomware: Re-Evaluating Our Defenses
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: There are two elements of a ransomware attack - the infection and then the action that takes place on infected devices. And both elements are evolving, says Ben Johnson of Carbon Black. He shares insight on how to improve ransomware defenses.

episodes.title: Blocking Hack Attacks: SWIFT Must Do More
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: With hack attacks continuing against banks, SWIFT must follow in the footsteps of other vendors - notably Microsoft - and begin offering detailed, prescriptive security guidance to its users, says Doug Gourlay of Skyport Systems.

episodes.title: Why Should Government Monitor Mobile Security?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In today's rapidly changing cyber threat environment, the federal government needs to take a lead role in making sure mobile device security is adequate, says security researcher Stephen Cobb, who analyzes ongoing investigations by the FTC and FCC in this audio interview.

episodes.title: Analysis: Walmart's EMV Lawsuit Against Visa
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Walmart's lawsuit against Visa, which claims the card brand is unfairly preventing retailers from requiring that customers enter PINs when they conduct EMV debit transactions, poses important questions about fair business practices, says Liz Garner of the Merchant Advisory Group.

episodes.title: ISMG Security Report: Unusual Twist in Ransomware
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Information Security Media Group is premiering the twice-weekly ISMG Security Report, a concise, on-demand audio report in which ISMG editors and other experts analyze the latest IT security news.

episodes.title: Data Protection: The Value of Masking
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Data today is money - especially in financial services, where account data is every hacker's target. How, then, can institutions mask that data and protect it when it's in non-production environments? Mike Logan of Delphix offers new insights.

episodes.title: Mandatory Breach Notifications: Europe's Countdown Begins
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Start preparing immediately for the EU's new General Data Protection Regulation - even though it doesn't go into force for two more years - because it mandates a number of new privacy and security requirements, warns cybersecurity expert Brian Honan.

episodes.title: Identity Management as a Business Enabler
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Identity and access management should empower businesses, satisfying customers and other stakeholders who need secure access to an enterprise's data and systems, says security expert Jeremy Grant, former leader at the federal government's National Strategy for Trusted Identities in Cyberspace.

episodes.title: ISMG Security Report: To Whom Should CISO Report?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The U.S. Congress delves into the issue of whether CISOs should report to CIOs, a topic that leads the Friday, May 27, 2016, edition of the ISMG Security Report, an on-demand audio report offered every Tuesday and Friday.

episodes.title: Ransomware - an Educated Response
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Stu Sjouwerman, CEO of KnowBe4, has seen first-hand the devastating impact of ransomware on healthcare entities. And he knows traditional defenses aren't enough to ward off attackers. What's needed is a whole new approach to user education.

episodes.title: Gartner's Litan Analyzes SWIFT-Related Bank Heists
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Financial fraud expert Avivah Litan, a Gartner analyst, says the SWIFT-related heists, which have defrauded banks out of millions of dollars in recent weeks, are not cause for "the sky is falling" alarm. She recommends key security steps to prevent further such incidents.

episodes.title: ISMG Security Report: Examining Global Breach Notification
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: ISMG editors, in a special report, examine the status of data breach notification laws in a number of regions, including the European Union, which this past week implemented the General Data Protection Regulation, although enforcement won't take place for two years.

episodes.title: Making Information Systems 'Trustable'
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Don't blame a lack of information security standards, security products or cybersecurity competence for the failure of breach defenses. In many cases, the culprit is design and implementation flaws in IT products, Robert Bigman, former CIO at the CIA, contends.

episodes.title: Recruiting CISOs: The Skills Now in Demand
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Executive recruiter Bill Liguori helps many organizations find CISOs. What skills are these companies looking for today? Find out in this in-depth interview.

episodes.title: Analyzing the Cybersecurity Framework's Value
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In this special edition of the ISMG Security Report, a panel of top cybersecurity thought leaders analyzes the value of the Obama administration's cybersecurity framework and its long-term impact.

episodes.title: The Backstory Behind the SWIFT-Related Thefts
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: This ISMG Security Report features a discussion of the impact on the global financial services industry of the SWIFT-related theft of $81 million from Bangladesh's central bank and similar thefts. You'll also hear reports on making IT systems more trustable and national governments' spending on cybersecurity.

episodes.title: NIST Plans  Cybersecurity Framework Update
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: NIST plans next year to clarify certain provisions in its cybersecurity framework. "Just to be clear, we're not headed toward a version 2.0 right now," Program Manager Matt Barrett explains in an interview. "We're headed to something that's more like a 1.1."

episodes.title: Simple Security: How Organizations Fumble the Basics
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Many organizations still fail to practice smart web security, warns penetration testing expert Ilia Kolochenko, who notes that 23 percent of all websites still use SSL version 3, despite it leaving them at risk from POODLE and BEAST attacks.

episodes.title: Report: Most Phishing Emails Pack Ransomware
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Cybercrime alert: In March, 93 percent of all phishing emails studied contained ransomware designed to forcibly encrypt PCs, says PhishMe chief operating officer Jim Hansen. In an interview, he offers insights on how to respond.

episodes.title: Audio Report: Updates on Infosec Europe, NIST Framework
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In the latest ISMG Security Report, our editors examine the top concerns of security practitioners gathered at Infosecurity Europe, NIST's planned revision of its cybersecurity framework and U.S. government efforts to make sure patients can securely access their electronic health records.

episodes.title: Tackling the D.C. Security Skills Crisis
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The scale of the global IT security skills crisis is well documented. But what is its direct impact on cybersecurity with the government agencies of Washington, D.C.? Dan Waddell of (ISC)² discusses the problem - and a new way to address it.

episodes.title: Retailers: Don't Require Us to Meet Bank Security Standards
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The Retail Industry Leaders Association is battling against passage of a national data security and breach notification bill known as the Data Security Act of 2015, arguing it would unreasonably require retailers to meet some of the same security standards as banks, says Austen Jensen, a RILA vice president.

episodes.title: Symantec's Latest Buy; Mobile App Woes
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In the latest ISMG Security Report, our editors analyze Symantec's pending purchase of Blue Coat; vulnerabilities in mobile banking apps; retailers' objections to a national data breach notification bill; and the relaunching of the IRS Get Transcript tool after a breach.

episodes.title: IBM Brings 'Watson' Supercomputer to Cybersecurity Fight
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: IBM is deploying its Watson supercomputer to help organizations answer this essential question: In the face of nonstop security events, potential intrusions and patches, what's the next, best action that an organization's security analyst should take?

episodes.title: Anatomy of a DDoS Attack
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: For years, organizations have been threatened by DDoS attacks on several fronts, ranging from volumetric attacks to application-level and DNS strikes. Now come ransom-based attacks. Trey Guinn of CloudFlare discusses how to respond to each type of attack.

episodes.title: 'Space Rogue' on Déjà Vu Security Failures
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: With rampant password, patch management and data missteps, it can feel like information security déjà vu all over again as security professionals fight so many of the same battles as 10 or 20 years ago, says white hat hacker Cris Thomas, a.k.a. "Space Rogue."

episodes.title: ABA: Retailers Should Meet Higher Cybersecurity Standards
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In an interview, Doug Johnson of the American Bankers Association explains why the ABA rejects the Retail Industry Leaders Association's contention that a legislative proposal to hold retailers to the same cybersecurity standards as banks is unfair.

episodes.title: Breach Aftermath Planning: Focus on Saving Your Business
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Crisis management expert Emily Mossburg discusses a new Deloitte study that shows why many organizations must reassess their approach to breach response to focus on what really matters: keeping the organization functioning.

episodes.title: Watergate and DNC Breach: Impact of 2 Types of Break-Ins
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The ISMG Security Report kicks off with thoughts on how Watergate - its 44th anniversary is today - would have turned out differently if today's technology existed in 1972. Also, you'll hear the backstory on the breach at Democratic Party headquarters revealed this past week.

episodes.title: How Will PCI-DSS Evolve in Next 10 Years?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: As the PCI Security Standards Council celebrates its 10th anniversary, Troy Leach, the council's chief technology offer, offers his assessment of how its Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard could evolve in the next 10 years.

episodes.title: Update: Ransomware, Digital Currency, Virtual Reality
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In this edition of the ISMG Security Report, you'll hear our editors explore how hackers use Java script for ransomware, the latest digital currency security issue and privacy threats posed by virtual reality.

episodes.title: The CASB Challenge: APIs or Proxies?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In recent months, Cloud Access Security Broker solutions have emerged as a defacto, mandatory control. Which is better approach to CASB - proxy or API? Rohit Gupta of Palerra shares his insight and recommendations.

episodes.title: No-Brainer Ransomware Defenses
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: With ransomware attacks surging, all organizations should ensure they have an enterprise backup and disaster recovery plan in place, and eliminate all unnecessary, outdated or disused applications and services running on endpoints and servers, says ESET's Mark James.

episodes.title: Roundup: Fraud Crackdown; Gov't Sensitive Info at Risk
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In this edition of the ISMG Security Report, you'll hear reports on the U.S. government nabbing healthcare fraudsters; federal agencies at risk of exposing highly sensitive data; and the hacking of brokerage accounts.

episodes.title: How NIST Framework Fosters Collaboration
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: One of the core values of the cybersecurity framework is to facilitate communication among various stakeholders coming from different technical and managerial backgrounds who must collaborate to build secure IT systems, NIST Program Manager Matt Barrett explains in an interview.

episodes.title: PCI-DSS: Building Global Acceptance
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Achieving international acceptance of PCI-DSS is an ongoing challenge, says Jeremy King, international director of the PCI Security Standards Council, who's working to educate merchants about baseline security that goes far beyond cardholder data protection.

episodes.title: Brexit Shocker, and Cybercrime Forum Sells Server Access
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Britain's surprise vote to "Brexit" the European Union leads the ISMG Security Report. Also hear analysis on a cybercrime forum selling remote server access; Comodo being in hot water by saying "let's encrypt"; and why Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg covers his webcam with tape.

episodes.title: Improving Fraud Prevention After SWIFT-Related Heists
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In the wake of recent SWIFT-related interbank payment heists, more banks are monitoring transactions for anomalous behavior in an attempt to catch fraud in real time, says Andrew Davies, a fraud prevention expert at core banking services provider Fiserv.

episodes.title: PCI-DSS: The Asian Journey to Compliance
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The need for PCI-DSS compliance is being embraced in Southeast Asia and the Middle East, with adoption of PCI standards increasing dramatically over the last five years, says Dharshan Shanthamurthy, CEO of SISA Information Security, who shares insights about why PCI adoption is likely to continue to grow.

episodes.title: Visa Acknowledges EMV Rollout Pain
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: So why is Visa temporarily reducing the fraud chargeback burden on non-EMV-compliant U.S. merchants? Mark Nelsen, Visa's senior vice president, says it boils down to this: The card brand wants to give retailers a break while it takes steps to streamline the cumbersome certification of new POS devices.

episodes.title: 'Dark Overlord' Deals Data, and Congress Tackles Crypto
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: The Dark Overlord selling stolen healthcare databases for bitcoins leads the ISMG Security Report. Also hear about banks' move toward real-time transaction fraud controls and a bipartisan attempt in Congress to tackle the ongoing crypto and "going dark" debates.

episodes.title: What 'Indicators of Exposure' Reveal
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: By tracking "Indicators of Exposure" - the top techniques attackers could use to hack into any individual enterprise - organizations can better defend themselves against network intrusions and data breaches, says Gidi Cohen, CEO of Skybox Security.

episodes.title: PCI-DSS Compliance: Are CEOs Buying In?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Ten years after the launch of the PCI Data Security Standards Council, the key to ensuring ongoing compliance with the PCI Data Security Standard is winning CEO buy-in worldwide, says Stephen Orfei, general manager of the council.

episodes.title: Ukraine Sees Bank Heist, Organizations Crave Deception
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Now a Ukraine bank has reported suffering a $10 million hacker heist via fraudulent SWIFT transfers. Also hear about why attackers often use legitimate IT administrator tools, and organizations' growing use of deception technologies and strategies.

episodes.title: Heartbleed Update: America the Vulnerable
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: More than 200,000 internet-connected systems remain vulnerable to the OpenSSL vulnerability known as Heartbleed, more than two years after the flaw was publicly announced and related patches released, warns security researcher Billy Rios.

episodes.title: Debating Hillary's Email Server: The Missing Element
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Missing from the analysis and debate regarding the U.S. government's decision not to prosecute presumptive Democratic Party presidential candidate Hillary Clinton for using a private email server while secretary of state is this simple fact: Secure IT systems aren't tailored to function the way people behave.

episodes.title: Anti-Virus Ruckus; Real Impact Over Hillary's Email Server
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: A bitter battle flares up in the fiercely competitive endpoint protection products market, and uncovering the real impact over Hillary Clinton's email server. These items highlight this edition of the ISMG Security Report.

episodes.title: Inside the Sony Breach
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Security vendor Novetta recently led an independent investigation into the 2014 Sony breach.  What lessons were learned, and how do they apply to today's threat landscape? Novetta's Peter LaMontagne shares key findings.

episodes.title: Mitigating 'Shadow IT' Risks
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In the wake of the Hillary Clinton email controversy, organizations need to be more aware of the risks of unsanctioned "shadow IT" and take appropriate mitigation steps, says security expert Mac McMillan.

episodes.title: Obama Sees Need to Improve Federal Government IT Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: In the wake of the controversy over Hillary Clinton's use of private email servers, President Obama voices his concerns about the state of federal government IT security in this edition of the ISMG Security Report.

episodes.title: U.K. Prime Minister Theresa May's Record on Cybersecurity
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: An analysis of the record of the U.K.'s new prime minister, Theresa May, on cybersecurity and online privacy and a report on efforts to create an antidote to ransomware highlight this edition of the ISMG Security Report.

episodes.title: FireEye on Extortion: To Pay or Not to Pay?
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: FireEye has dealt with more disruptive data breaches over just the past year than it has since the company was founded 12 years ago. Charles Carmakal, vice president with the company's Mandiant forensics unit, shares tips for handling a breach.

episodes.title: Top Cyber Expert on Rethinking Approach to IT Security
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Examining the human factor in the age of cyber conflict and the new healthcare challenge concerning ransomware highlight this edition of the ISMG Security Report. Also, hackers target the Republican convention.

episodes.title: A Roadmap for Integrating Cybersecurity
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: Too many organizations have too many disjointed security controls, says Vijay Bharti of Happiest Minds. What do they need? An integrated cybersecurity approach that includes analytics, machine learning and a higher degree of automation.

episodes.title: Upgrading Security: Setting the Right Priorities
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
episodes.summary: While enterprises rebuild or upgrade their security programs, they must guard against over emphasizing technology investments while neglecting staffing issues, says Ben Johnson, chief security strategist at Carbon Black.

episodes.title: Three Principles of an Effective Cybersecurity Strategy
episodes.author: BankInfoSecurity.com
